Sweden to Free Connected Minds in Beirut. From lectures in Harvard and
Yale to DOKU:TECH in Prizren.
Together with Ingo Petz I wrote a book about the events and my life as an activist. It has, in fact, been published in German by a large publisher. You can get it in German on Amazon, as an import in any bookstore or in my own shop. It has received great reviews in the media.
Now I want the whole world to know my story. That's why I want it to be translated into English.
There are publishers interested in bringing the book to the English speaking markets. They, however, fear the costs of a translation. I have regained the rights for a translation into English from my German Publisher.
I'm not afraid of the costs - because I have you! 

What you give and what you get:

If the campaign hits €3800 I will be able to pay for the translation.
The translation will be made by a professional translator - Anwen Roberts. You do not need to buy a pig in a poke - we already translated the first chapter and you can read it here. The cover layout of the book is designed by a friend of mine (Christopher of Chriss Cross Media) for a very cheap price. All people involved in this project get paid - because no one should work for free (except me). I have to pay for the perks on my own.

Atari Teenage Riot has written an exclusive Soundtrack for the book! ATR is going to release it for free after the campaign hit it’s goal as they just stated on their website.

€1500 Euros more - and I can not only pay for the perks but I can also
deliver a hardcover edition. Every Euro more helps to bring an even shinier edition to life.
All editions produced by this campaign are limited. They will not be produced like this afterwards. In fact, I have no idea what will happen after the campaign is done and the book is delivered.

After the money kicked in (Chances & Risks): I will deliver.  
It is hard to bring a book to life. It is even harder to get it translated in a proper way. With this campaign you can show that international publication of books in high quality on your own is doable without exploiting people working on it. I know the prices I have to pay are cheap - the people supporting me in this project do it because they do believe the same way as I do in this project.

If the goal is NOT reached I will find other sources to fund it. I am willing to sell my soul to bring this translation to life. It just will need a longer time to achieve.
By supporting this project you will help me tell this important story to
the world. You will also show that it is possible to independently
translate and publish a book.


    
You can help!

 Please let your english speaking community know about my project. Help
me spread it all over the interwebz. Tell your friends, family and
co-workers. Help me to reach out. Indiegogo provides a tool to help you
doing so.
There are Shirts, Hoodies and Zippers available - as they are not perkable for me, you can get them here.


    Reviews of the German book .NEUSTART Here are some reviews form German speaking sites:  The German television station ARD gave the book 5 out of 6 stars and put it onto the list of the 13 most important books of the Frankfurt Book Fair.
"'.REBOOT' is an uncontrolledly honest book telling about a life dealing with nothing and everything but actual dealing with one thing: to understand this world, change it and not collapsing doing so." (politik-digital.de)
"His (Urbach's) book is not another netphilosophical sorry effort which you read and take some nice ideas from and put in the shelf. His book is unperfected, emotional, lacks from emotional detachment. It deeply moves. Thanks." (Publikumsbeschimpfung)
"'.REBOOT" is an extraordinary intensive book, deeply moving and frightening at the same time showing that its worthwhile to commit to others and that there is no shame to admit your flaws." (Hanauer Bote)
7 Reviews on Amazon - all with 5 stars.

story:
Beginning in 1992, Godfrey Cheshire became the first American critic to write extensively about Iran’s post-revolutionary cinema. As that cinema rose to global prominence, Cheshire covered the story not only from New York and numerous international festivals, but also during several extended visits to Iran. His writings, which appeared in publications including the New York Times, Variety, Film Comment, Cineaste, Sight & Sound, Cinema Scope and the Village Voice, and for DVDs released by the Criterion Collection, First Run Features and Kino Lorber, established him as the leading authority on Iranian cinema among U.S. critics.

For Godfrey Cheshire, following Iranian filmmaking has not only entailed writing widely about it and studying its basis in Persian culture, but also an ongoing series of personal excursions and adventures. Cheshire was with Abbas Kiarostami when he won the Palme d’Or at Cannes and the Silver Lion at Venice. Kiarostami took Cheshire on a pilgrimage to the site of his “Koker Trilogy,” during a summer when the critic became the first U.S. journalist since the Iranian Revolution to rent an apartment and live in Tehran. When Godfrey wrote in the New York Times about director Dariush Mehjrui making a film from J.D. Salinger’s “Franny and Zooey,” and Salinger threatened to send marshals to Lincoln Center to seize the film, Cheshire and the film’s star, Niki Karimi, made public appeals to the author. After helping organize exchanges of U.S. and Iranian film artists, Godfrey accompanied director Michael Almereyda to Tehran, where the filmmaker unknowingly took photos of the site of a recent terrorist attack; the action got both Americans hauled to an Iranian police station, from which they were rescued by Iranian producers who were trying to stage Iran’s Oscars the very same night.

IN THE TIME OF KIAROSTAMI: WRITINGS ON IRANIAN CINEMA collects many of the pieces Cheshire has written over the years, along with new writings, to present a detailed, prismatic set of reflections on that cinema from its beginnings until now. 

 

Godfrey says, “Crowd-funding is a great way to launch a project like IN THE TIME OF KIAROSTAMI: WRITINGS ON IRANIAN CINEMA. A lot of people have become passionate fans of Iranian films, and some have followed my writings over the years. Our Indiegogo campaign will allow us to get to know many of those folks, and will allow them to help us create and release the book. It will be exciting to open this dialogue and to keep in touch with everyone once the book is out. I really appreciate all the interest many people have already shown, and I look forward to expanding the project’s circle of friends as we go forward.”

We’re very excited to invite you to join our campaign and a team that, besides Godfrey, includes editor Jim Colvill, design and social media director Miguel Gesso, and editorial/media assistant Tania Ahmadi, and, starting late June, campaign manager Sujewa Ekanayake.  The monies raised by the campaign will be used to fund editing and design; the remaining writing; assorted expenses including travel, research, translation;  as well as printing, publication and publicity. 

 

IN THE TIME OF KIAROSTAMI: WRITINGS ON IRANIAN CINEMA will be a sewn-bound hardcover that uses only the best quality printing and binding materials to create a handsome and durable edition.

The contents will include: “My Journey with Iranian Cinema,” Godfrey’s personal overview of his long involvement with Iran and its remarkable film culture; “First Encounter,” his ground-breaking 1993 Film Comment article that initiated his study of Iranian cinema; “Inside the Islamic Republic,” reports on several visits to Iran from 1997 to 2017; “The Backstory,” a history of Iranian cinema from 1900 till Close-Up; “Abbas Kiarostami, Cine-master,” detailed explorations of many of the films that made this director one of the most acclaimed in cinema history, as well as accounts of Godfrey’s interactions with him; “Directors and Films,” profiles and reviews of artists including Dariush Mehrjui, Mohsen Makhmalbaf, Jafar Panahi, Asghar Farhadi, Mohammad Rasoulof, Majid Majidi, Bahman Ghobadi and others; “Aspects of Iranian Cinema” reports and essays on topics including Ebrahim Golestan and The House Is Black; cinema pioneers Fereydoun Hoveyda and Farokh Ghaffary; the tradition of Iranian films about children, and others. And more.

This book will be not just an authoritative look at numerous important Iranian films and filmmakers but, additionally, a very personal odyssey of discovery and engagement. It’s also a project with wider implications than most film criticism. Godfrey says: “When I first encountered Iranian films, I was struck by the ethos of compassion and humanism at the center of many. These movies give us a much different picture of Iranians than the toxic, hostile image presented by the news media. I still think Iranian cinema not only can make Americans think about the lack of humane values in many of our films, but also can help create the kind of understanding needed to head off conflicts between Iran and the U.S. – a danger that right now seems all too real.”

 

We appreciate all contributions to the campaign of any size, and we hope you will let friends and family know about it. As you can see, we are offering an array of perks relating to Kiarostami, Iranian cinema and Godfrey’s work. More perks to be added as the campaign progresses!

*

story:
Story of My Book

Mission Impact - How Tomorrow's Students can create a Community Change through Entrepreneurship.

*The book was originally titled "Beyond a Bake Sale", as mentioned in the video*


My name is Emily Yuan and I am the author of Mission Impact. As a student, I was interested in business and wanted to do everything I could to get involved in the community, but didn't really know the best way to combine those two interests. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how to satisfy your entrepreneurial desire while creating a positive impact on the community. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for social entrepreneurship in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you come up with an idea for and successfully create a social venture. 

In this book, you'll learn about how to create and run a social venture through:

  • Finding inspiration for your business idea, and knowing which ideas are the most successful
  • Learning how to take advantage of opportunities given to you as a student
  • Knowing how to manage the finances of a start-up
You will love this book if you are someone who wants to create a difference in your community, but don't quite know how.

Mission Impact is a non-fiction book that speaks to both students and parents and teachers who are looking at entrepreneurship and creating a community impact for the first time.

 

The Book - Mission Impact

The book is written in three Parts....

Part [1] contains the introduction + additional chapters. Here, you will learn what social entrepreneurship is and if it is something that you will like to pursue. You will find stories from successful social entrepreneurs who have made Forbes 30 Under 30, as well as learn about Bill Drayton, the man who pioneered the industry.

Part [2] contains Chapters 5-8. There are a couple things that most successful people do that separates them from your average person – this section contains stories and advice from famous business people and entrepreneurs. Here, you'll learn habits and traits of successful social entrepreneurs. 

Part [3] contains Chapters 8-17. These give a step by step outline of how to create a social venture. The section will go through everything from how to build a great team culture to how to manage finances, how to run meetings, and finding a mentor. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this December 2019

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

 

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

I have always been passionate about business, but also about helping others. Recently, I found social entrepreneurship to be the perfect solution to merge these interests, and dove deeper into this idea through my book.

As a high school student, I was involved in both business competitions and started two nonprofits to help create a community impact. However, after attending an entrepreneurship camp, I realized the opportunities present in social entrepreneurship. After going through the college application process and meeting other students at Stanford, I've noticed that everyone seemed to have a common trait: they made an impact on their community. I hope to help others create an even bigger impact than I was able to make.

I'll be majoring in neuroscience, but will definitely be getting involved in the Silicon Valley start-up culture once I'm in college. I am happy to answer any questions you may have either about the book or just about me. For more information you can connect with Emily at emilyyuan96@gmail.com and @emilyyuan96 on Instagram.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #missionimpact and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Emily Yuan

We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Please use #missionimpact and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

story:
Story of My Book

Between Two Worlds is about a young Celtic girl captured and taken to Rome, where she is sold as a slave. The novel follows her quest for identity and journey to acceptance despite her unfortunate circumstances. 

My name is Cheyenne van Langevelde, and I wrote this book because I enjoy reading fiction set during the first century and wanted to write my own story, drawing inspiration from my favorite authors. 

I hope that, in reading this book, you will not only learn about life in Rome during the first century A.D., but you will discover, along with Enid, that your worth is not dependent upon circumstances or your past, but on what you hope and trust in. 

Enid, a young Celt, is overjoyed when the youth she admires tells her of his love for her. But her hopes and dreams are shattered when slave traders ambush them and sell Enid off as a slave in Rome. So she buries her past, struggling to survive in a world vastly different from her own. 

Illegitimate and rejected by society because of his British ancestry, Lucius is desperate to prove his worth as a Roman. He enlists in the army with hopes of gaining honor, only to lose everything in the process. 

Two different souls, one hopeful for change, one seething in bitterness, both caught between two worlds. When they collide, nothing will ever be the same. 

Yet Rome is hostile towards these outcasts of society, and Enid must learn to lose one identity in order to gain another, placing her faith and trust in the God of the Christiani if she and Lucius are to have any hope for a future together at all.

You will love this book if you enjoy historical fiction, especially those set in ancient cultures. This book is similar to classics such as The Eagle of the Ninth by Rosemary Sutcliff, The Bronze Bow by Elizabeth George Speare, The Spartan by Caroline Dale Snedeker, and A Voice in the Wind by Francine Rivers. 

 

What I Need and What You'll Get

This book will be self-published. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

~ The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.

~ The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

~ The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

~ The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

~ The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this coming spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

~ You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

~ Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

~ You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

~ You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

~ You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

~ And much more!

 

About the Author

Cheyenne van Langevelde is a young author and musician whose greatest passion is weaving tales through story and song. Drawing inspiration from authors such as Rosemary Sutcliff, Verity Buchanan, J.R.R. Tolkien, and Marcus Zuzak, she has written a number of stories in various genres. When not struggling with trying to create the most metaphorical prose, she enjoys composing and recording soundtrack pieces for books, practicing calligraphy and Irish dance, and studying the Welsh language. She occasionally emerges into the real world to restock her chocolate supply, of which she hordes like a dragon would his gold. Between Two Worlds is her debut novel, set in ancient Rome during the first century A.D. 

For more information, you can connect with Cheyenne at cheyenne@cornerstws.com, or follow her on Twitter and Instagram as dancing_bardess and thedancingbardess respectively.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. Shipping is included in the publishing goal raise for those in the United States. International shipping costs will be added accordingly. I will do my best to ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible and will keep you up-to-date as to when my book will be published. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram with your friends, family, and network. Please use #betweentwoworlds and tag me so I can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Cheyenne van Langevelde

This book is similar to classics such as The Eagle of the Ninth by Rosemary Sutcliff, The Bronze Bow by Elizabeth George Speare, The Spartan by Caroline Dale Snedeker, and A Voice in the Wind by Francine Rivers. 
 
What I Need and What You'll Get
This book will be self-published. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
~ The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
~ The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
~ The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
~ The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
~ The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this coming spring.
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
~ You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
~ Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
~ You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
~ You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
~ You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
~ And much more!
 
About the Author
Cheyenne van Langevelde is a young author and musician whose greatest passion is weaving tales through story and song. Drawing inspiration from authors such as Rosemary Sutcliff, Verity Buchanan, J.R.R. Tolkien, and Marcus Zuzak, she has written a number of stories in various genres. When not struggling with trying to create the most metaphorical prose, she enjoys composing and recording soundtrack pieces for books, practicing calligraphy and Irish dance, and studying the Welsh language. She occasionally emerges into the real world to restock her chocolate supply, of which she hordes like a dragon would his gold. Between Two Worlds is her debut novel, set in ancient Rome during the first century A.D. 
For more information, you can connect with Cheyenne at cheyenne@cornerstws.com, or follow her on Twitter and Instagram as dancing_bardess and thedancingbardess respectively.
 
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. Shipping is included in the publishing goal raise for those in the United States. International shipping costs will be added accordingly. I will do my best to ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible and will keep you up-to-date as to when my book will be published. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 
Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram with your friends, family, and network. Please use #betweentwoworlds and tag me so I can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.
Thank you so much for all of your love and support!Thanks again,Cheyenne van Langevelde

story:
Story of My Book

This Too Shall Pass is about making peace with pain and finding gratitude in adversity.

My name is Jet Mendes and I am the author of This Too Shall Pass. I’ve written this book out of respect for everyone who has made me who I am, and with the hope that the stories of my life may resonate with others. It’s a kind of thank you note to life, and a means to help provide light to the life of others. 

My hope is that this book will evoke a greater sense of trust in life, a desire to dive deeper in the self discovery process, a greater appreciation of the present moment, and a deeper sense of love. 

In this book, you'll learn about creating joy for ourselves and surrendering, allowing life to work with rather than against you. It includes stories such as:

Not becoming the college athlete I believed I was meant to be. (Self-Discovery)

My first meditation. (Awakening)

Finding peace while grieving the loss of my mother. (Inner Peace)


You will enjoy this book if you are at any kind of crossroad in your life, if you are overcoming any kind of adversity, if you wish to fill your life to the brim with love, and if you wish to find serenity in every discomfort. This book should be a kind of meditation, a therapeutic conversation.
 

The Book - This Too Shall Pass

The book is written in 2 Parts....

Part 1 contains the Introduction + Chapters 1-9. The first part of the book is a lot about coming to terms with surrendering, whether that be to the loss of my mother or the houses and the cars. It is the shocking recognition of the ego, as though placed under a surgical light, and the beginning of the egoic erosion process.

Part 2 contains Chapters 10-15. The second part of the book holds primary focus of life without the ego – the beauty of what life becomes when we choose to live without it.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2020

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Summer

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

 

About the Author

Jet Mendes is a student at the University of Southern California where he has been recognized for his outstanding merit in theatre. He is also an accomplished writer having won awards in creative writing for his work titled “Mother Knows Best.” 

Granted, most days I still feel like a four year old child running around tirelessly. And there are certainly times when I can act that way, but, like all of us, I do my best. I think it’s important that we do not sacrifice the heart’s immortal youth and playfulness no matter how serious life gets. I remind myself of that often. I’m still a mere student in this course of life, and there are certainly times when I forget to do the homework, times when I’ve forgotten to study for an exam, but that’s all just part of the game!

For more information you can connect with Jet at jetmend@gmail.com and IG: @Jetmendes

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ThisTooShallPass and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jet Mendes

story:
Overview

This is the publication/pre-sale campaign for my new novel, Summer of Smoke, an ensemble comedy set in Oregon's fire season. 

Summer of Smoke will be my fifth book. As always, I am seeking to publish independently so my books are funded by those who appreciate them most: their own audience.

This campaign will pre-sell the book and offer supplementary materials to fund the independent publication of Summer of Smoke. 

About the Book

As thick smoke from a nearby wildfire lingers in a small Oregon town, daily life begins to more closely resemble an apocalyptic sci-fi film than summer vacation and the locals all go a bit nuts. However, the Gilbert family just goes a bit more nuts than usual. 

The father, Greg, is so severely depressed over the toxic air quality and the loss of work that he barely gets out of bed, choosing instead to haunt online forums pushing conspiracies about why the fire hasn’t yet been extinguished. 

The mother, Lina, is plagued with guilt over the state of the environment and tries to drag her family to volunteer at various charities to alleviate her personal distress, but consistently ditches to smoke pot. 

Emma, the teen daughter freshly-returned from the ultra-liberal University of Oregon as an evangelistic vegan, becomes an eco-radical and spends her evenings in campaigns of petty sabotage directed at anyone over the age of 30 for their complicity in climate change.

And the teenage son, Shannon, finds literal escape by taking a job as trail guide to a man searching for Bigfoot in the mountains beyond the smoke’s reach, but finds that the constant trips in and out of the smoke begin to warp his sense of reality.

Each chapter is told from a different character’s POV, weaving multiple plot threads together as the Gilbert family unravels. They are each simultaneously at war with the weather, with each other, and with their fracturing senses of self and order to the universe. By summer's end, nothing will be the same. 

Why This Book Matters

Summer of Smoke was inspired by the brutal fires my hometown in Oregon endured in 2018. Businesses closed. Events were cancelled. No one left the house without smoke masks. Anyone who could afford it went out of town and lived in hotels. Every day looked and felt like the end of the world, and yet the world just kept on going about its business, leaving everyone to make their own sense out of it.

After about three months, the fires became national news. Not because the national media noticed our plight, but because the smoke turned south and hit San Francisco for a day. Suddenly, it was a major emergency. 

At first, I was angry that we had suffered for months without anyone noticing. Then I realized there was no reason they would. Rural Oregon is as close to nowhere as one can get in America. Its events and culture are not widely known or understood. I'd never read a book set in my hometown, or seen a film set there, or even one that took place in an Oregon that even remotely resembled the way I'd grown up. 

I decided that day to write this book to shine a light on the unique regional culture, and life during fire season in the age of climate change.  

Summer of Smoke captures the look and feel of an unusual culture in an unusual time, while addressing social anxiety over how unusual those conditions may be in our rapidly changing environment—but it wraps those themes up in a fast-paced comedy about a dysfunctional family and a coming of age story about looking for Bigfoot.

About the Author

My writing background includes fifteen years as an arts journalist for alt-weeklies, more than a dozen produced stage and screen plays (including several musicals that I also composed), and four books put out through small and independent presses.  I am the Writer in Residence for the rock and roll theater company Puppeteers for Fears, a regular contributor to Jefferson Public Radio, an editor for Blackstone Publishing, and the running champion of the Rogue Poetry Slam. 

What's been said about my previous books...

“Josh has a talent for creating an instant connection with a character and his or her story that, unfortunately seems to be rare in the world of writing today.”

-The Idaho Statesman

“The originality in his approach and his grip of humor writing knock the wind out of me.”

-Boulder Weekly

“[His] are the kind of soul-molesting stories that are difficult to forget, and would be a shame to miss out on.”

-LauraReviewsBooks.com

The Deets

What we need....

  • Money to pay the cover artist and graphic designer ($750-$1,500)
  • Money to pay a copy editor (approx. $625 by industry standards for page count)
  • Printing ($1,200ish depending on pre-orders)
  • Shipping ($400)
  • A marketing budget ($650)
  • An audio edition ($1,000-ish)
  • IndieGoGo fees: 5 percent
  • Enough left over for a pizza party at the end ($24.95 plus tip)

What you get...

  • This awesome book!
  • Being included in the thanks section!
  • Original interior art!
  • Bonus content!
  • A warm sense of doing good in the world by helping make this book happen!
  • Other stuff probably!

Ways You Can Help

Want to see Summer of Smoke get out into the world? Here's what to do. 

  • Buy a copy!
  • Heck, buy two copies!
  • Tell everyone you did that!

But seriously, this campaign will be primarily online. If it's something you're into, chances are your peeps will be as well. So let them know. Blast it on social media, your podcast, strap a speaker the roof of your car and drive around shouting about it like The Blues Brothers, whatever. Just get the word out. 

Broke as fudge? You can still help. 

  • Tell yo friends!
  • Tell yo mom!

Maybe one of them will score you a copy.

story:
Story of My Book

Quit Repeating Yourself outlines three key aspects of business: 1) Culture and Leadership, 2) Systems and Processes and 3) Recruiting and Hiring. In this book, I share how these aspects helped me create the sustainable growth and positive culture that built my business.

My name is Jaime Jay and I am the author of Quit Repeating Yourself. I wrote this book to show you, the aspiring or veteran business leader, how to have sustainable growth in your business by harnessing the power of your focus. I will explain how you can drastically change the speed and direction of your business by refocusing your actions; acting as if it was the last time you were going to do them and no longer doing the wrong things. This, in turn, allows you to focus on doing your best work.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for building a business. I interviewed over 1,000 business leaders and share with you what I learned from them as well as through my own experiences. This includes the importance of building a positive company culture through strong leadership skills, the need to put systems in place to provide a scalable business environment and the elements of effective recruiting and hiring strategies. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you become a better leader, build a sustainable company and find the right people for your organization.

In this book, you'll learn how to build a positive company culture through effective leadership skills and how to create systems based on your experiences. You'll also learn what I do in my own company to improve recruiting and hiring processes. You'll also hear key points, such as ...

  • Why culture is way more than a mission statement or words on a wall. It is how a company behaves and what informs every decision, action and reaction. Culture is the invisible hand, the true north that guides every organization, and if you build a legendary culture you will build a legendary company.
  • How starting, building and growing a business is very exciting. To be able to create something that never existed before is an incredible feeling. However, most ventures fail when the excitement wears off. Typically, they fail for one of two reasons - the leaders didn't focus on the problems or, more than likely, they lacked a business system.
  • And, how the hiring market today has become extremely competitive. Companies can no longer simply rely on posting job openings online. Thousands of companies are posting on the same digital job boards so there is no guarantee the right candidates will see a specific listing.

You will love this book if you your business can’t run without you, if you can’t seem to break the 7-figure mark, if you don’t have written processes for every aspect of your business and/or if you can’t seem to find the right employees.

Quit Repeating Yourself is a nonfiction book that speaks to entrepreneurs, business leaders and managers who want to look at building a sustainable business that runs itself and inspires its employees in a very new and different way.
 

The Book - Quit Repeating Yourself

The book is written in three parts.

Part 1 contains a forward from my good friend, #1 Apple podcast host and best-selling author, Christopher Lochhead, and is dedicated to positive culture and leadership. I will unpack the most powerful intangible, culture. I’ve spent several years interviewing hundreds of business men and women to learn why they were such great leaders and I’ll share with you why I believe building a positive culture begins at the top.

Part 2 contains chapters defining why systems, processes and workflows are so important and how to build your very own scalable foundation. Have you ever been asked a question by one of your employees that you knew the answer to and relayed it to them right away? Have you ever been upset by an employee asking you a question because they should already have known the answer? Have you ever had to answer the same question over and over again? How much time does this waste?

I get it. Sometimes your employees do not take the time to do their research, but can you prevent this? Whose fault is it, really. Could you be the bottleneck? Have you clearly defined the expectations for your team? Be real. You could have done better, right? I know I strive to be a better leader every single day.

When you feel frustrated by someone and hear that little evil fella pop up on your shoulder motivating you to think to yourself, “Come on. How do you not know that”? Chances are it is because you haven’t taken the time to document your thoughts and your company processes. Remember, there is only one YOU. That is why I believe so strongly that sharing information with your team will create a solid foundation for your business.

Part 3 reveals some very creative hiring and recruiting strategies I use in my company. After doing over 1,000 interviews since the early 2000s, I have learned a thing or two about what to look for when you recruiting and hiring new talent. Believe it or not, several years ago I was fired from a big corporate staffing agency because they said I wasn’t a good fit. They were right. I felt like a round peg trying to fit into a square hole. Have you ever felt like that? Our recruiting and hiring process is different and I really enjoy seeing our clients completely shift the way they live their lives after going through it. Now, I want to share these same strategies with you so you can feel the same way.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August of 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish later on this summer.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 205 copies of my book, I will publish an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Jaime Jay is the founder and managing director of Bottleneck Distant Assistants. Bottleneck Distant Assistants identifies, cultivates, and hires Dedicated Distant Assistants (DDAs) from the Philippines. Bottleneck appreciates the unique Filipino culture that is in line with their core beliefs. Bottleneck is also the original company to offer distant assistants, not virtual assistants.

Jaime wrote this book because many business professionals have approached him to learn what he was doing differently. After many interviews and conversations, he decided to open up the doors to his business and share his strategies and systems in the hope that readers will learn how to build a more sustainable business and, in turn, be able to live the life of their dreams.

In his spare time, Jaime enjoys playing hockey, camping, boating, playing guitar, shooting guns, traveling and spending time with his amazing wife, Sara. Jaime has been featured in Forbes, CBS, NBC, Springfield Business Journal, Shoutout LA Magazine, Fox, CW, Ask, Daily Herald, One-Person One-Million Dollar Business (the book), and more.

For more information, you can connect with Jaime Jay at info@bottleneck.online and all the major social media channels such as Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and check out their new YouTube channel called Bottleneck Television (BTV).
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #QuitRepeatingYourself and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jaime Jay
story_txt:
Story of My Book
Quit Repeating Yourself outlines three key aspects of business: 1) Culture and Leadership, 2) Systems and Processes and 3) Recruiting and Hiring. In this book, I share how these aspects helped me create the sustainable growth and positive culture that built my business.My name is Jaime Jay and I am the author of Quit Repeating Yourself. I wrote this book to show you, the aspiring or veteran business leader, how to have sustainable growth in your business by harnessing the power of your focus. I will explain how you can drastically change the speed and direction of your business by refocusing your actions; acting as if it was the last time you were going to do them and no longer doing the wrong things. This, in turn, allows you to focus on doing your best work.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for building a business. I interviewed over 1,000 business leaders and share with you what I learned from them as well as through my own experiences. This includes the importance of building a positive company culture through strong leadership skills, the need to put systems in place to provide a scalable business environment and the elements of effective recruiting and hiring strategies. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you become a better leader, build a sustainable company and find the right people for your organization.In this book, you'll learn how to build a positive company culture through effective leadership skills and how to create systems based on your experiences. You'll also learn what I do in my own company to improve recruiting and hiring processes. You'll also hear key points, such as ...

Why culture is way more than a mission statement or words on a wall. It is how a company behaves and what informs every decision, action and reaction. Culture is the invisible hand, the true north that guides every organization, and if you build a legendary culture you will build a legendary company.
How starting, building and growing a business is very exciting. To be able to create something that never existed before is an incredible feeling. However, most ventures fail when the excitement wears off. Typically, they fail for one of two reasons - the leaders didn't focus on the problems or, more than likely, they lacked a business system.
And, how the hiring market today has become extremely competitive. Companies can no longer simply rely on posting job openings online. Thousands of companies are posting on the same digital job boards so there is no guarantee the right candidates will see a specific listing.

You will love this book if you your business can’t run without you, if you can’t seem to break the 7-figure mark, if you don’t have written processes for every aspect of your business and/or if you can’t seem to find the right employees.Quit Repeating Yourself is a nonfiction book that speaks to entrepreneurs, business leaders and managers who want to look at building a sustainable business that runs itself and inspires its employees in a very new and different way. 
The Book - Quit Repeating Yourself
The book is written in three parts.Part 1 contains a forward from my good friend, #1 Apple podcast host and best-selling author, Christopher Lochhead, and is dedicated to positive culture and leadership. I will unpack the most powerful intangible, culture. I’ve spent several years interviewing hundreds of business men and women to learn why they were such great leaders and I’ll share with you why I believe building a positive culture begins at the top.Part 2 contains chapters defining why systems, processes and workflows are so important and how to build your very own scalable foundation. Have you ever been asked a question by one of your employees that you knew the answer to and relayed it to them right away? Have you ever been upset by an employee asking you a question because they should already have known the answer? Have you ever had to answer the same question over and over again? How much time does this waste?I get it. Sometimes your employees do not take the time to do their research, but can you prevent this? Whose fault is it, really. Could you be the bottleneck? Have you clearly defined the expectations for your team? Be real. You could have done better, right? I know I strive to be a better leader every single day.When you feel frustrated by someone and hear that little evil fella pop up on your shoulder motivating you to think to yourself, “Come on. How do you not know that”? Chances are it is because you haven’t taken the time to document your thoughts and your company processes. Remember, there is only one YOU. That is why I believe so strongly that sharing information with your team will create a solid foundation for your business.Part 3 reveals some very creative hiring and recruiting strategies I use in my company. After doing over 1,000 interviews since the early 2000s, I have learned a thing or two about what to look for when you recruiting and hiring new talent. Believe it or not, several years ago I was fired from a big corporate staffing agency because they said I wasn’t a good fit. They were right. I felt like a round peg trying to fit into a square hole. Have you ever felt like that? Our recruiting and hiring process is different and I really enjoy seeing our clients completely shift the way they live their lives after going through it. Now, I want to share these same strategies with you so you can feel the same way.
What I Need & What You'll Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August of 2021.
The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish later on this summer.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 205 copies of my book, I will publish an audiobook.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more! About the AuthorJaime Jay is the founder and managing director of Bottleneck Distant Assistants. Bottleneck Distant Assistants identifies, cultivates, and hires Dedicated Distant Assistants (DDAs) from the Philippines. Bottleneck appreciates the unique Filipino culture that is in line with their core beliefs. Bottleneck is also the original company to offer distant assistants, not virtual assistants.Jaime wrote this book because many business professionals have approached him to learn what he was doing differently. After many interviews and conversations, he decided to open up the doors to his business and share his strategies and systems in the hope that readers will learn how to build a more sustainable business and, in turn, be able to live the life of their dreams.In his spare time, Jaime enjoys playing hockey, camping, boating, playing guitar, shooting guns, traveling and spending time with his amazing wife, Sara. Jaime has been featured in Forbes, CBS, NBC, Springfield Business Journal, Shoutout LA Magazine, Fox, CW, Ask, Daily Herald, One-Person One-Million Dollar Business (the book), and more.For more information, you can connect with Jaime Jay at info@bottleneck.online and all the major social media channels such as Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and check out their new YouTube channel called Bottleneck Television (BTV). International Preorders For international preorders, please send me a private message. Risks & Challenges The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship. Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #QuitRepeatingYourself and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Jaime Jay

story:
"Life is a journey of hurting and healing, just as the sun rises and falls every day. But the sun will always rise again."

Story of My Book

Before 18: A Journey of Living, Loving, Hurting, and Healing is a poetry collection that focuses on the process of hurting and healing from mental trauma. The poems have an underlying theme of nature and its impact on life. 

My name is Niharika Ghosh and I am the author of Before 18: A Journey of Living, Loving, Hurting, and Healing. I wrote this book because I went through a lot of personal struggles in my last year before adulthood, hence the name “Before 18." Writing poetry was my way of coping with my strong emotions, and I wanted to share these poems and my journey with the world.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will have an emotional reaction and feel personally connected to the poems. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to reflect upon yourself and your experiences, and if you have shared in these feelings before, to embrace that. Everyone has gone through mental challenges and conflict of some kind, which often leave a lasting mental impact. It is important for all of us to learn how to confront uncomfortable feelings and learn self love and compassion so that we may heal. Healing is a painful, messy process, but it is possible, so I want to leave you with a sense of hope as you close the last page.

In this book, you’ll join me in exploring mental health, trauma, and recovery and discovering the power of healing through poems like: 

“Waterfall” — a poem about overwhelming sadness and years of pain cascading in an emotional waterfall.

“Dancing Flames” — a poem describing the unpredictable and volatile nature of fire, a metaphor for the passion within ourselves.

“Healing” — an inspiring poem to provide hope that healing from pain is possible and there is light in the future.

You will love this book if you enjoy reading emotional poetry, have dealt with mental health issues, or want to focus on learning how to heal from the past. Most importantly, you will love this book if you have ever been a teenager yourself, because everyone shares the rollercoaster journey of ups and downs during these transformative years. 

Before 18 speaks to teenagers and young adults who want to grapple with mental struggles and healing in a new way. However, any person, regardless of their current stage in life, will be able to relate to one or more of the themes and emotions shared in my poems.

Ultimately, I hope that Before 18 inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions such as:

  • How can I confront and heal from my own trauma?
  • How can I have a stronger emotional understanding of my loved ones?
  • How does do these themes relate to the larger mental health crisis in society?

 

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing trauma, pain, and healing will change us all for the better. 

 

The Book 

Before 18 is written in 5 parts:

Part I: Nature - These poems focus on the beauty of nature and its power to energize and empower the mind. These poems will draw you into the tranquility and peacefulness of nature around us, and provide an escape from the chaos of daily life.

Part II: Childhood - This section explores the themes of growing up and leaving childhood behind, as one emerges into the turbulent state between childhood and adulthood.

Part III: Hurting - These poems focus on the experiences of mental health issues, trauma and facing difficult challenges including self-image, depression and anxiety, and substance abuse.

Part IV: The Dark Side of Loving - This section explores young love and the heartbreak, pain, and suffering that comes along with it. These poems explore the passionate and volatile nature of one’s first love.

Part V: Healing - These poems offer a message of inspiration about healing from the past. By exploring self-compassion and growth, these poems empower the reader to grow from their experiences and look towards the future with hope.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

 

When I pre-sell 120 paperback copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Niharika Ghosh is a prospective undergraduate student who wrote her first book during her senior year of high school. 

Niharika wrote this book because writing poetry is one of her many passions, and publishing a book has always been one of her lifelong dreams. These poems were written and inspired by her own experiences before she turned 18 and officially became an adult, so she hopes that her words will be able to touch the hearts of her readers and have an emotional impact on them. 

Known as “Niha” by her friends, she is an avid singer, pianist, actress, and painter who loves to engage in anything artistic or musical in her free time. Niharika has been a perfectionist and chronic procrastinator her whole life, so it is a miracle that she was able to complete this book. If she’s not stressing about some task that she needs to get done the day before a deadline, you can find her planning the next project to add to her already overflowing plate.

For more information, you can connect with Niharika at niharikaghosh524@gmail.com and at Facebook, Instagram @nihaghosh24, and LinkedIn. You can also check out her Instagram poetry account @poemsbyniha and show support!

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Before18 and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!!

Thanks again,
Niharika Ghosh :)
