story:
Short Summary

My name is Tim Sutton.  I am an author and a screenprint and stained glass artist. In collaboration with the Mormon Artists Group, I created a memoir/art piece that we launched this past April (2015) called Me and Thad.  

The project began as a memoir about my brother Thad, who was born with a rare and life-threatening birth defect. Very early on, I realized that because of the nature of his condition, Thad's life was simple, but his story is found in the lives of everyone who knew him. I discovered that the best way for me to tell Thad's story was to explore my own life, my own struggles with feelings of being inexplicably different from what I was supposed to be, and my own journey toward understanding and acceptance of myself, of my family and of the world at large, while acknowledging how deeply Thad's presence in my life helped me along the way.

I am a gay man with a Mormon background, but this story is more than a typical "coming out" tale. It is the story of my family whose deeply held spiritual and religious convictions helped us make sense of a devastating reality when Thad was born. Hope, love, and faith pulled us together and set the stage for a deep and meaningful family life. Still, though that foundation did not circumvent the sometimes painful challenges that arose when I began to mature and explore the doubts and feelings that had perplexed me for most of my youth, it did create an environment that encouraged trust, communication, forgiveness, and growth.  

The journey, my journey, was not only towards accepting my sexuality, but even more toward understanding and accepting those who were having a hard time understanding me--for however long they needed. Through this whole process, I learned that the truth of every story is as big as everyone involved. Though I could not write from everyone's perspective, I did my best to honor the fact that they had one. This is a personal, sometimes serious, often funny, story about family, tireless parents, faith, trust, service, and love. 

The goal of the Mormon Artists Group when they approached me about this idea was to create 24 gorgeous, signed, hand-bound limited edition volumes that they could make available to their collectors. These collector's editions included 6 original screenprint illustrations and endpapers that I created bound into the book. I also created one stained glass version of each illustration which were paired with six of the books. 

Once the collector's editions were complete, and mostly sold, we made a paperback version and a kindle version available on amazon.com. From the beginning, that was where our collaboration would end. Any marketing or efforts to get the word out regarding the paperback and electronic versions were my responsibility. I started by creating an iBooks version as well for iPad readers, and I've been doing my best to use social media and whatever other means at my disposal to gradually move outward through friends/family, their friends/family and so on. 

I've had quite a few people ask me if I am going to make an audio version of the book. There are many people who don't read books, but who will listen to them--commuters, tread-millers, you name it. My grandfather lost his sight in the latter part of his life, and books on tape were a real blessing for him. In writing and publishing a book, it seems to me that the process, now, in our technologically-driven world is not complete until all of the bases are covered: hard copy, electronic versions, audio version (and that is in the first language.)  I am confident that by creating an audiobook version, I will expand my audience even more. 

This is where you come in. I need your help to make this happen.     


What We Need & What You Get

There are two parts to this audiobook:  

The first part, obviously, is recording the book itself, which I will be doing at The Sound Distillery here in Manhattan. They are excited about the project and they have been very helpful with suggestions and direction. I could not have asked for a more positive collaboration. Our budget for this part of the process is $4,000

The second part of this process involves arranging and recording two songs that I wrote while I was a missionary in southern Spain. Both songs are incorporated into the text of the book, and I feel it would be best to include the actual songs, rather than simply reading the lyrics. I am very lucky to be working with Matthew Dean Marsh to make these recordings possible. Our budget for this part of the process is $2,000

So, our total budget for this project is $6,000.  I will be covering any incidental expenses like coaching, consulting, or anything else that I determine along the way will make the end product the best and highest quality I am capable of producing.

We have 30 days from the launch to reach our goal of $6,000. If we don't quite make it, I will be incredibly grateful for whatever amount we do achieve. Then, I will regroup and figure out how to make up the difference. This project will go forward. If we exceed our goal, any additional funds will be used toward translating the text into Spanish and Portuguese, since I know that I already have an audience waiting who speaks those languages.

We have some fun perks in a wide range of dollar amounts.  These are all items that I have created (in the case of the film 'extraordinary measures,' my brother Travis made the film, I helped him as a producer/consultant/cheerleader) and I hope they will make it more exciting and worthwhile to donate!

$25 (+ shipping)
"Me and Thad" tote bag
hand printed by Tim Sutton

20"x16"x4" Jumbo Natural Cotton Canvas Tote Bag
10 oz heavy natural 100% cotton canvas tote bag with 4" bottom gusset and 24" handles. 

$25 (+ shipping)

extraordinary measures DVD
In 2006, Travis Sutton made this compelling documentary about Thad. He created the narrative based on interviews he did with members of the family. During the course of production, our father had a heart attack which resulted in a brain injury, so Travis documented our father's progress from "if he survives" to "he's doing well, but we're not sure he will ever recover his memory." Travis paralleled the two stories to create a very personal and multi-faceted film. Premiered at the 2007 San Francisco DocFest.

$50 USD (+shipping)

Brooklyn Bridge at Night

Signed and numbered (10) limited edition print by Tim Sutton.
Artwork is 8" x 8" with a 1.5" border.

$50 USD (+shipping)
Bethesda Fountain at Night
Signed and numbered (10) limited edition print by Tim Sutton.
Artwork is 8" x 8" with a 1.5" border.

$50 USD (+ shipping)
Game Night in Provo
Whenever there is a home football game at BYU, the large "Y" on the mountain is lit up for everyone in the valley to see.
Signed and numbered (10) limited edition print by Tim Sutton.
Artwork is 8" x 8" with a 1.5" border.

$50 USD (+ shipping)
Lotus

Signed and numbered (10) limited edition print by Tim Sutton.  
Artwork is 8" x 8" with a 1-inch border.

This print uses multiple layers of color with varying transparencies to create the look of stained glass. It is a technique that Tim worked with while he was creating the illustrations for "Me and Thad."


$100 USD (+shipping)

Shakespeare Print

Signed and numbered limited edition print by Tim Sutton.  I created this 13"x15.5" print of Shakespeare using the "To be or not to be" monologue from the first folio edition. I did the original script work with a quill and ink, then created a template to print it using a blend of colors.

I printed on 160gsm Italian-made Pergamenata Parchment, which is as close as you can get to the real deal of aged parchment. It is a translucent, neutral pH paper, with the crisp snap, mottled look and hard feel you would expect from an actual sheet of animal parchment.

$150 USD (+shipping)

The Little Red Lighthouse Print

Signed and numbered limited edition print by Tim Sutton.

"The Little Red Lighthouse" stands on the shore  on the Manhattan side of the Hudson River below the George Washington Bridge. This print uses multiple layers of color with varying transparencies to create the look of stained glass. It is a technique that Tim worked with while he was creating the illustrations for Me and Thad.

This is a computer  rendering.  As soon as I print them, I will post an actual photo.


$150 USD (+ shipping)

Broadway/NYC 2015 Art

I created this design to celebrate Broadway and New York City. It is printed on the back of a 15" x 6" plexiglass sheet and mounted to hang on the wall. This image is a computer rendering. As soon as I print them, I will post an actual photo.


$350 USD (+shipping)

Signed Limited Edition of "Me and Thad"

One of the last three signed and numbered limited editions of Me and Thad. It is a gorgeous 12.25" x 12.25" x 1" volume, handbound over boards in silk, in a slipcase with six original screenprints and endpapers bound into the book.


$500 USD (+ shipping)

Black and White Baroque Glass with Clear Architectural Accent

I found this beautiful Baroque glass with gorgeous large black and white swirls. I was intrigued by the idea of creating a piece that contrasted the free flowing movement of the baroque glass with the hard lines of a clear architectural glass with raised parallel lines. This is a companion piece to the White baroque Glass with Clear Architectural Accent, but can also be a stand-alone piece.

In the black wood frame,this piece measures 29.5" x 23" and has 3 eye screws to assist in hanging.

$500 USD (+ shipping)
White Baroque Glass with Clear Architectural Accent
I found this beautiful Baroque glass with gorgeous white swirls in a clear glass. I was intrigued by the idea of creating a piece that contrasted the free flowing movement of the baroque glass with the hard lines of a clear architectural glass with raised parallel lines. This is a companion piece to the Black and White Baroque Glass with clear Architectural accent, but can be stand alone.
In the black wood frame,this piece measures 29.5" x 23" and has 3 eye screws to assist in hanging.

$800 USD 
Stained Glass Cross

I created this design for a dear friend of mine whose Christian faith informs everything that she does.  She is kind and generous and a true example of faith in action.

It measures 12.5" x 15.5". I will make up to 4 additional pieces based on this design specifically for this campaign.


The Impact

"Me and Thad" contributes a valuable point of view in the current discussion of religious freedom and social equality. If love is truly at the core of our intent, understanding is possible, even when belief systems are in conflict. It requires an effort on everyone's part and the process is not always easy, but the end result is worth it. 


Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that life as it is, not everyone will be able to contribute. That is totally fine!  There are other ways you can help if you like!

  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to share my campaign with your friends, colleagues, millionaires, lottery winners, NPR, Oprah, Ellen Degeneres, Stephen Colbert, etc.
  • If you've read the book already, please write a review on Amazon or iTunes. Reviews help immensely to personalize the book reading experience for people who don't know anything about it. The subject matter, at first glance, appears daunting and serious. If you've read it, you know that there are some serious, even painful, parts, but my intent was to create an overall feeling of hope and happiness. I believe that I succeeded. As the author, I can say this till I am blue in the face, but it doesn't have the same impact as it does when someone else shares how the book affected them. 
  • If you are a friend on Facebook or in other social media, please share my posts with your friends. Perhaps one or twelve or fifty of them will be intrigued. Liking is great, sharing opens doors. 
  • Continue being the amazing people that you are and make the world a better place every day.
story_txt:
Short Summary My name is Tim Sutton.  I am an author and a screenprint and stained glass artist. In collaboration with the Mormon Artists Group, I created a memoir/art piece that we launched this past April (2015) called Me and Thad.  
The project began as a memoir about my brother Thad, who was born with a rare and life-threatening birth defect. Very early on, I realized that because of the nature of his condition, Thad's life was simple, but his story is found in the lives of everyone who knew him. I discovered that the best way for me to tell Thad's story was to explore my own life, my own struggles with feelings of being inexplicably different from what I was supposed to be, and my own journey toward understanding and acceptance of myself, of my family and of the world at large, while acknowledging how deeply Thad's presence in my life helped me along the way.
I am a gay man with a Mormon background, but this story is more than a typical "coming out" tale. It is the story of my family whose deeply held spiritual and religious convictions helped us make sense of a devastating reality when Thad was born. Hope, love, and faith pulled us together and set the stage for a deep and meaningful family life. Still, though that foundation did not circumvent the sometimes painful challenges that arose when I began to mature and explore the doubts and feelings that had perplexed me for most of my youth, it did create an environment that encouraged trust, communication, forgiveness, and growth.  
The journey, my journey, was not only towards accepting my sexuality, but even more toward understanding and accepting those who were having a hard time understanding me--for however long they needed. Through this whole process, I learned that the truth of every story is as big as everyone involved. Though I could not write from everyone's perspective, I did my best to honor the fact that they had one. This is a personal, sometimes serious, often funny, story about family, tireless parents, faith, trust, service, and love. 
The goal of the Mormon Artists Group when they approached me about this idea was to create 24 gorgeous, signed, hand-bound limited edition volumes that they could make available to their collectors. These collector's editions included 6 original screenprint illustrations and endpapers that I created bound into the book. I also created one stained glass version of each illustration which were paired with six of the books. 
Once the collector's editions were complete, and mostly sold, we made a paperback version and a kindle version available on amazon.com. From the beginning, that was where our collaboration would end. Any marketing or efforts to get the word out regarding the paperback and electronic versions were my responsibility. I started by creating an iBooks version as well for iPad readers, and I've been doing my best to use social media and whatever other means at my disposal to gradually move outward through friends/family, their friends/family and so on. 
I've had quite a few people ask me if I am going to make an audio version of the book. There are many people who don't read books, but who will listen to them--commuters, tread-millers, you name it. My grandfather lost his sight in the latter part of his life, and books on tape were a real blessing for him. In writing and publishing a book, it seems to me that the process, now, in our technologically-driven world is not complete until all of the bases are covered: hard copy, electronic versions, audio version (and that is in the first language.)  I am confident that by creating an audiobook version, I will expand my audience even more. 
This is where you come in. I need your help to make this happen.     
   What We Need & What You Get
There are two parts to this audiobook:  

The first part, obviously, is recording the book itself, which I will be doing at The Sound Distillery here in Manhattan. They are excited about the project and they have been very helpful with suggestions and direction. I could not have asked for a more positive collaboration. Our budget for this part of the process is $4,000

The second part of this process involves arranging and recording two songs that I wrote while I was a missionary in southern Spain. Both songs are incorporated into the text of the book, and I feel it would be best to include the actual songs, rather than simply reading the lyrics. I am very lucky to be working with Matthew Dean Marsh to make these recordings possible. Our budget for this part of the process is $2,000

So, our total budget for this project is $6,000.  I will be covering any incidental expenses like coaching, consulting, or anything else that I determine along the way will make the end product the best and highest quality I am capable of producing.

We have 30 days from the launch to reach our goal of $6,000. If we don't quite make it, I will be incredibly grateful for whatever amount we do achieve. Then, I will regroup and figure out how to make up the difference. This project will go forward. If we exceed our goal, any additional funds will be used toward translating the text into Spanish and Portuguese, since I know that I already have an audience waiting who speaks those languages.

We have some fun perks in a wide range of dollar amounts.  These are all items that I have created (in the case of the film 'extraordinary measures,' my brother Travis made the film, I helped him as a producer/consultant/cheerleader) and I hope they will make it more exciting and worthwhile to donate!
 


$25 (+ shipping)

"Me and Thad" tote bag hand printed by Tim Sutton


20"x16"x4" Jumbo Natural Cotton Canvas Tote Bag10 oz heavy natural 100% cotton canvas tote bag with 4" bottom gusset and 24" handles. 

$25 (+ shipping)

extraordinary measures DVD
In 2006, Travis Sutton made this compelling documentary about Thad. He created the narrative based on interviews he did with members of the family. During the course of production, our father had a heart attack which resulted in a brain injury, so Travis documented our father's progress from "if he survives" to "he's doing well, but we're not sure he will ever recover his memory." Travis paralleled the two stories to create a very personal and multi-faceted film. Premiered at the 2007 San Francisco DocFest.



$50 USD (+shipping)

$50 USD (+shipping)

story:
The Backstory...
 

My name is Ahmed Sirour.

Years ago, I dropped out of undergrad from my university where I was studying marketing, because I felt I wasn't really learning what I needed and tried my luck in the job force. I ended up at a bank and became a bank teller, but because of a few marketing/promotional internships I had while in school, I actually managed to impress the marketing director of the bank (on a chance encounter at the bank HQs) and got promoted right into the marketing department of that bank and made good money–without even needing the degree!

But I discovered I wasn't fulfilled.

During that time, I was also teaching myself how to play the piano/keyboard by ear (since I've loved music all my life) because I found I actually had a talent for it. After while, I then decided to leave Corporate America and take my savings and a big leap of faith to see if my hobby and passion could turn into me becoming an actual professional musician.

And I actually achieved that!

During those years as an up-and-coming musician, I achieved quite a lot more for someone who was a self-starter with no contacts in the beginning, including even scoring my own weekly jam session at a hot cafe in the city, with my own band, and a packed house each night we played, but after a while became disillusioned with the cut-throat/cookie-cutter music scene there and wondered if I should travel to other cities around the country and see where other opportunities might be. I had no idea that the Universe would choose that time to cross my path with a beautiful student doing a summer program in town before heading back to her state, and then a mere few days later after that would leave the country for a study abroad program in North Africa. I had no idea that our growing romance would be the catalyst for what would become my own solo world travels. Like the famous book, The Alchemist, I saw myself on an amazing journey to discover what and where my "treasures" were...and interestingly it actually began (just like the book) with my standing in the actual Sahara desert, overlooking endless sand dunes, wondering where next the adventure would take me.

A year later, after my ex and I broke up, I left the country for a 3-week excursion to the UK...and then the adventure really took off! Somehow, I managed to get accepted into a Masters degree program at a prestigious university in London with NO PREVIOUS Bachelors degree, and from that point forward, I would end up spending significant time in or actually living in various cities/countries around the world, and eventually visited every continent on Earth (except Antarctica...for now).

But let me not get ahead of myself, because there's a LOT being left out (thus the need for this BOOK), and even more amazing stories that cover the last 10 years of my life (2006-2016) criss-crossing the planet. And the thing is, even though I'm a musician, the vast majority of my travels had nothing to do with a tour or concert, and many times I had very little to practically NOTHING in my pockets, while in the middle of some country where English was not the native language (sometimes not even anyone nearby who spoke it). And to be from the proverbial hood–if anyone knows anything about Brownsville, Brooklyn, you get what  I mean–but then find myself in places I had only read about or seen in movies, or public television travel series, or in pictures I saw in National Geographic magazines–so many moments when I had to pinch myself to believe I was where I was!

Throughout it all, it was also filled with many challenges, dangerous close calls, crazy scenarios but also miracles, blessings, hilarious moments, deeply introspective revelations, close friendships made, numerous life lessons and experiences had, and...well...that's why I'm writing a book, so lemme chill before I do that here!

So many people who have been following my travels (whether via my Facebook music page to just my friends who keep up with me on social media) have said I need to write a book with all the stories I've accumulated and have shared with them, so I truly hope these same people (and you who are reading this and hearing about me for the first time) will also support this project that I am finally embarking on! And with that, here's the campaign breakdown...
 

 

What I Need & What You Get (the Tran$parency part)
 

Well, I need money to get this book completed (properly and professionally) and then you and the rest of the world get to reap the benefits of it by getting a copy of the finished product and more! I've gone over the numbers from various sources online of professionals who recommended the best budget and decided to base my needs off of the following website: http://mediashift.org/2013/05/the-real-costs-of-self-publishing-book/. I have chosen the lower end of the scale for the majority of their budget recommendations, so here is what you will be contributing to as follows:

  • Developmental editing (content structure/fluidity)- $2,520
  • Copyediting (proofreading) - $840
  • Cover design - Low end: $150 (to get a professional to properly render my mockup)
  • Formatting for print and digital conversion - Free ;-)
  • Getting an ISBN (International Standard Book Number) - $125 for one ISBN
  • U.S. Copyright fee - $35
  • Distribution: FREE! (i.e. Amazon, Barnes and Noble, Apple iBooks, etc.)
  • Cost of review from Publishers Weekly PW Select - $150
  • Marketing & PR - $1,000
  • Travel (for book launch) - $865
  • Crowdfunding fees (5%) + Credit Card fees (3%) = 454.80
    TOTAL: $6,140


 

Risks & Challenges (aka Leaps of Faiths and Opportunities)

The only risk I've faced in approaching this book is the amount of time I've waited until I finally decided to bring it into existence, and the only real challenge is getting out of my own way and make it happen. My legacy-building has been through music, thus far, and I'm blessed to have received messages from others about how my work has moved, inspired, or helped them, which means the world to me! And now I have this opportunity to use my talents in the written word, combined with my unique life experiences and perspective, to offer this time capsule of words and photos (also videos and music in the e-book version) of an unusual journey that is rich with stories, travel insight, and hopefully an overall inspirational theme that can positively affect and change the lives of any who read it, around the world, and for generations to come; this is the intention and desire for this book! You see, my resolve is that whether I reach or exceed my financial goal for this campaign or come up shorter than what I was shooting for, THIS BOOK WILL MUST GET PUBLISHED...one way or another! I believe this is something I was born to do, just as I realize now that I was supposed to become a musician! I will find a way, or make one, even if some of the things I listed I have to figure out and do on my own if push comes to shove, BUT I will also deliver a book...and a quality one at that!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if some of you are unable to contribute financially (I've been there many a time as an artist, a student–hell, as a human lol), by taking a brief moment to share with others by word-of-mouth, or by email, or by social media, or by bartering your skills I could use in possibly an exchange for an advance copy or name credit, by effectively sharing this crowdfunder, you are donating your valuable time which always counts just as a financial donation does. I am writing this book to help people and I need people to help me accomplish this goal. This book will weave together experiences that are culmination of people who I encountered, who changed my life, and who are an important part of why I have a story to tell the world.


Oh, and One Last Thing...

If this book is like my life movie/biopic, and I happen to be a music artist, then there HAS to be a SOUNDTRACK for it, right? ;-)

story: My Name is Kayla Burrows. I am a twenty year old woman, born and raised in Calgary, Alberta.  I am absolutely honoured to have been selected by Miss Canada Globe Productions, to participate in the National Pageant, staged in Toronto, Ontario, August of 2015,  as a Miss Canada Petite National Finalist. It is my hope that I may prove to be a positive role model for women around the globe. I wish to inspire confidence, integrity, and true inner beauty through my actions and example  each and every day. As a delegate, entry and pageant expenses including transportation, administrative fees, wardrobe, etc. are a reality. Obtaining pledges, and sponsorships to offset these costs are immensely appreciated. Businesses or individuals can write-off donations or sponsorships with a tax receipt provided by MCG Productions for all funds issued over $50 .  Please support me in my endeavour to represent Canada in 2015. If selected I will go on to participate in the 2015 International Pageant.  I am very excited to have this opportunity, and it is my hope to make you all proud!
story_txt: My Name is Kayla Burrows. I am a twenty year old woman, born and raised in Calgary, Alberta.  I am absolutely honoured to have been selected by Miss Canada Globe Productions, to participate in the National Pageant, staged in Toronto, Ontario, August of 2015,  as a Miss Canada Petite National Finalist. It is my hope that I may prove to be a positive role model for women around the globe. I wish to inspire confidence, integrity, and true inner beauty through my actions and example  each and every day. As a delegate, entry and pageant expenses including transportation, administrative fees, wardrobe, etc. are a reality. Obtaining pledges, and sponsorships to offset these costs are immensely appreciated. Businesses or individuals can write-off donations or sponsorships with a tax receipt provided by MCG Productions for all funds issued over $50 .  Please support me in my endeavour to represent Canada in 2015. If selected I will go on to participate in the 2015 International Pageant.  I am very excited to have this opportunity, and it is my hope to make you all proud!

story:
I am a former Muslim, renounced Islam in 1973 and turned to atheistic humanism. Born and brought up in Jummu & Kashmir, the state of India in an orthodox Sunni Muslim family, my parental name was Mohammad Ashfaq Hussain. In 1997, I changed my name to Yang Burz Home.

I am writing under pen name M.A.Hussain. I am an independent researcher, writer, a self-taught cultural anthropologist, a political satirist and a blogger. One of my draft research papers on Islam can be accessed at this link: http://www.academia.edu/1813187/Non_Theologicentric_view_of_islam.

 I have a manuscript, titled "From Islam to Womanism, My spiritual Journey"  approximately 90000 words and containing 200 pages. The manuscript is complete and  ready for publishing.

The book is the result of my two years of rigorous study.  When most of the women see the world through man’s prism under the influence of male consciousness my contemplation led me to see the world through woman’s eyes. My musings feminized my epistemology and cognition, it fascinated me. I ventured beyond atheism to love as my new religion. Now I can see the world through woman’s eyes. It is what I call “Womanism”.

 The book is my spiritual journey from Islam to Womanism. It is thought provoking,  pro-woman, humanistic, scholarly, a piece of a creative and critical thinking that will interest general readers as well as academia, the political left and the right, and all those who are interested in Islam. It is not merely about why I renounced Islam, it is also how I became an atheist; why I did not convert to any other religion, what led me to new spirituality, Womanism, the pinnacle of humanism, and what are its theoretical and philosophical foundations.  It may be deemed to be an atheist invitation to more than one billion Muslims to renounce Islam, and a guide to become an atheist.

The book is worth to be given as a gift to Christian converts to Islam and Muslims aspiring to be atheists. It is better than others on the market, as it is a true story and is consistently scholarly book.  I have adopted Non Theologicentric approach in  understanding Islam and treated Islam as RIA(Repressive Ideological Apparatus).

I tried my level best to get it published by a mainstream publisher but they are not  willing to publish the book because of criminalization of criticism of Islam and even scholarly criticism is not tolerated. I am determined to get it published. I have decided to self-publish the book but I do not have funds for the same and need $ 5000 for editorial, printing and publishing services. If you think that such a book should  be published, please donate. If you cannot donate, please spread the word, let the like minded people know about it.

story:
Je m’appelle Laurence Beaudry-Lafrenière, j’ai 21 ans, étudiante à l’université McGill en travail social, je serai bachelière au printemps prochain. Grande sportive, j’ai toujours aimé me dépasser dans des activités physiques de tout genre, je carbure aux entraînements, aux compétitions, au dépassement de soi. Depuis mes tout débuts en planche à neige, à l’âge de 8 ans, les sorties sur les pistes m’apportaient un sentiment d’ivresse incomparable. À l’époque, je rêvais de sauts et de vitesse, éléments que l’on retrouvait séparément, mais non simultanément dans les types de disciplines populaires (slalom et half pipe), le snowboard cross ne faisant que ses débuts. Je m’impliquai donc dans d’autres sports, rêvant d’un jour secrètement pouvoir percer en snowboard d’une quelconque façon.

En 2006, lors des Olympiques d’hiver, je vis pour la première fois la discipline de snowboard cross. Je me suis alors promis d’un jour y tenter ma chance. Ce n’est qu’à l’hiver 2011-2012, après être allée au bout de ma première passion, le volleyball, que je tint enfin ma promesse et troquai mes cuissards pour ma planche à neige.

Aussitôt, j’ai eu la piqûre pour ce sport, qui combine vitesse et sauts. À ma première saison, nonobstant mes études à temps plein, mon travail à temps partiel et mon statut d’entraîneur d’une équipe de volleyball, je réussis à bien performer aux deux compétitions Coupe Québec auxquelles j’ai participées, gagnant notamment la deuxième. Suite à cela, j’ai été sélectionné sur l’équipe du Québec de développement. Conséquemment à cette sélection, j’ai pris la décision de m’impliquer dorénavant à temps plein à la pratique de ce sport.

Toutefois, vu les coûts importants qu’engendrent la pratique du snowboardcross, je me dois de continuer à travailler à temps partiel tout en complétant mes études. Mon statut sur l’équipe du Québec me demandant de participer à des camps d’entraînements et des compétitions à l’intérieure et à l’extérieure de la province (notamment un camp d’entraînement au Colorado en novembre et le Championnat Canadien en Colombie-Britannique), en plus des entraînements réguliers sur neige et en gymnase, les frais deviennent alors très élevés. Étant nouvellement athlète sur le circuit de snowboard cross, je ne reçois aucune subvention gouvernementale et ne reçois l’aide d’aucun commanditaire. Je dois donc défrayer à moi seule l’ensemble des frais entourant la pratique de ma nouvelle passion.

Tous vos dons, quel que soit le montant, m’aideront grandement à payer les dépenses reliées à l’équipement (planche à neige, cire, etc.), aux courses(déplacements, hébergements, inscriptions, frais d’entraîneurs), ainsi qu’aux entraînements sur neige et en gymnase. Je vous demande donc votre support pour pouvoir me permettre de tout mettre en place afin d’atteindre un rêve de jeune fille, soit éventuellement devenir membre de l’équipe nationale de snowboard cross et qui sait, peut-être un jour, pouvoir participer à la plus prestigieuse compétition mondiale; les Olympiques!

Merci pour votre soutien!

Très cordialement,

Laurence Beaudry-Lafrenière

story:
My name is Josie Thompson. What's my story?  I'm just a good ol’ spunky 24 year old Mormon girl from Mesa Arizona, trying to keep up with everyone around me. Yet there is one major setback that sure separates me from most… Bi-polar.

I am currently a patron of the 'somewhere after high school/before marriage' chapter of life, yet I tell a very different story than most my age.  I have struggled with mental illness for almost 5 years, and with that, has accompanied a pervasive darkness so thick, that most days, any type of avail feels impossible.  Time and time again I have watched hope slip from my fingers as I have jumped around from treatment to treatment, medication to medication, “answer” to “answer”.  

-I have seen over 19 different medical professionals

-I have tried over 26 different medications

-I have been administered 12 treatments of electric shock therapy

-I have lost a full-ride academic Scholarship

-I have received a mission call for my church, yet was considered ineligible to serve just days before my departure date

-I broke off an engagement

-I am unable to work

…just to name a few of course :)

However… I decided early on that not only was I going to triumph over this disheveled life-hand, but more importantly, I was going to help others in the process.  I was pretty closet about all this Bi-polar jazz because I didn’t want to be known as “that” girl. I certainly feared society’s misconceptions pertaining to mental illness. Yet I now dream that by opening up about everything perhaps one day, not only will I mend from this, but along the way I might help someone through their own adversity. It has been through my writing that I have provided (or at least strived to provide) that secondary aide to others.  Through my writing I share with a very raw candor, my struggles, obstacles, heartache, but most importantly, my Hope.  A hope that I believe is powerful enough to offer light to others no matter WHAT their opposition may be.

And it was through the dual facet of writing and desire to help another that The 444 Project was born. (444 being significant because of our family scripture Alma 44:4... and in honor of my great aunt and hero, Aunt Joyce)

The 444 Project idea evolved last fall, after I wrote my first initial Bi-polar post (here); a post that told the uncensored story of my personal bout with Depression/Bi-polar.  I had been writing a blog for awhile, but that particular post was the first real integral post I had ever published regarding my personal Bi-polar bout… I had finally decided that I am who I am, and I wanted to put it all out there for anyone and everyone to read.  I was terrified of what feedback would return my way, and at the time, had NO idea just what was to come… much to my surprise, hundred’s of emails came swarming in from friends family, and strangers alike, telling me about THEIR personal bouts and struggles.  I learned very VERY quickly, that I am not alone… and in the process, my desire to want to help others, only strengthened.  Then not soon after, one of my best friends challenged me to take that desire one step further- she suggested that I go out and really do something about it.

So while responding to my inner drive to help others, yet still catering to what limitations currently beset me, with the help of friends and family, we created The 444 Project.  A project designed to give hope to all, and help me prove that 1) Everyone has a story to tell, 2) There is goodness everywhere, and 3) There is always a reason to get out of bed each day.  A project that once completed, I would turn into a book.  

I left the last week in March 2013 on The 444 Project and have now been out over 3 months, as I have sought to collect 444 answers to my ultimate question: what gets YOU out of bed each day? During the project I have been living out of my car, drifting from one town to the next, all while interviewing perfect strangers.  I ask them about their lives asking them one final question:  What gets you out of bed each day?  And then as regularly as circumstances allow, I report back to my blog… josiethompson.com  

However, I have now just about reached my quota of 444 interviews, which means I am now ready to return home and begin phase 2 of The 444 Project; the writing of the book.  I have met some amazing people along the way and have had some of the most exciting yet difficult experiences of my life and I want to share these with everyone.  The 444 Project book will be a culmination of all of my experiences from the past three months... but most important, it will contain my personal collection of thoughts, ideas and lessons acquired because of those same experiences.  It will be a book that tells the story of a Bi-polar girl transforming an impossible dream, into a possible journey.   

The past 3 months have been difficult, scary, adventurous, dangerous, exhilarating and much, much more... but ALWAYS, has it been worth it.  And I want to write a book to tell why. 

I invite all of you to join alongside me for the newest phase of this journey, as I near the end of the travels and begin the writing of The 444 Project Book. It is my personal conviction that this project has a divine purpose and possesses absolute potential to change lives- I have already observed it happen.   And even though many precious personal sacrifices have been required to advance this far, never have I ONCE questioned nor doubted the endeavor... that is how much promise lies within The 444 Project.  I have believed in this project charge since its birth... and now it is time to officially write the book that tells the tale and allows me to explain why.  But I need YOUR help to do it.  Help me be that girl I aspire to be. Help me be the girl that brings light to others through my own darkness. Help me change the world.

Love 444ever,

Josie Thompson

story:
Imagine a Peaceful, Just and Thriving World

We have a message to share with you and the world - a message we believe can transform our planet and humanity for the better (yeah, we know this sounds grandiose, but it's true). In our book, Conspiracy of Dreamers: Capitalism at the Service of Humanity, we describe how we can align the awesome power of capitalism with the best of human nature - compassion, love, justice, community. Join us and we will make it happen together. 

In order to launch Conspiracy of Dreamers - and, far more importantly, the ideas in the book -  we need a serious PR campaign. We invite you to help in three ways: 

1. Contribute 

All of the funds we raise will be used to spread the message that the future of our planet depends on forcing capitalism to evolve. (This is a philanthropic project - no contributions go to the authors as royalties or otherwise.)  

2. Give a Copy of Conspiracy of Dreamers to Someone 

We need to get this book into the hands of "movers and shakers" - people who can help make this dream a reality in a powerful way. So, this is the idea: when you contribute, you'll get a copy, or copies, of Conspiracy of Dreamers (see the "perks" for details). Keep one to read yourself, and give (that is, have us send) a copy to the people you know (or know of) who you believe can help make the dream happen, either personally, or by passing the book to someone else (hopefully after they've read it :)  

3. Share Our Project on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, at Church/Temple/Mosque/Ashram, in Your Dorm, at Work, at the Gym … 

In trying to get this message of hope and transformation to go viral we have to compete with a never-ending deluge of cute cat videos – we need all the help we can get. Evolution happens through communication (an idea we explore in the book). Be an agent of conscious human evolution by posting, sharing, liking, talking about Conspiracy of Dreamers. 

Who We Are

M. Renée Orth practiced business litigation after receiving her J.D. from Berkeley in 1999. She graduated summa cum laude with a B.A. in Political Science from U.C.L.A. She put her legal career on hold to devote herself full-time to writing Conspiracy of Dreamers.

After earning an M.B.A. from Stanford University, Paul J. Behrman was a private equity investor for over a decade, a partner in two firms. He played football for the University of Texas where he graduated summa cum laude with a B.B.A. in Business. Today, he is the Chief Executive Officer of SkillBet.com. 

We consider our lack of academic expertise in economics and sociology an asset: “In the beginner's mind there are many possibilities, in the expert's mind there are few,” explained Shunryu Suzuki in Zen Mind, Beginner's Mind. If you want the future to look a lot like the past, then expertise is essential; if you want to create a future far better than the past, then expertise is overrated. What we bring to the table is a strong foundation in logic and reasoning, a thorough understanding of finance and business, creativity, curiosity, passion and optimism.

We thank you for taking the time to consider our project and we hope you choose to join us and put capitalism at the service of humanity.

We thank you for taking the time to consider our project and we hope you choose to join us and put capitalism at the service of humanity.

story:
"I shall act in a way that gives love to the world, 

and demands hope for all people.

So that even on a bad news day,

there shall always be a good news story."  

Kyla McMullin, Cancer Survivor

Summary

Warrior is a memoir of inspiration, courage, and hope.  

It is my goal to give cancer survivors, and their supporters,  an inspirational look into my journey, and a deeper look into themselves.

My name is Kyla McMullin. 

On February 24th, 2011, three days after the birth of my daughter, I was diagnosed with Stage IIIA Hodgkin’s Lymphoma.  That day changed my life, and the life of my family, forever.  

Receiving a diagnosis of cancer is difficult.  Like so many others, after experiencing cancer, I felt compelled to give back. 

Warrior allows me the opportunity to share my story, and to continue to provide hope, and inspiration, to cancer survivors and their supporters.

Funding Need

During my treatment, I "journalled" my feelings in a blog.  

In order to turn these blog entries into a book,  here is the breakdown of what I need the funding for, in order to achieve this undertaking:

  • Editing/Technical Writing services $2800.00 (self-funded)
  • Book Design $2300.00 (self-funded)
  • Printing Services $3000.00-$5000.00
  • Marketing/Launch of Warrior $500.00-$1000.00
  • Web Support/Design $2000.00-$3000.00

I have decided to self-publish Warrior, and I have already dedicated my own funds towards the editing and technical writing of my book, but there is still more work to be done.

In addition, because I am an actively involved with the Leukemia & Lymphoma Society of Canada, twenty percent of any funds raised over 7000.00$ during this campaign, will be donated to this cause, supporting Tally's Roses (my team) - Light the Night Campaign - as we support this event that continues to fund the research that saves lives.

Watch - Kyla McMullin 2012 Honoured Hero Video here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nFxb7Dt7e9o

A Sneak Peak - An Entry from Warrior

Let me share an entry with you.  

I hope that it will allow for you some insight of all the souls, present and future, who have been touched by cancer.

May 10th, 2011 

I am in this. And as I move forward into the unknown, I wish for those of you to understand what it truly feels like to be one of the many, chosen for this journey. 

To understand what it is like to have cancer. To have been in a place where you have been given the news that your life has been threatened. An incomprehensible moment.

I attempt to explain it to the world, as I try to explain it to myself.

Every day of your life has prepared you for this moment. As if all of your experiences were practice to determine how you were about to handle the news that you, yes YOU, have been chosen for this journey.

You will be afraid. You will not worry so much about the well-being of yourself, rather you will take on the pain of the suffering your loved ones feel, as they watch you climb over mountains. Oh the mountains you will climb.

You will have pain. You will have such incredible pain that you will have to mentally remove yourself from the situation, almost as if you are no longer in your physical body, like you are watching from the sidelines.

You will have humiliation. You will have every piece of your body poked, prodded, looked at, in, and on. 

And you will lose your hair. But this is the uniform you will need to wear when you are in this army.

You will learn sacrifice. You will have to give up the most important moments in your life so that you can fight, so that you can survive, in an attempt to regain some of these very moments that were taken from you.

You will fight. You will fight every single day of your life, to be damn sure that in the end, you are standing on top of the bully, screaming at the top of your lungs, your incredible victory. And YOU did it. Yes YOU did it!

You will cry. You will cry for your family, your friends, your husband, your daughter. You will cry for your loss of control, the fear of the unknown, and the great hurt that you will experience. 

You will suffer great disappointment. You will find out who your friends are. Your circle will change. You will be saddened at some of the losses, but you will honour their choices.

You will sleep less. You will struggle to close your eyes at night, for the fear of missing a moment, or not getting the gift of tomorrow.

You will question your faith. You will wonder, you will search. You will look for your purpose, your reason, your being. But you will find out. 

You will laugh more. You will gain the ability to find humour in every situation. The opportunity to laugh at the things that hurt the most.

You will believe in second chances. A time to forgive, and forget. To move on, and to try again.  

You will love. And boy, you will LOVE. A love that you have never known before. The kind of love that guides your heart and clouds your brain. You will Love. You will Love. You will Love.

You will find beauty, in every instance, each moment you are offered. You will smile at the sunshine, the snow, the rain, the streams, the rivers, the mountains. You will appreciate the universal paintbrush, like you have never seen it before, and you may never see it again.

You will count your blessings every single day of your life. You will honour those who are less fortunate, who may not have the strength to move on. And you will never forget them.

You will be blindsided by the good in the world. Even when you may be surrounded by drama, gossip, and bad news. You will be overwhelmed by the good in the people. All of the people.

You will learn to live again. But you will live in a way that you never thought possible. A way where you strive to be better, to be good, to love. You will really live.

Lastly, you will accept this burden as the brilliant opportunity it is. The chance to find the strength in yourself that you never knew you had. 

And you will hope. You will always hope. You must always hope. And you will fight. You will always fight. You must always fight.

And if that bully chooses to show itself again.  

You will win. You will win.

Love, Kyla

Perks And Recognition

Each contribution comes with different reward levels, but every contribution will receive a heart felt thank you, and public recognition.  Thank you!

    The Impact

     A warrior.

    A warrior is defined as any person who shows or has shown great courage.

    My final treatment was September 19th, 2011. 

    It is strange how quickly life changes. In just a breath, the world you thought you knew is taken away, and you are given a new look at life. With new priorities, and new reasons. 

    At the time that I was diagnosed, I was overcome with emotion.  Not knowing of the journey that I had yet to face.  And as I held my new born baby in my arms, I did not know if I truly had tomorrow.  And if I did, what that would like for me.

    It was in that moment when hope was defined for me.

    And hope is the reason why I share my story.

    Because for me, hope is not just a feeling.  Hope is a purpose.  

    Hope is what remains when everything else has been torn away.

    Hope is knowing that there are forces at work in the universe that extend way beyond what is in our control.  Hope is knowing when to trust in those forces, and hope is knowing when to defy them.

    Hope is knowing that even the hardest days shall turn to night.

    Hope is trusting that a smile can last forever.  

    And hope is believing that yes, time can stand still.

    Thank you for your support so that Warrior can offer hope to cancer survivors and their supporters.

      Other Ways That You Can Help

      I have one wish. I wish that by sharing my journey, we all become motivated to pay it forward with whatever means we are able.  And at the same time, we become inspired to receive.  To receive the blessings that come at the most difficult times.   And to receive the gifts that are handed to us in each precious moment.

      And that despite what we may be handed in our life, now or yet to come, that we are able to acknowledge the blessings in each circumstance, no matter how grand, no matter how dim.  

      To truly live for the moment, to welcome our future, to accept our past, and to smile as we remember all of our days past.

      I understand that not everyone is in a position to contribute financially, but you can still help.  

      Please share this campaign through social media, and help Warrior make its way in the hands of the people affected by cancer.  Help me to spread the word and to share my story.  Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Trudy Metzger. Born in Mexico, and raised in a Mennonite home and community--in a setting perceived as idyllic and peaceful to 'the outside'--our home was anything but... We feared daily for our lives, and suffered much violence, sexual abuse and death threats, in a deeply religious environment. We moved to Canada the year I turned six, in hopes of a better life. And, in some ways, it was. But the violence continued. To escape, I left home at fifteen. Just before my eighteenth birthday I was engaged, and about to marry into a world of drugs and violence in a satanic environment, when one inconvenient moment became my miracle, and changed my life forever. Today I work with victims of sexual abuse, doing conferences as well as one-on-one coaching/mentor sessions, to offer hope to those who are trapped in silence and shame.

I have written a memoir of my childhood and teen years, and have recently been offered a contract to publish the book in English. (The working title is "A Secret Sin" but may well be renamed by the Publisher.) We are raising funds to translate the memoir into Low German and to cover professional editorial work (including rewrite) that needs to be done, but is not included in the Publisher's contract. Low German--my first language--has only become a written language in recent years, and the process is long and tedious, but the need is great. (To understand the need in only one area of the world, visit this update on the horrific Ghost Rapes of Bolivia where most women cannot read or write English.)

The book gives victims of abuse permission to speak up, and break the shame surrounding abuse, and even the tragic choices we often make as a result, and offers hope. It will appeal to victims in religious settings, as well as those wanting to understand both sides of the Mennonite community--the beauty and the abuse. We anticipate reaching thousands of victims, breaking the silence of sexual abuse, and helping to end this violence against innocent children.

What We Need & What You Get

Professional Editor Review & Report: $2000
Coaching/Support for Rewrite: $6000 - $10,000
Translation to Low German Fee: $19,000
German Editing/Review Fee:  $8000 - $12,000

If our entire goal is not met, the project will proceed through the first two phases. Remaining funds will be donated to Generations Unleashed, a registered Canadian Charity that works with abuse victims and offers conferences internationally to create awareness and offer help to victims. 

The Impact

Sexual abuse is shockingly prevalent in religious settings, but tragically victims are often not believed, or are afraid to speak out because of the belief that 'it doesn't happen here'.  It is time to acknowledge it is a universal problem, and the solution lies in speaking up--not in hate and vengeance--but with authority and forgiveness, while holding the guilty accountable to the law. By telling my story I hope to give men and women across the world permission to speak up, and release the guilt, shame and loneliness, and band together for the next generation. 

With a team of people, I have been leading conferences and doing speaking engagements, offering healing and hope for sexual abuse victims, in both secular and Christian environments since 2010. I've heard (and read) literally hundreds--probably thousands--of men and women share their stories of struggling through and overcoming abuse. And I have been honoured to help many work through that trauma. The support from men, women and businesses in funding these events has been touching, and is a testament to the deep need for this kind of project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word by sharing our event with friends, through social media and word of mouth. Indiegogo share tools makes it easy!

Remember, 1 in 4 girls, and 1 in 6 boys, is a victim of sexual abuse. That means that, among eight to twelve closest friends, at least two (statistically) have suffered abuse. By helping to spread the word, you acknowledge that you care... that you will fight for the freedom of the next generation of boys and girls. 

Thank you for making a difference!

story:
Why I am asking for your support

After three years,   THE FILAM would like to take its reporting to the next level. We would like to start an investigative reporting project that will explore deeper reporting on the community and engage Filipino-American journalism students or media majors who might want to write about  issues. The topics are not limited to exposing problems and wrongdoings among community leaders and organizations, but will discuss in-depth  serious topics that are current or of wide interest. One largely untold story is the plight of undocumented  Filipinos in immigration jails. Another relevant but under-reported issue is the financial viability of Filipino restaurants: why some thrive and others can’t seem to have a command of the market. The challenges faced by  Filipino nurses is another topic worth exploring: Are those challenges the same whether they work in hospitals or in nursing homes? 


What is THE FILAM? 

THE FILAM is an online magazine serving Filipinos in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut, Founded March 15, 2011, by journalist Cristina DC Pastor, THE FILAM came to be known as an independent publication  run by a member of the working press. It features mostly original content about FilAms in the arts and entertainment, business, education, fashion, food industry, health, local politics, LGBT advocacy, etc. We are widely republished by content partners in the Philippines, New York and California. It has won community journalism awards.

It was featured in Voice of America as “bridging” Filipinos in New York with their motherland during the powerful storm wrought byTyphoon Haiyan.

THE FILAM is among the publications currently featured until January 2015 at an interactive exhibit on 100 of the most influential ethnic media publications in the U.S. The exhibit, "One Nation with News for All,"  was organized by the Smithsonian Institution at the Newseum in Washington D.C.





Where your support will go? 

Our target amount is $5K to support at least 3 to 4 years of continued investigative reporting at four articles a year. We believe the amount is not nearly enough  but fair to begin with.  The reporter will receive a stipend of anywhere from $300 to $400 per completed report. Hopefully, it will support the reporters’ gas money, some meals with sources, batteries, photocopying documents and other expenses Depending on the area of research, we hope to keep expenses within a reasonable level.

 

Why your support is important  

Because of lack of resources, some in the ethnic media shy away from investigative reporting. It takes a lot of time and resources, which community newspapers do not always have. As a publication owned by a working journalist, THE FILAM would like to initiate Investigative Reporting because of a need to bring heightened discussion of community issues. The reports will spotlight specific community concerns  (eg. immigration, employment opportunities, health problems, generational conflicts) and examine some issues and possible solutions. I hope that our reporting in the past three years as a continuous online publication shows that THE FILAM has done something different and that you will support this plan to report stories with more depth and analysis.

How else you can help

I understand that some of you may not be able to contribute, You may be able to help out  in other ways by spreading the word about our campaign and sharing the link with your network. For those with a burning story to share and believe it needs to be told, please send a short pitch to TheFilAmNY@gmail.com.

story:
Welcome to the Mini Fund Raiser for our Little Bitty!

In efforts to do the best we can for our budding family, we have spent the pregnancy bargain hunting, waiting to make purchases during sales, sharing one vehicle, getting low cost natural medical assistance, buying as much health food in bulk as possible, searching thrift and second hand stores, applying for food stamps & other assistance and have very gratefully received some higher priced baby essentials as gifts. 

Some things you may enjoy knowing:

  • Our most recent accomplishment for Little Bitty was avoiding medical intervention and future medical bills and problems by having our midwives manually turn Bitty out of a breeched position! (quite amazing at nearly 36 weeks along!)
  • Our tight budget is now devoted to getting an economical family car, since our current vehicle is a 2 seater and is not safe for a car seat (only front seating)
  • The remaining costs to prepare for our baby are mainly for breastfeeding and home birth purposes! Yes, this is what all contributions to this fund will go to!

Items You will be contributing to the purchase of:

Breastfeeding!

  • Breastpump! Yep, I'm going to start working again and actually return to school! We are overjoyed at the opportunity to continue to progress economically and provide the best nutrition that can be provided to a baby ~ <3
  • Breast milk storage set, matching bottle tops for feeding and a bottle warmer for Daddy or baby sitter to quickly prep frozen or cold milk when Bitty is asking.
  • Rocking Chair ~ I don't have one and we don't have much furniture in general, so we need a place I know I can sit comfortably to nurse Little Bitty very often, day & night and ergonomically (so as to not cause injury or strain).
Home BIrth
The cost of a home birth is actually quite economical. We just need to purchase our midwives' birth kit (a new one used for each home birth with essential sterile medical materials) and some items such as receiving blankets, herbal support for cramping (cramp bark), bowls and trash bags and special oil for skin saving purposes.
Little bit on Home Birth:
babies show higher rates of health, behavior (function) and wellness throughout life. 
Midwives are also excellent and greatly appreciated birth specialists who have studied, train and apprenticed in school for years to be able to gain certification and competence. 
Babies and Mothers enjoy the best births through well trained midwifery and cesarean rates for competent midwife care drop down to 2-3% !!!!

What if we don't reach our goal?

Well, we have faced many challenges during the pregnancy and the deepest love in my heart has taught me to do the best I can when approaching difficulty, to ask for help when it really is needed and speak out about what the situation really is. 

And that's just what we'll do.

Other Opportunities to Contribute 

We are beginning to invite people to be a part of Little Bitty's landing on Earth and the postpartum time by signing up on a Meal Train!

  • Contact Stacy O'Neill, Christie Thompson or Jessica Hadden to receive an invitation via email or Facebook if you have not seen one yet. 
  • The actual calendar to reserve your visit time will be posted as soon as birth begins. Visits will start about one week later.

You can also contribute directly by purchasing breastfeeding items from the Babies R Us Registry:

http://www.toysrus.com/registry/search/index.js...

Thank you all for being a part of Little Bitty's beginnings. 

We are elated to bring Bitty to the world ~ <3
story_txt:
Welcome to the Mini Fund Raiser for our Little Bitty!In efforts to do the best we can for our budding family, we have spent the pregnancy bargain hunting, waiting to make purchases during sales, sharing one vehicle, getting low cost natural medical assistance, buying as much health food in bulk as possible, searching thrift and second hand stores, applying for food stamps & other assistance and have very gratefully received some higher priced baby essentials as gifts. Some things you may enjoy knowing:
Our most recent accomplishment for Little Bitty was avoiding medical intervention and future medical bills and problems by having our midwives manually turn Bitty out of a breeched position! (quite amazing at nearly 36 weeks along!)

Our tight budget is now devoted to getting an economical family car, since our current vehicle is a 2 seater and is not safe for a car seat (only front seating)
The remaining costs to prepare for our baby are mainly for breastfeeding and home birth purposes! Yes, this is what all contributions to this fund will go to!
Items You will be contributing to the purchase of:Breastfeeding!
Breastpump! Yep, I'm going to start working again and actually return to school! We are overjoyed at the opportunity to continue to progress economically and provide the best nutrition that can be provided to a baby ~ <3
Breast milk storage set, matching bottle tops for feeding and a bottle warmer for Daddy or baby sitter to quickly prep frozen or cold milk when Bitty is asking.

story:
¿Qué?

Giacomo es una novela dura y por momentos hilarante en la que, de la mano de Carlos Ortega Pardo, un moderno Casanova busca su camino en un mundo quizás demasiado parecido al nuestro.

Cuando su novia lo abandona, Hugo Prado se refugia en una bizarra retahíla de conquistas amorosas. Aunque en algunos casos cabría decir, más bien, derrotas amorosas. Recogidas puntualmente en su diario, éstas conviven con su lucha por ganarse la vida —o la desesperada búsqueda de la plaza de funcionario que como ciudadano me corresponde—; con una serie de citas extraídas de sus lecturas, algunas ciertamente alucinadas, y con el relato apasionado de su participación en las ilusionadas jornadas primaverales del 15-M. Si bien los motivos que le llevan a enrolarse en el movimiento indignado resultan, cuando menos, inusuales- o quizá no tanto.

Casanova moderno, perdedor con delirios de seductor, asiste perplejo a la evolución del microcosmos de su entorno: sus amigos se casan, otros emigran; algunos incluso alcanzan un moderado éxito. Mientras él, enmarañado en sus obsesiones, se resiste a adentrarse en lo que muchos considerarían la vida adulta.

Una vida adulta, en fin, que para Hugo Prado no es sino La Derrota.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Carlos Ortega Pardo.

Un joven licenciado en Ciencias Políticas que tras trabajar en el gabinete de comunicación de un partido con representación parlamentaria, quizás hastiado y desencantado por las labores que se le asignan como por la propia política, no tarda en encaminar sus pasos hacia otros derroteros.

A día de hoy desempeña funciones de profesor y traductor, junto con otras actividades relacionadas con la literatura y la cinematografía; siendo un asiduo en las publicaciones de críticas fílmicas.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos y hacerte con las galeradas de edición aportando un poco más.
  • O incluso, haciendo un pequeño esfuerzo, estarías invitado a un evento con ágapes y medios de comunicación donde el autor presentará la obra al mundo.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Giacomo que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Carlos Ortega vea publicada su obra. Ahh... lo olvidaba, en nuestra página www.tandaia.com tenéis acceso a uno de los emocionantes capítulos de Giacomo...

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
So why do you wanna make this book?

- The reason i want to make a book about female breast's and body is because they are beautiful... And in this second you guy's may think im talking about those sexy hot models for victoria secret and playboy, but i would say more the normal girl on the street. From fat women to skinny women, the women that is tall and the woman that is small. And all this to show you how women from scandinavia looks like


But why do you wanna make a book full of pictures of these kinds of women?

- So the reason behind why these women and not the skinny sexy model's?! is pretty easy to answer on. The reason is that in these days we live in, we can see women who are unsatisfied with there body and think they look ugly. Or we could say they have a bad confidense about there body and dream about being like the hot photoshopped women in the magazines, and i will try change on that. Cause i want to make everyone pretty and show without photoshop how women from allover scandinavia looks like, cause we live in rich country where you can sometimes be jugded about you look, how you dress and so on.

So How big is the book Going to be?

-Right now i don't have a clue, but what i know for sure is that we atleast are going to take 50-100 pictures from each country. but we only have friday to sunday to take the pictures. And that means we are in a thight budget So what we hope is atleast 200 to 400 pages of beautifull women from each country.

So how old do i have to be to participate as and model?

-So what we know is that you have to be over 18 year's old and up to 100 there is no end. But if you are 16 you can also participate but you have to show that parents allow it and atleast one have to come with you. I would also hope on that everyone who wants participate, even if you are fat have anorexia or had breast cancer... we want to show everyone in this book and we will get people to see it in perspective and say that you are beautifull as you are.

So what type of picture's are we talking about?

We are for the most talking about nude picture's. In the start it was talk about boobs, but after a while we thought we had to get everything in the picture. But if you are not comfortable we will take pictures of you while you cover the vaginal parts and breast. we also alow to have underwear that fits to the skin color but breast have to be covered by hands

We will not make anyone uncomfortable. But we will make a Email where you can send in who you are, how old and how you look, doesn't have to be picture but it is much appreciated if you have one.

So how much will this cost us and what do we get?

-So because of the expensive prize in scandinavia, i got calculated 7594$

It may seem high and it is, but if i can make it with your help i will give away 25% of the money to Red Ribbon as an help for sexual diseases and to the norwegian Pink Ribbon to fight the Breast cancer for women.

but that is after the book is done so here is why i need money so here is a list about every detail:

Ps: every number is written in the budget is rounded up to closest

Plane ticket's

-From Stavanger to Oslo: 328$

-From Stavanger to Copenhagen (Denmark): 328$

-From Stavanger to Stockholm (Sweden): 328$

-From Stavanger to Helsinki (Finland): 328$

Hotel for 3 day's

-I rounded up the number up to 820$ and it is also included with food so i don't go hungry

Camera equipment?

So i had a camera, but it got stolen. The 2000$ goes to rent or buy cheap Camera and studio equipment to take the photos. 

Location and studio is going as thought to be in conference rooms where we can take picture's for the book will cost us additonal 1000$

In additon to that i've talked to a book company in norway and they ask for around 2,5k $ to print up the books and they will also help out with sending it out to book-stores and make a good commercial out of it

so all in all the price will be 7594$ US dollars. And it may seem alot for a book of women but if you ask me it is worth it


So is there anything we forgot or that you may like?

I would love to get your thoughts about it and your meanings. so dont be afraid and say it to me. It would be much appreciated. if we get enough money we will also go to Iceland

story:
Who We Are

When Nigerian novelist, Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie, addressed the TED Conference in 2009, she spoke of the danger of the single story, a distorted, one-dimensional view of Africa that sees the continent only through a prism of war, disease, poverty, starvation and corruption. 

Short Story Day Africa has established a day, 21st June – the shortest day of the year – on which to celebrate the diversity of Africa’s voices and tell you who we really are; what we love; love to eat, read, write about. We want to bring you the scents on our street corners, the gossip from our neighbours, let you listen to strains of the music we dance to.

Short Story Day Africa brings together writers, readers, booksellers, publishers, teachers and school children from all over the globe to write, submit, read, workshop and discuss stories - and foster the love of reading and writing African fiction. Because we have something to tell the world. About us. In our own voices.  


What We Need & What You Get

Short Story Day Africa is in its 4th year and the project has grown substantially since we began. Last year, we brought out two collections of short stories, an anthology of adult writing, Feast, Famine and Potluck, and Rapuzel is Dead, stories written by Africa's younger writers. Both collections are available on Amazon, Smashwords and Megabooks. This year, we'll be highlighting Africa's wonderful speculative fiction. 

Help us reach our funding goal and in return, we'll send you an e-book of our 2014 collection. Fund us in excess of $100 and you'll become an official sponsor of Short Story Day Africa '14.

Why do we need the funding?  We're bringing out an anthology and we want it to be slick and polished, sans spelling errors and bad grammar. For this we need editors, proofreaders, book designers and illustrators. We want the quality of the book to match the quality of the writing, which if last year is anything to go by, will be outstanding.


The Impact

Literacy! By running competitions and workshops in schools and beyond, we foster a love of writing that leads to a love of reading. Perhaps we inspire the next Chimamanda. Perhaps, ten years from now, a best-selling author will be asked why they started writing and they'll say they entered a competition for Short Story Day Africa, got published and discovered a passion for the written word. You could be reading that writer. In fact, what's to stop you being that writer?


Image,  "Line Dancing", courtesy of Candace di Talamo, who also illustrated the cover of Feast, Famine & Potluck. More of her work can be viewed here.

story:
Due to a variety of extenuating circumstances, Wesleyan University's slam team does not have the funds for the airplane ticket to send their fifth member, Giorgia Sage Peckman, to CUPSI, the national college slam competition in Richmond, Virginia, at the end of March.

We're on a time crunch to get this ticket purchased, and it is essential to the team that we are able to travel, perform, and compete as an entire unit, after all of the work we have collectively put in together. Not only is this an important emotional and bonding experience, it is also incredibly important on a professional and creative level. Anything you can give helps, even just a dollar.

All additional proceeds after travel is paid for will offset the costs of producing team merchandise.

A little bit about Giorgia: 

Giorgia Sage is an undergraduate at Wesleyan University studying studio art and environmental science. A San Francisco native, the most homesick she gets is that she forgets she now lives in a place that is not in a drought. She has been published in Barking Sycamores, Sugar Mule, The Found Poetry Review, the MOTIF anthology series, and Your Impossible Voice, among other journals. She has been told her work is like drinking a coke with Frank O'Hara. She likes walking and often wishes she was a bat.
