story:
About AJ

AJ is a 9 year old boy who wrote the story 'Sam's 10th Birthday' when he was 8.  It's the story of a young boy who wakes up on his birthday expecting lots of toys, but gets love letters from his family instead! 

Sam gets really angry and 'throws his temper around the whole house!'

His family help him to realize that he has far too many toys already, and that more practical presents should also be appreciated. The story is funny, has a moral to it, and AJ hopes it will help children realize that lots of toys on your birthday is not as important as having the love of your family!

AJ's dream is to reach as many people with his story, in the hope it will help both young and old appreciate the blessings they already have.  Help him with his publishing goal and receive a SIGNED COPY of his book in return!  

Here's a snippet of AJ reading his story at a local library; a reporter was in the audience, and now the Croydon Guardian want to feature his story when the book is published!

Help AJ reach his goal, and be blessed in return!

What You Will Get for Funding AJ's Campaign

  • For a minimum £10 contribution, AJ will send you a SIGNED COPY of his book and invite you to his Book Launch! (in London)
  • £15 will get you a SIGNED COPY of the book, PLUS a recording of AJ reading his story!
  • £25 will get you the book, CD, AND a T-Shirt saying "I helped a boy publish his book" (with a print of the book cover design on the front)  
  • Any extra money raised will go towards printing extra books to be given away to disadvantaged children in Africa, schools and libraries.

What a Difference a Book Makes!

The book has positive images of an African-Caribbean family, which will have a positive impact on the psyche of young children in this society.  If you know a young boy or girl aged 5-12 get them a copy!

Other Ways You Can Help

Help AJ reach his target by: 

  • Sharing the link to this page with people who you know have children
  • Post it on your social networking sites

Many thanks in advance!

Cezanne Poetess
story_txt:
About AJAJ is a 9 year old boy who wrote the story 'Sam's 10th Birthday' when he was 8.  It's the story of a young boy who wakes up on his birthday expecting lots of toys, but gets love letters from his family instead! Sam gets really angry and 'throws his temper around the whole house!'His family help him to realize that he has far too many toys already, and that more practical presents should also be appreciated. The story is funny, has a moral to it, and AJ hopes it will help children realize that lots of toys on your birthday is not as important as having the love of your family!AJ's dream is to reach as many people with his story, in the hope it will help both young and old appreciate the blessings they already have.  Help him with his publishing goal and receive a SIGNED COPY of his book in return!  Here's a snippet of AJ reading his story at a local library; a reporter was in the audience, and now the Croydon Guardian want to feature his story when the book is published!Help AJ reach his goal, and be blessed in return!What You Will Get for Funding AJ's Campaign
For a minimum £10 contribution, AJ will send you a SIGNED COPY of his book and invite you to his Book Launch! (in London)
£15 will get you a SIGNED COPY of the book, PLUS a recording of AJ reading his story!
£25 will get you the book, CD, AND a T-Shirt saying "I helped a boy publish his book" (with a print of the book cover design on the front)  
Any extra money raised will go towards printing extra books to be given away to disadvantaged children in Africa, schools and libraries.

What a Difference a Book Makes!The book has positive images of an African-Caribbean family, which will have a positive impact on the psyche of young children in this society.  If you know a young boy or girl aged 5-12 get them a copy!Other Ways You Can HelpHelp AJ reach his target by: 
Sharing the link to this page with people who you know have children
Post it on your social networking sites
Many thanks in advance!Cezanne Poetess

story:
Idle Thoughts was a weekly column written over 18 years by Oliver Harris.

This campaign is an effort to raise enough money to put a compilation of the columns into one place- published in a book.
story_txt: Idle Thoughts was a weekly column written over 18 years by Oliver Harris.This campaign is an effort to raise enough money to put a compilation of the columns into one place- published in a book.

story:
What is this?

Just over a year since I began writing about Delilah More, her story is coming to an end. I have shared so many of my experiences through her, writing in an incredibly emotion/feeling-driven manner. Writing a book has always been something I have craved to do -- to know what it feels like to hold hundreds of days of thoughts in your hand, to let the people you love and the people you have yet to meet to indulge in your elaborate fantasy -- and now I am so close to achieving this goal. 

Writing is not something I have taken up for money, for publicity, for a simple hobby. It is something I have always been passionate about, something that I feel I belong to and that belongs to me. No matter where I go, what I do, or who I meet, nothing will ever strip me of my love for storytelling.

I sat down one afternoon and wrote the first draft…it was just one page. I realized that there was so much to one story, so many details and thoughts and interactions, that if time permitted, every story would never end. I began to inject some detail into the story, then more and more and more, until it became a giant stack of scenes. I became addicted to the story, thinking of it constantly and desperately putting time aside to contribute to it. I would write on my phone, homework paper, computers, iPads, anything I could get my hands on, at any time. I have put crazy effort into this story, and now it is time to release it to whomever is interested in reading. 

Oh, yes. The story.  

Sugarbird is the tale of a seventeen year old girl who is just finishing her first book. She believes it is her masterpiece -- she has been writing it for five years now. As the completion of the last few chapters approaches, she finds herself on the cusp of insanity as her muse for the main character of her novel seems to become increasingly more real. She treats this woman -- this character -- as if it were her daughter. One night, Lye takes shelter from the rain in a chapel inhabited by a priest named Jay, and quickly becomes infatuated with him. She visits him often, in pursuit of a distraction from her struggle with her long-desired authorship. They become close as he helps her cope with not only her psychological struggles, but with the hardships she faces at home. 

Sugarbird illustrates the relationship between author and character, the tragic combination of fantasy, love, and obsession.

Why is help needed?

I want to self-publish my book on Blurb.com, and that requires some financial help. For over 100 copies, it will cost about $300, plus any fees from Blurb. The next step will be the distribution, which Blurb will also manage, but which may also have a fee.

Impact
  • You will partake in the beginning of what hopefully turns out to be a very successful book.
  • You sure will make me, and everyone else who buys the book, happy.
The Challenge
I am young, but I want to accomplish this as independently as I can. Creating my own campaign will help me raise the money I need and gain the attention my book needs in order to be successful.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share the video!
  • Share anything and everything related to this campaign on social media!
  • Talk about it!

Thank you so much for the support.

story:
Update Jan. 4 2015 (7pm)

Wow!!! Passed 100%! This is unreal! :D Thanks so much for the support! Campaign closes on Jan 7th. Let's finish strong!

Update Jan. 4, 2015 (1pm)

Amazing news! An awesome Shmootown supporter has offered to match your contribution - up to $250 - for the next 24 hours only!!

Hurray!!!! :D


---

Update Jan. 2, 2015

And we are over 85% of the way to our goal! Hurray! Let's get to 100%!
Happy New Year!


---
Update Dec. 29, 2015

Amazing! Hurray!
What a part-ay!
And the even better news?
THIS MEANS MORE SHMOOS!!!

Thanks! Keep the momentum going! If you want to contribute, do it now! :D



---
Update Dec. 26, 2015

Merry Christmas! :)



---
Update Dec. 14, 2015


Just a little thank you for everything so far...
Check out the new Featured Perk, which just arrived in the mail. Awesome!! :D



---
Original text: Dec 7, 2015

Hi there! Thanks for stopping by my crowdfunding page. I am raising funds to launch the very special and totally awesome Shmootown children's books - and I need your help. I am a motivational scientist and learning coach, with a strong backgound in research psychology. Here's the deal: we all need a lot more support getting through the challenges in our days, and early childhood education is a big part of that.

Kids need to feel floods of love and support, We are all part of the "village" needed to raise happy kids. And the Shmootown books are all about community.  These books are about bringing in the good.

When I wrote these books I used everything I know about psychology, motivation, health and happiness to create narratives that touch people of all ages and make us feel connected to who we really are.

And who we are is awesome.


What We Need

So why crowdfund?

Well because we need lots of things:

  • To finish digitising the images from the 2 books that are in the works ("Growing Things" and "How to be Courageous")
  • These books are completely ready except for the digitising and formatting
  • To start on the third ("Welcome to Shmootown")
  • A web site! Where kids (and other people) can go look at some Shmoo photobook pictures and read some nice rhymes throughout the day
  • The plan is to launch the books as e-books to be made available via Amazon, and then to print a limited run
  • The funds will go to getting as far down this road as possible

It's hard to be a kid these days. We're all feeling the effects of the stress of climate change, a difficult economy and very scary conflicts. Kids need to feel that there is hope and they need to learn how to dig deep and have strength and courage and community.

Welcome to Shmootown!


Shmootown is the home of the Shmoos, a very wonderful people who like to laugh, play, make jokes and make shoes. Professor Bikoosh, the narrator of the stories, stumbled upon the Shmoos one day during a long train ride... Being a cultural anthropologist, the Professor decided to investigate these intriguing beings!
Since then, Professor Bikoosh has made regular trips to Shmootown (nobody else knows the way) and written down a bunch of stories from life in Shmootown and from Shmoo folklore. These are the tales told in the Shmootown books.


Books in the Works:


"Shmootown - Growing Things"

The Shmoo you see here is named Hoppy Hoo, and she is the best gardener in Shmootown. This story is about how growing up means having to let go... but that it is always alright in the end.

Hoppy and her Pop are actual inhabitants of Shmootown, and they figure in some of the other stories starring Hoppy's friends or her neighbors.


"Shmootown - How to be Courageous"

That's Henry Hoo. And this is a tale of how Henry had to face one of the biggest, scariest monsters ever. And he did. This story has been handed down through generations in Shmootown to teach Shmoos how to be COURAGEOUS!


The Impact

I know these books are great because I have tested them on kids from ages 3-10 years old and the feedback is unanimous: they love them. (The older ones are even surprised:  "YOU wrote this?" they ask incredulously.) I believe that kids deserve stories that help them with their real challenges - being brave, persevering, growing up, making friends, getting through good days and hard days... That's what the Shmootown stories are all about. We forget what it's like to be small in a big world. Sometimes it's hard, but if we make friends and try to do our best... well, it can be just wonderful. I hope you'll be a part of making these books a reality.

In the words of one of my biggest little fans:

"MORE SHMOOS!" - Preschooler, 3 years old


Other Ways You Can Help

Are you feeling it??!! Yes!!! Join the Shmoo Party Train!!!

Here are some other ways to help:

  • Post this campaign to your FB or social media page to get the word out: SHMOOTOWN IS COMING! 
  • Indiegogo has share tools to make this easier: #shmootowniscoming
  • Want to hear more? Shoot me an email at nadine@shmootown.org and get on the SHMOOTOWN MAILING LIST!
  • Don't have any money? Send me good vibes! You have no idea how much that helps!
  • Do something Shmoo-y today! Spread the joy :)



Copyright notice: The Shmootown stories, illustrations, and all the characters theirein are the intellectual property of Nadine Bekkouche and protected by copyright. All rights reserved.

story:
Short Summary

My name is A.C. Burton and I am the author of Find Me in the Trenches. I wrote this book as an honest testament to what it takes to reclaim control of life moving forward, rather than staying stuck in the “trenches” of past adversities. We truly believe that this is a time for us to step out of our comfort zones and begin to walk towards true freedom.

My hope is, in reading this book, readers can discover what it takes to ultimately begin the process of healing - in family, relationships, and in self-identity. In this book, I hope to instill in readers the same sort of passion and excitement I have for the journey of healing and renewal of human spirit. Ultimately, I want readers to use this book as a testimony to share how overcoming adversity can be the ultimate strength to be resilient towards life’s challenges

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

The Impact

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #FindMeintheTrenches and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
A.C. Burton

 

About the Author

A.C. Burton is an aspiring author and currently working towards a writing career as a fictional author and podcast host. Her passions include youth culture and education, problem-solving, and leadership, advocating for solutions that will fully equip the next generation of leaders. 

Burton wrote this book as an honest testament to understanding what it takes to overcome adversity and to reclaim control of your life. Seeing this through her father’s personal testimony, she wanted to share his story and the consequences he went through in order for him to find a sense of gratitude, ultimately leading to resilience. The same gratitude and courage he demonstrates are what lead Burton to take her own steps towards reclaiming control of her life journey.

She believes everyone has the potential to pursue true happiness and joy in life, even when life does not go according to our plans. Her passion is to see people who have been stuck in their own “trenches” for a long period, rise above and choose to take those steps towards healing and growth and find resilience even in the darkest areas of life. 

Burton is currently working as a college intern. Outside of school, she is a “student of life,” picking up various hobbies during her free-time, including photography, videography, investing, & cooking. In her downtime, she likes to catch up with the online Star Wars community, play video games, read, drink lots of coffee and go on early morning walks with her Boston terrier. 

For more information, you can connect with Burton at alisnavidadcreative@gmail.com.

story:
Story of My Book

Shufto - My Unique Journey From Sudan, Egypt, To The USA is a series of stories about my personal journey as a refugee, and about the experiences of many other refugees and immigrants around the world.

My name is Jenaro “Shufto” Olwak Aken and I am the author of Shufto - My Unique Journey From Sudan, Egypt, To The USA. I wrote this book because I wanted to shine a light on my experience as a refugee from Sudan, and on the refugee experiences of many others around the world. We may not have all gone through the same challenges, but we all have gone through difficult circumstances nonetheless. This is just one version of that refugee experience, and it is one you haven’t heard before now.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the world is smaller than most people think. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for life and the human experience. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you understand the refugee experience.

In this book, you'll learn about life in Sudan, Egypt, the US, and perseverance. You'll hear stories such as...
  • My family and my upbringing in Khartoum, Sudan.
  • The difficult decision families make to seek refugee in foreign lands and the challenges they face.
  • The importance of education, opportunity, and community.
You will love this book if you like to learn about different cultures, travel, and believe in possibilities.

Shufto - My Unique Journey From Sudan, Egypt, To The USA is a nonfiction book that speaks to parents and students who want to look at immigration and refugees in a new way.
 

The Book - Shufto - My Unique Journey From Sudan, Egypt, To The USA


The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-5. The first five chapters focus on my family and my childhood in Sudan. I write about my family dynamics and about my struggle dealing with the name “Shufto.” I was a curious child and often got into trouble for being so curious, but my love for education helped me through that difficult time and early stages in my life.

Part 2 contains chapters 6-12. These chapters deal with the early stages of my education, my relationship with my parents, and my family's decision to leave Sudan for Egypt, and life in Cairo. Living in Egypt was a difficult experience for all of us, but particularly for my mother especially after a serious accident. At only ten years old, I tried my very best to support her and the family.

Part 3 contains chapters 13-19. This last part of the book covers our transition from Africa to America. The culture shock, a new language, snow, and the four seasons of Western, New York. I write about the ups and downs of growing up in Buffalo, NY and about the community as well as about the opportunity my family and I were granted to start a new life and make the best of our second chance as a refugee family in the USA.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

 

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring 2021.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

 

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author


Jenaro Aken is a community activist, entrepreneur, storyteller, and author of the new book Shufto – My Unique Journey from Sudan, Egypt, to the U.S.A.

He wrote the book in order to shine a light on the refugee experience many Sudanese families have gone through over the past two decades. Jenaro is passionate about working within his community with youth and young adults in particular. His goal is to inspire the next generation to take full advantage of opportunities available to them, in hopes of making a positive impact in the world. Jenaro is curious about finding ways to use his life story and experience as a refugee to connect with people interested in helping those of us most in need.

Reading, writing, dancing, and music have been important pillars in Jenaro’s life from a young age. He credits the arts for helping shape the person he has become. Sports, soccer "Futball" in particular is a favorite hobby and has been for a long time. Most friends would describe Jenaro as talkative and a “know it” all, but a humble and gentle soul deep down.

For more information, you can connect with Jenaro Olwak Aken at Olwakjenaro@gmail.com and on Instagram @Olwak_Jenaro.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #Shuftomyjourney and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jenaro Olwak Aken
story_txt:
Story of My Book
Shufto - My Unique Journey From Sudan, Egypt, To The USA is a series of stories about my personal journey as a refugee, and about the experiences of many other refugees and immigrants around the world.My name is Jenaro “Shufto” Olwak Aken and I am the author of Shufto - My Unique Journey From Sudan, Egypt, To The USA. I wrote this book because I wanted to shine a light on my experience as a refugee from Sudan, and on the refugee experiences of many others around the world. We may not have all gone through the same challenges, but we all have gone through difficult circumstances nonetheless. This is just one version of that refugee experience, and it is one you haven’t heard before now.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the world is smaller than most people think. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for life and the human experience. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you understand the refugee experience.In this book, you'll learn about life in Sudan, Egypt, the US, and perseverance. You'll hear stories such as...
My family and my upbringing in Khartoum, Sudan.
The difficult decision families make to seek refugee in foreign lands and the challenges they face.
The importance of education, opportunity, and community.
 You will love this book if you like to learn about different cultures, travel, and believe in possibilities.Shufto - My Unique Journey From Sudan, Egypt, To The USA is a nonfiction book that speaks to parents and students who want to look at immigration and refugees in a new way. The Book - Shufto - My Unique Journey From Sudan, Egypt, To The USA
The book is written in 3 parts.Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-5. The first five chapters focus on my family and my childhood in Sudan. I write about my family dynamics and about my struggle dealing with the name “Shufto.” I was a curious child and often got into trouble for being so curious, but my love for education helped me through that difficult time and early stages in my life.Part 2 contains chapters 6-12. These chapters deal with the early stages of my education, my relationship with my parents, and my family's decision to leave Sudan for Egypt, and life in Cairo. Living in Egypt was a difficult experience for all of us, but particularly for my mother especially after a serious accident. At only ten years old, I tried my very best to support her and the family.Part 3 contains chapters 13-19. This last part of the book covers our transition from Africa to America. The culture shock, a new language, snow, and the four seasons of Western, New York. I write about the ups and downs of growing up in Buffalo, NY and about the community as well as about the opportunity my family and I were granted to start a new life and make the best of our second chance as a refugee family in the USA. What I Need & What You'll Get This book will be published with New Degree Press. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now: 

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
And much more!

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #Shuftomyjourney and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

story:
Story of My Book

Out of the Closet and Into the Streets: Why We Need to Practice Rainbow Feminism is a piece of feminist literature focused on the intersection of Queer theory and the fourth wave. As feminism enters a new phase with a younger and more diverse generation at its core, the movement needs to evolve and question how traditional notions of liberation may actually contribute to continued oppression. 

My name is Emily Hardy and I am the author of Out of the Closet and Into the Streets: Why We Need to Practice Rainbow Feminism. I wrote this book because as a young adult,  struggling to both define myself as a feminist and navigate my Queer identity, I often found myself asking larger identity questions about the kind of world I want to help build. Motivated by an authentic desire to communicate my beliefs about the direction of feminism, this book is my contribution to the future. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will question the binaries that seem so fundamental to the constructions of Western society. In this book, I hope to instil in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the future of the Feminist movement and Queer liberation. Ultimately, I want you to see my work as a tool to help you understand the current relationship between the feminist movement and the LGBTQPIA2+ community but also as a challenge to traditional white-woman feminism that failed Queer, disabled, socio-economically disenfranchised and racial/ethnic minority communities. 

In this book, you'll think about the true origins of knowledge and challenge the institutions of power that govern our relationships, not just with society and others but with ourselves. You'll hear stories from classic feminist thinkers, like Audre Lorde, and more contemporary scholars, like Sara Ahmed, on the evolving discourse of the liberation movement.


If you are Queer or if you are a feminist, if you know it all or if you know nothing, this book is for you. I know that you will love this book if you want to critically analyze gender, Queerness and feminism in our current socio-political context.

Out of the Closet and Into the Streets:  Why We Need to Practice Rainbow Feminism is a nonfiction book that speaks to the academic community and general public alike by distilling scholarly discourse in a digestible and approachable medium. For those who want to challenge their own subconscious bias, internalized misogyny, and compulsory heterosexuality (all terms I will discuss throughout the book--no worries if you are unfamiliar) my book is for you. 

What I Need & What You'll Get

My book will be published with New Degree Press and I already have a publishing contract. I just need your help. The pre-order tiers and campaign funds the book and makes my publishing dream a reality. To help cover the costs for publishing my book, I will rely on sponsors like you to support my campaign early. All money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this August 2021!!!!


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook. But I need your help to hit these milestones. The publishing process is made possible through your support. 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

1. You will become one of my Beta readers- a community of trusted advisors in the publishing process as I navigate the marketing journey. 

2. You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish in August.

3. Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

4. You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

5. You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

6. You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

7. And much more!

About the Author:

Originally from Vancouver, Canada, Emily is a student at Georgetown University majoring in International Politics and dual minoring in Justice & Peace Studies and Women & Gender Studies. Passionate about gender equality, peacebuilding, and global governance, Emily is publishing her book Out of the Closet and Into the Streets: Why We Need to Practice Rainbow Feminism,  in August 2021 with New Degree Press. As a student of feminist theory and a proud member of the Queer community, Hardy hopes to use her privilege and voice to build a more equitable world that is liberated from all oppressive, binary structures. When she's not writing, Hardy can be found baking cookies (chocolate chip, of course) or lost in a good book! 

Want to know more? 
For more information, you can connect with Emily Hardy at ejfhardy@gmail.com and on her blog: https://ejfhardy.wixsite.com/my-site-2 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is obviously delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically mailing the book to you. In order to eliminate this risk, all relevant/associated costs (including the cost of mailing and shipping) have been included in each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. It would honestly mean so much to me if you could use your platform to amplify my voice and connect me with a larger audience.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media. <3 

Thank you so much for all of your support!

Sending my love to you!

-Emily

story:
Short Summary

How do I navigate a space that historically wasn't created for me nor do I have the tools for?

My name is Eriana James and I am the author of The 4-Year Ride. I wrote this book because there was not a blueprint for first-generation and minority students transitioning to college. This was something I struggled with during various points of my academic career. I feel compelled to share my experiences through this “four year ride“ in hopes that it will be beneficial to those who may be able to relate to my story.


My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that you are not alone in this experience. The journey will have its ups and downs, but that is only to test your will to succeed, not just academically but personally. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with the themes of; “storm before the calm”, which is dealing with adversity before anything gets better, “am I enough”, which deals with questioning one’s self-worth and whether they belong in an environment; and “cheers to the mayhem“ which is the growth and celebratory section of the book. It deals with realizing the lessons learned from experiencing adversity and being able to be comfortable in the uncomfortable.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book is a physical copy.
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Eriana James is a first-gen college graduate from Georgetown University. She has given a TEDx Talk October 2019 discussing the experience of a first-gen and how she was able to overcome her personal battles. She now resides in Dallas, TX as she is immersed in her teaching program, Urban Teachers. She will be going into her first year as a teacher-of-record for DISD in elementary and is also completing her last year of her Master's program at Johns Hopkins School of Education. 

THIS IS THE BOOK SHE WISHES SOMEONE HAD GIVEN HER WHEN SHE BEGAN HER 4 YEAR COLLEGE JOURNEY AS A FIRST-GEN & MINORITY STUDENT. She made this blueprint so other first-gen students can get an idea of what to expect and therefore be even more prepared and successful in their own journey.

She is someone who is extremely ambitious, determined, and a goal-getter. When she wants something, she does not, under any circumstances, take no for an answer. She believes that the impossible is actually possible; it’s a matter of changing the course to make it possible.]

For more information, you can connect with Eriana at erianajames@yahoo.com and Facebook: Eriana James-Bell.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #The4YearRide and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Eriana James

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #The4YearRide and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Eriana James

story:
Story of My Book

Skulls and Hibiscus is meant to be a self-reflection for those affected by mental health struggles in everyday life. This collection of poems serve as a guide to rediscovery within oneself. It is to ease hopeless romantics, people-pleasers, and over-thinkers so that they know that their feelings are valid.

My name is Heather Vazquez and I am the author of Skulls and Hibiscus. I wrote this book because I wanted to create a manuscript relatable for young adults such as myself. We live in a society where mental health is still a taboo, encouraging us to cope with life through technology and fake smiles. My hope for this book is that it pushes my audience to speak up for how they’re feeling, whether it is positive or negative. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover your own voice. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to release any tensions in your heart and to confront the emotional despairs of life, but realize there are moments of light laced within it.

In this book, you’ll join me in exploring love, youth, and how the struggles of mental health affect relationships and oneself through poems like: 

“A Young Confession” — A hopeless romantic who finally realizes their self-worth knowing that they, along with the person they're pursuing, have flaws, but finds that they are perfect for one another.

“Short-lived” — People may believe that getting old is something to fear, but they must remember that there is beauty in aging along with the world around us.

“Parents” — This piece is meant to connect with those who believe they are not adequate enough for their parental figures. Whether it is academically or socially, there are children who try their hardest achieve pride from a parent, seeking validation even if they are already doing all they can.


You will love this book if you enjoy romance, self-reflection, psychology, and philosophy. Skulls and Hibiscus speaks to hopeless romantics and over-thinkers who want to deal with their mental and emotional health in a new and healthier way.

Ultimately, I hope that Skulls and Hibiscus inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

Why should mental health be talked about more?

Is there a difference between idealized and romanticized love?

How does society behave around the stigma of mental health?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing mental health and its affects on love and behavior will change us all for the better. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Heather Vazquez is an English literature student at University of Phoenix and an influencer on the platform TikTok. She believes that helping others is what leads one to success and that a life with no regrets is a life well lived. She enjoys making people laugh and giving advice when needed. She is passionate about art, music, and anime, which have made her who she is today. She hopes to inspire others to better themselves emotionally and to have fun throughout their lives. She enjoys making silly videos to entertain her audiences and takes pride in taking care of her younger brother and pet turtles. 

For more information, you can connect with Heather Vazquez at hvazquez0612@gmail.com and at @afronoya_ on Instagram and Twitter or @afronoya on TikTok.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #SkullsandHibiscus and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Heather Vazquez

story:
Herald News China / 华美通讯

Many media outlets want us to demonize 1/5 of the humans on the planet. Anti-China rhetoric is rising, and COVID-19 has provided the backdrop for anti-Asian racism, hate crime, and discrimination. People are not their governments. Herald News China aims to use information and narrative to build bridges across the Pacific Ocean.

Herald News China was founded in 2020 by Y-LOVE (Yitz Jordan), an African-American rapper, founder and entrepreneur based in Brooklyn, NY. The company aims to combat anti-China bias in Western markets by promoting positive interrelationships between Chinese and Western users, through providing Mandarin- and English-language content and offline experiences (post-COVID-19).

The project seeks to raise $20,000 for seed funding which will be used to expand our staff and to expand our marketing efforts on both sides of the Pacific, culminating with the site launch, scheduled for August 6, 2020.

story:
Thanks for stopping by to read about the My Real Garden book. Welcome to th​e gang!

Hello there, my name's Ann-Marie Powell and when I found myself alone and scared at the start of lockdown, I really needed something to hold on to and give me hope.

I turned to my much neglected garden and decided to use the time that lockdown provided to transform it, and to share the trials and tribulations of doing so with fellow gardeners through a daily Instagram live - @myrealgarden. I hoped that my successes (and failures!) might help others who were also suddenly being thrown into disarray. Here’s the thing - I’m a well-known garden designer and TV presenter, so I was unsure about revealing the  true state my little plot of land – would its dishevelled condition lead to my professional ruin, or through gardening would I find what I was looking for?

Without fail I appeared LIVE, every day, at 12.30pm, for 100 days over the lockdown. At first, I felt nervous, shy and unsure of what I was doing and why (not to mention having to get to grips with Instagram’s tech!), but I was soon to discover that connecting with other gardeners was to be my silver lining through the most difficult of times. 

Right away I found that there was a hunger for real, fun and unfiltered advice (I seriously can't help telling people how it is for me!!!). Being joined by regular viewers each lunchtime,  my lockdown was brightened MASSIVELY by their company - their support, their mutual love of all things plants and gardening, and their virtual but very real friendship.

Suddenly My Real Garden was getting us all through AS A COMMUNITY OF SHARING GARDENERS.

A book like no other gardening book...

Connections have since been made throughout the world  and we are now a global community of over 12,000 passionate gardening experts, rusty returners and absolute beginners; sharing our successes, failures, and the enjoyment and emotional support that our gardens give us.

To celebrate our community and the lifeline that gardening supplies to us, we decided to create a book, so that we could share our gardens with a wider audience.

Members of the community have been  invited to submit photos, tips, favourite plants and gardening thoughts. The response has been phenomenal. The book will feature advice from hundreds of real gardeners from all walks of life, all corners of the globe, and with all sorts of gardens.

I believe that such a collaboration of real gardening knowledge, and the joy that it brings, has never been published before. So, to make this magical book happen we need your support. The book will be 208 pages packed with tips, hacks, failures, and floral fabulousness.

It will not only inspire all gardeners on all budgets but we will also be donating some of the proceeds to the UK charity Greenfingers. They create beautiful, well-designed gardens for children to enjoy precious time together with their family, friends and siblings in children's hospices. The more books we can presell, the more help we can provide to this wonderful charity.

I hope that you will want to be part of this growing community, one that has turned the trauma of lockdown into something immensely positive, by pre-ordering your copy of our book now, so that we can #passthepassion.

So how will we do it?

Our community couldn't do this on its own. So I asked my old friend and former 'The English Garden' editor, the wonderful Tamsin Westhorpe, to help me to collate and edit our community’s words into a volume we can all be proud of.

We are committed to producing a beautiful book to treasure, and in order to do so we are employing the requisite professionals to make it so. A book designer, editor, copywriter, proofreader and print company will all sustain necessary costs, not to mention the need for an ISBN number and beautiful packaging.

The result will be a full colour, maximum joy, advice-packed 208 pages loaded with feature gardens, tips, hacks, failures, and floral fabulousness from hundreds of gardeners around the world.
The final size will measure roughly 25 x 19 cms and be printed on lush 100 gsm silk paper.

We’re ready to go.  All we need is funding.  

If we can pre-sell a minimum of 1000 copies we can secure enough money to publish.

But if we can pre-fund 1001, 1002, or even more - ONLY THEN can we start supporting Greenfingers, the UK charity that fundraises to build beautiful gardens in children's hospices. The more we sell, the more we raise.

We would so appreciate your help - please pre-order your copy today.

And finally, a word on our founding supporters  

They say it takes an army to raise child.  It certainly takes one to grow a gardening book and halfway through our efforts we want to add a special thanks to our original troops. 

We are so grateful to Candide, the wonderful plant and gardening app, who had such faith in our mission that they supported our set up before we even had a page to share.  They asked for nothing, but we want to publicly acknowledge them and highly recommend that you take a look at their brilliant app too! 

We are also hugely thankful for all the advice we’ve had from the wonderful, independent publishers Orphans. They have generously shared all their publishing prowess to ensure we deliver the quality product we are committed to producing.

Big thanks to them and all you fabulous backers!

Fancy looking at some sample layouts?

No problem. Tamsin and I hope you like them as much as we do...

Thank you for your time.

story:
CHILDREN'S BOOK SUMMARY

"I Grab The Mic" takes us on a colorful fantasy ride through the challenging scenarios that can be linked to public speaking and performance anxiety. We experience this story through a young, Black girl and her friends as they grapple with the nerves that sometimes come with speaking/performing in front of a group. 

MEET THE TEAM

Malik Sickstein | Author

Malik is a Master's level psychologist, Hip-Hop Historian, proud Bison, and recording artist who co-authored the critically acclaimed YA novel "Let Me Hear A Rhyme". He is a committee panelist for the Virginia Children's Book Festival and is passionate about writing children's and adult non-fiction that express life lessons. He is the product of three places, Harlem, NYC (where he was born), D.C. (his second home), and the SF Bay Area (where he lives) - "Yee!" 

Paige Mason | Illustrator

Paige was born and raised in Fresno, California. Her passion for art and soccer earned her a full scholarship to the University of Arkansas-Little Rock where she obtained her Bachelor’s degree in Fine Art with an emphasis in Illustration. 

She lives in San Jose, California with her family of six: her husband, daughter, son, and two big dogs. When she isn't drawing and painting in her living room's corner studio, she's teaching visual art to elementary and middle school students. 

Jesse Byrd | Campaign Lead

Jesse is an award-winning children's book editor and writer from Oakland, CA whose family has been in publishing for over 31 years with New York Times Bestselling books to their credit. Believing so much in Malik and Paige's mission to help kids approach and address stage fright, Jesse's helping to lead this campaign to assure the project makes the most of every dime raised and this book receives its deserved exposure.

Serita Braxton | Campaign Manager 

Serita is a professional writer and published author from Maryland based in Spain. Her wanderlust carries her all over the globe where she writes for various publications. Serita is also the founder of Monita Tequila, a Black female-owned tequila brand. She's lending her vast talents and network in the world of publishing and business to help this campaign be the best it can be.  

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

This $10K will help us produce books and other items at a healthy enough volume that we can be sustainable and continue to create diverse products like this one, in the future.

The money raised will be used in the manner below:

85% | Developing + Printing the first-edition print of "I GRAB THE MIC"

15% | Funding "I GRAB THE MIC" virtual storytime reading, coloring book, recordable mic keychain, and custom stickers.

THE IMPACT


AUTHENTIC DIVERSITY: According to the Children's Book Diversity Council, less than 10% of children's books in 2018 featured a Black person as the main character. And, half of the books featuring Black characters as leads are not written by Black people. Making matters worse, there are 3x as many books published featuring animals in the U.S. than those centering Black, Latinx, Asian, Native American and African children COMBINED! Let's help to change this. 

A HARMFUL MYTH in the publishing world is that people just don't dig into their pockets to support creators of color in a real way that'll justify printing and publishing their works on a large scale.

Let's prove them wrong and show that diverse books of all kinds deserve a place on the shelf.

GOALS & CHALLENGES

Traditional Publishing: Our #1 goal for this book is to prove its worth in financial and community support to win a traditional publisher. We want every kid to have easy access to this story nationwide. The best way we can do this is by making a big enough "splash" during this campaign so publishers are willing to give this picture book an honest look.

Being Evergreen: It is critical that we build a true and lasting community to expand the lifespan of this work. Any referrals for storytime readings (virtual now, and later, in-person) plus book purchases for schools, libraries, and organizations will be incredibly helpful!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP BESIDES $$$

Every purchase, referral, and mention amongst your network truly matters. In addition to fueling this mission financially, please help us out by sharing the word amongst your social and personal circles! We're more effective together and need your help.

Sincerely,

Malik, Paige, Jesse & Serita
 

Follow the Campaign on Social Media!

Any referrals for storytime readings (virtual now, and later, in-person) plus book purchases for schools, libraries, and organizations will be incredibly helpful!OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP BESIDES $$$Every purchase, referral, and mention amongst your network truly matters. In addition to fueling this mission financially, please help us out by sharing the word amongst your social and personal circles! We're more effective together and need your help.Sincerely,Malik, Paige, Jesse & Serita Follow the Campaign on Social Media!

story:
Book Summary

"The sea is calling, answer your heart."

Ava’s life is thrown into a tailspin when she not only moves in with the family who hopes to adopt her, but also as she experiences mysterious changes.

First, she sees glimmering tattoos all over her body and then she starts experiencing excruciating pain when her skin touches water. Her social worker, Nerissa knows more about Ava than she should, and she eventually gives Ava three items that help her uncover her true identity. As Ava learns more about herself and her past, she must decide, stay with the family she’s growing to love or return to the family that gave her up as a child. Ava’s only hoped for one thing her entire life, a family to accept and welcome her.

Now faced with the indecision of who to choose, Ava’s life and the life of her loved ones are in danger, and all at the hand of someone near to her heart.

About Project Glimmer

This debut YA novel follows a young girl’s need to be loved and accepted. Yet the protagonist discovers that her own strength and identity are all she ever needed.

With similarities to The Girl the Sea Gave Back, by Adrienne Young, and Water So Deep, by Nichole Giles, you’ll find a story of a brave teen who learns to embrace herself and who steps into her rightful role.

Note: Project Glimmer will be released in two episodes (shorter books that will later be bound up together as one completed novel). This campaign if completely funded will 100% fund the first episode, which is what you'll get access to depending on your tier.

Amanda Creek is currently attending Southern New Hampshire University to obtain her Master of Fine Arts in Creative Writing, where she's working on this novel for her Thesis project. When she's not writing, Amanda operates her business where she helps creative female entrepreneurs share their creative talent and skills through online marketing efforts. 

Follow me online:

View my website here. Follow me on Instagram here.

Why I'm Pre-Selling My Book This Way

I've decided to go the self-publishing route instead of the traditional publishing route, as I believe that my years in business will help me market my books well. But with self-publishing, it can be difficult to get that first book off the ground. Here's why I've decided to pre-sell my book in a crowdfunding campaign:

  • There are costs that occur when you self-publish books, and while I can cut corners as much as possible, there are a few one-time costs that will help set my career up for success if I purchase them in the beginning.  For example, there's a software called Vellum Press that will help me to format my books myself. This program will help me format all my books for years to come. By helping me through this campaign, I'll be able to acquire this program and other necessities that  will make self-publishing so much easier.
  • With pre-selling my book this way, I'm setting my book up for much bigger success than just posting it to Amazon and crossing my fingers. My goal with this campaign is to get my book out and into the hands of readers (aka - you!) right away. 
  • By sharing my book in this way, I also get to create a lot of cool stuff to go along with it (such as bookmarks, enamel pins, and book totes). These additional perks probably wouldn't come to fruition until much later in my publishing journey without a campaign like this. Not only will this campaign push me to create all these fun perks in the first place, but it also helps me to create the buzz necessary to launch a book in a fun and exciting way. By creating this book merchandise, I can also do things like giveaways on my social media.
  • If I don't reach my goal amount, the funds I do raise here will go strictly to editing Episode 1 and getting character art created.

What Your Contributions Help Me To Do

With your contributions, I'll be able to self-publish the first episode of my story by being able to pay for the following costs:

  • Pay for a developmental edit and a copy edit of the first two episodes (Estimated cost: $1,500)
  • Pay for the character art that will go on my covers and on all my book merchandise (Estimated cost: $900)
  • Purchase the ISBNs for my paperback books (Cost: $295)
  • Purchase a copy of Vellum Press to help me format my books (Cost: $250, this is a one-time cost that will be beneficial to my entire author career)
  • Pay for printing of all paperback books, book merchandise, and to pay for shipping to get these perks to you

Risks & Challenges

In this section, I want to share with you the risk and challenges that I may face with publishing and launching and what that means for you as an individual contributing to this campaign:

  • Challenge #1 - I want the first episode of my book edited and ready for publication by January 2021.
    • The challenge with this is that if I can't get enough funds to pay for the editing, then I will have to delay the publication date.
    • The good news is that I've already secured my editors and that the cost is reasonable.
    • I have this campaign, along with other avenues to help gather the funds to make this happen. I don't expect there to be any delays, but you never know.
  • Challenge #2 - If I don't get the full amount that I'm asking for with this campaign, the second episode will definitely be delayed for publication. 
    • ​Because this campaign is primarily to help me launch the first episode, the second episode isn't my primary focus. But any delays to episode one will significantly delay the second episode.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone can contribute financially, but there are other ways that you can help! The things listed below will help more than you can ever imagine...

  • Share with your friends and followers on all your social accounts. The more people that see this campaign, the closer I'll get to reaching my goal. You can easily share the campaign by clicking on the share tools at the top of this page.
  • Leave a review when you do read my book. If you decide to wait until my book is published to pick up your own copy, please help me out by leaving a review on Amazon or Goodreads. These reviews help me out by letting other readers know that you enjoyed my book, plus it makes my book easier to find when people search on Amazon and other sites.

Thank you so, so much!

I understand that not everyone can contribute financially, but there are other ways that you can help! The things listed below will help more than you can ever imagine...

Share with your friends and followers on all your social accounts. The more people that see this campaign, the closer I'll get to reaching my goal. You can easily share the campaign by clicking on the share tools at the top of this page.

These reviews help me out by letting other readers know that you enjoyed my book, plus it makes my book easier to find when people search on Amazon and other sites.

story:
Welcome to Wonder Valley

You might have passed through there, maybe. Out for a drive with time on your hands you might have noticed the abandoned homestead shacks crumbling along a grid of dirt tracks scraped into this corner of the Mojave Desert. Wonder Valley. It’s a place peopled by a menagerie of misfits and miscreants, artists and retirees, methheads and the otherwise marginalized. They live in the derelict cabins, fixing them up, some, or just making do in others. And while most landed here because it’s cheap—the cheapest real estate in all of California--that’s not what they’d tell you. They’d tell you they came looking for a freedom elsewhere unavailable or to escape the conformist pressures of mainstream America. They’d say they came for the changing colors of the desert sunsets or some sense of authenticity, bedrock, the real deal, life and death and heat and grit.

I myself came to Wonder Valley to investigate the death of Ricka McGuire, on assignment, ostensibly, with a magazine distributed on the streets of Denver by the homeless. Really, though, I felt drawn to this place. My life was falling apart—I’d lost a fortune in the Great Recession, my marriage was inexplicably unbearable, and my own sense of self had become vacuous, empty. I felt an outcast in my own skin. In Wonder Valley, though, I sensed a kinship with those I met. They walked the edge of an abyss out there, an abyss I felt drawn to, one I needed to peer down into.

Ricka McGuire’s story had struck me as wildly outlandish at first. She’d lived in a broken-down school bus, no electricity or running water. Aged and destitute, she succumbed to the heat. That someone could die so easily here in America, in California of all places, shocked me. How could anyone let this happen?

From that first encounter, though, Wonder Valley had a hold on me. I found it haunting and otherworldly, almost unbelievable in its strangeness. It was like a lost island, a desert Galapagos in a sea of sand. I appointed myself its Darwin. In its isolation a people had evolved, a breed apart from mainstream society, many of them living like Ricka, on this edge, walking that dangerous precipice between life and death.

I spent years in Wonder Valley immersed in and documenting the resilience and humanity of these people in the face of mental illness, alcoholism, poverty, and neglect, until the line between my reporting on and becoming one of them blurred. As a microcosm of society, Wonder Valley suffered the economic tides flowing across the country most acutely. The people’s tenuous existence there coupled with the pervading media and political rhetoric exacerbated the deep, unending unease washing over America. Like the rest of us, the people out there had all seen the bottom drop out of the economy and a great uncertainty fill the void. Those who had anything at all worried about losing it, their incomes, their homes, their health. Many became mired in the sense that should they fall, they may never get back up. As a reaction, the artists and retirees and society’s forgotten each bunkered into separate communities, members limiting themselves to those of their own, avoiding and even disparaging as illegitimate the lives of the others, leading to the most extreme of economic outcomes: Survival on the backs of the weak.

WELCOME TO WONDER VALLEY is a completed manuscript ready to be published as a book. In the vein of Hillbilly Elegy and the work of Michael Perry and writers like William Vollman, Ted Conover, and William Finnegan, it explores a darker side of the American dream, a side so pervasive, yet so largely unacknowledged by major media. Interwoven with the memoir of my own fall and recovery from financial and personal crises, the book looks at life in a place where the safety net barely exists and falling through the cracks is too often fatal.

 

About the Me

Prior to embarking on this project, I worked as a day laborer, a handyman, and in a guitar factory. I ran an environmental consulting firm, a restaurant, huge call centers, and hired, trained, and mentored hundreds of employees. I also made and lost a fortune in real estate, casting me into the downward spiral that sparked this Wonder Valley odyssey.

An avid traveler, I have visited more than forty countries on five continents. I’ve crossed the equator by plane, boat, bus, and on foot. I’ve battled forty-foot seas in a thirty-five-foot sailboat, been chased by a wild orangutan in a Sumatran jungle, stared into the black pupil of a rebel Kalashnikov in the rainforest of Guatemala.  

I received an M.F.A. in Creative Nonfiction and Screenwriting from UC Riverside where I was mentored by L.A. Times Book Critic and notable author David Ulin.  My work has appeared in magazines and anthologies including the Denver Voice and Best American Nonrequired Reading. I currently live between Wonder Valley and Orange County, California

Praise:

“William Hillyard is an insightful writer who wields all the best writer’s weapons—close observation, a natural fearlessness, and endless curiosity—to evoke with brilliance and beauty this strange yet telling spot on the Western map.”

—Amy Wilentz, Professor of Literary Journalism, University of California, Irvine, and author of Farewell, Fred Voodoo: A Letter From Haiti, among other books. 

 

“[California writing] is at its best, for me, when the authors treat California as a character rather than set dressing. William Hillyard does just that in “Wonder Valley” when he recounts the tale of Ned Bray and the end of Ricka McGuire in this nowhere corner of the Mojave. Part anecdote, part history lesson, Hillyard transports you so thoroughly in his descriptions that you’ll need to drink a glass of water when you finish.”

         —Justice Fisher, Hippocampus Magazine.

 

 “Reading Hillyard's story, it's not hard to see why the work of literary nonfiction got the [Best American Nonrequired Reading] nod. "Wonder Valley" depicts a forlorn corner of the Mojave Desert in California populated by outcasts and drifters and opens with a bang—a cinematic panorama of this desolate wasteland that ends on the nude, dead body of a woman lying in the dilapidated school bus that was her home.”

            —Joel Warner, Westword Magazine.

story:
You are helping me reach my project budget of $15,000. Please enjoy the book and other offerings for your contribution.  

Where your money goes:

Your funds will help produce, print and ship the book to people who need it the most. 200 copies of the first printing will be donated to 20 different hospice centers and grief-support groups throughout the United States.

Your funds will help bring the companion website, TheGriefPractice.com, online and available as an interactive, 24-hour support that will give an ongoing voice to grief through human stories and offer practice videos that support grief in the body.

What is so unique about the book?

The Grief Practice applies modern movement science and neuroscience to the ancient practices of yoga and mindfulness in an uncomplicated and beautiful way, creating an accessible path to grief through yoga designed to welcome grief. The Stories section delivers comfort, compassion, and hope through other stories of survival and invites the reader to open to it as they are ready.

The book peels back the layers of the most feared emotion along the spectrum of being human - grief - and proposes a way to welcome it back to the table of public life, right between love and joy. It invites the reader to become part of the story by adding their experience, feelings, and photos to blank and lined pages, thereby turning a book that holds other peoples' stories into a book that holds their story.

Part I: The Stories

Part I of the book gives grief a voice through the stories of twenty-one humans who have lost a loved one in death. Photographs and hand-drawn art accompany the stories so as to most accurately convey the storyteller’s unedited heart.

These stories are raw and beautiful. They are both tragic and so full of hope.

There are blank and lined pages for the reader to write in their own story, to add their photos or mementos, because it is meant to come alive in their hands.

Part II: The Practices

Part II of the book is trauma-sensitive yoga and mindfulness practices specific to grief laid out over three chapters.

Chapter 1, Grief In The Body, takes the reader on a tour through grief in the body, breaking down concepts of neuroscience and movement science into relatable, comprehensible bites, creating a framework for exploring grief in the body that feels both safe and supportive.

Chapter 2, Organs Of Grief, highlights five different organs in the body, exploring their scientific and energetic components as it relates to grief. They are accompanied by hand-detailed art that speaks to both the anatomy and energy these organs hold. There is a “Map Your Own Grief” section where the reader can explore grief in their own body and map what shows up and how it changes from day to day.

Chapter 3, Yoga, invites the reader to explore the practices of yoga and mindfulness through a trauma-sensitive lens, beginning with an explanation of anchors and how to use them both on and off the yoga mat. There is a section of supported, still shapes and practices and a section on active, moving shapes because sometimes in our grief we need stillness and sometimes in our grief we need movement.

Who am I?

My name is Monique Minahan. I am a registered yoga teacher in Carlsbad, California. For the last several years I have been piecing together an approach to grief through yoga, informed by research on trauma in the body and neuroscience, that welcomes it and acknowledges the innate healing ability of every human being and every human body.

For the last decade I have been motivated to create a book that would be a soft place for grief to land and feel its way through the dark, nonlinear process of healing and living with loss.  

This is that book.

www.moniqueminahan.com

I need your support.

Every little bit helps. Whatever you can contribute or however you can spread the word is needed and appreciated. Deep gratitude for your support.

Gratitudes:

To the humans who helped make the video :

videographer/cinematographer- Jeff Trujillo

timelapse footage - Thomas Close

yogis - Kevin, Erin, Brianna, Kasey, Suzy, Kim, Sandy, Sophie, Drew, Ted. 

art - Jacqueline Washle
