story:
About Us:

Suzanne Paschall, Indie Ink Publishing  

Hi, I'm Suzanne Paschall, founder of Indie Ink Publishing, a small company in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, Canada. I'm here to introduce to you a very special book written by a very special lady.  

But first, a little about us so you know where we're coming from and why we are pitching together with Treena. Indie Ink is three years old, and in that time, we have collaboratively published 7 titles with some really fresh authors who, while they are are from our province, have ideas and content that expand far beyond our prairie borders. 

We work in a wonderful creative and business partnership with our authors (like Treena, who you'll meet in the video here) which means we take equal risk with them, either financially on in-kind in services they provide, and then we share equally in the rewards. Everyone on the book project team brings all of their creative and business experience to the table and we all benefit from our various kinds of expertise. We bring our editorial, marketing, new book forms and distribution expertise to the table, and our authors bring not only their book content and author profiles, but in many cases their own sets of other skills. 

Treena Wynes, Author, Eating Myself Crazy

Treena Wynes is an amazing person. I call her one of those "angels on earth". She doesn't know she is, but I do. She moves through life bringing a peaceful feeling to those around her. She makes you feel good just by being in her aura. She has been through hell, more than once, in more than one way, and she has slogged through it. And she's done something even more amazing: she's come through it with the most positive attitude I've ever seen. She's made it her business to help other people. But not in a preachy, annoying way. In a sweet, quiet, funny, sometimes goofy, always diva-devoid Treena-way. She's a mom, a wife, a friend, a counsellor, a survivor, an activist and now, soon to be, an author. 

I invite you to meet Treena up close and personal in the pitch video...there's a good chance you'll be able to relate to some of the people featured...

About the Book:

Writing about this journey and putting down her tips, and recipes and tidbits of information into this tidy book along with her own graphic and personal story is the personification of Treena herself: it's sweet, funny, honest and...ultimately, helpful and hopeful.

First, Treena tells her own story, no holds barred. It's graphic, and as true as true gets. Then, she shares information in easy to understand portion sizes about a number of eating-related issues that she found confusing and complex. She then provides a number of tips and recipes and even provides journal space for readers to make their own comments and plans for their healthy future.

What We Hope:

I believe this book is going to help a lot of people. Not just people who have terrible eating disorders, bless them, but so many of us who struggle daily with emotional eating issues--as we say in the marketing material: those of us who, having had a crappy week with the job and the kids and who knows what else, come home on Friday and shovel down an extra-large bag of nacho chips and polish it off with a pint of Rocky Road. We know who we are. We feel like ARGH after, and we don't know why.

Well, Treena does, and this book is for anyone (male, female; older, younger) who understands that scenario or any like it. There are a lot of books in this category by authorities (doctors, nurses, nutritionists, dieticians, researchers), and these are very valuable...but Treena wanted to write something from a different perspective: something that wasn't intimidating and so overwhelming and complex to someone who was already confused, scared and suffering. So Eating Myself Crazy is purposely NOT any of those things.

Where Your Money Will Go:

1.  Book design & printing 

2.  Marketing materials (bookmarks, posters for bookstore promotion)

3.  Launch event costs

4.  Marketing/publicity costs 

Book making and marketing is an increasingly expensive enterprise and (you may not know this) a really difficult business to actually make money at. In particular for a small indie publisher with no deep pockets (unlike a Random House or S&S), as we don't have months to wait for the orders that are taken when we publish a book to finally end up in cheques on our doorstep. Book selling is basically a consignment business...Retailers and wholesalers order our books and we ship them, but they don't actually PAY us for them for months, sometimes up to half a year or longer, for those books. And then, if they don't sell them, they return them.

And as we share equally in our profits with our authors, the more successful our marketing efforts are, the more successful the book is, and the more successful we and our authors are. 

Most importantly, the message of hope and inspiration that is Treena's goal only gets to the most people possible if our distribution, sales, marketing and publicity efforts are successful.

Your contributions help with ALL of that!

Other Ways You Can Connect or Help:

1.  Refer the campaign to your friends/colleagues

2.  Leave us a comment!

3.  Share the campaign URL on your Facebook page.

4.  Tweet out your support and the URL on Twitter!

5. Give a "LIKE" to Eating Myself Crazy Facebook page (see links!)

6. Join the Moody Foodys tribe and find out ways you can continue to be involved with Treena and her projects - and even have an opportunity to share your stories in future Eating Myself Crazy books!

story:
Short Summary

The ground gave way. There was a burst of fire like dragon’s breath, and I fell.

I don’t remember landing, only silence and darkness. We were in a cave, the ceiling lit by blue phosphorescence. For a long time, I just lay there, too stunned to move or breathe. I remember coughing, drawing air into lungs gone tingly with pins and needles. It burned like dying and then coming back to life. Something nearby was drip-drip-dripping into a puddle near my head. There were other people breathing, and a few sniffles. Something terrible had happened.

--Joanna Sanderson, Dragon Breath Part One: Pawns

Joanna Sanderson didn't have high expectations for her junior year. Between overly critical teachers and her natural impulse for mayhem, all Jo could count on was detention, a handful of smoke bombs, and a passing grade won by the skin of her teeth.

She certainly didn't expect to be kidnapped by dragons.

Now she and her classmates are caught in a game of intrigue and trapped on an alien world. The Dragon Queen wants the kids to become her riders...and the others want human as their very next meal. But if anybody can make it home, it'll be the girl that pranked the entire Junior Prom. It says don't mettle in the affairs of dragons...but the dragons aren't giving Jo a choice.

Maybe they should have said something about messing with Joanna Sanderson.

Dragon Breath is a YA fantasy adventure written by me, myself and I. My name is Chelsea Gaither. I've self published eleven novella leingth books in the past year, with mild-to-moderate success.

With Dragon Breath, I'm trying to take things to the next professional level. I promised my readers this book would be professionally edited, and it is. The first third, Part One: Pawns, has been edited, fully prepaired, and will be published on August 5th, 2013.

But this is where you come in.

What We Need & What You Get

I dressed up as a fictional girl, rather than a fictional me, to say I am not like you. I am not more special or more brilliant or rich or beautiful or whatever, but I am not like you. I am not a tool. I am not a breeder.

I put glue in the bubble machines because making a statement blows when no one is looking.

--Joanna Sanderson, Part One: Pawns

Editing is expensive. I'm a 27 year old waitress in South Texas. The next third, Part Two: Knights, will cost just under 500 dollars to edit. My personal resources are tapped, and with tourist season ending, I know I won't be able to afford to edit the other two thirds of Dragon Breath. Without your help, I'll be breaking a promise to my readers. And I never break those promises

I need $500 in 30 days. This money would go towards editing Dragon's Breath, Part two: Knights. Anything left over would go towads editing Part Three: Queens. 

In return, you will get an e-copy of Part Two. Even if all you give me is a dollar. You help fund the book, you get a copy of the book. Donate more, and it goes up.

Five dollars gets both Part one and Part two.

Donate ten dollars, and you get all three parts, delivered on publication.

Fifteen dollars, you get all of Dragon Breath, as well as an omnibus of a previously released sci-fi series, Starbleached.
 
Twenty dollars, you get all of Dragon Breath, the sci-fi omnibus and my previously published urban fantasy series omnibus, Silver Bullet, Black Hounds: The Exiles Omnibus.
 
Fifty dollars gets everything above, plus a signed 10 by 15 print of Dragon Breath's cover art.
 
100 dollars gets everything above, plus a signed 20 by 30 art print of Joanna Sanderson with the Dragon Queen.
 
And just for reading this and watching the video, you get a free copy of Starbleached. Drop on over to Smashwords.com and use this coupon: MP72H

Of course, there's always the chance I won't meet the goal. Well, even $200 would help. All money raised by this campaign will go to finance books, be it two dollars or two hundred thousand dollars. It won't go to cookies, or burgers, or rent money.

The Impact

“How could you stand it? We’re living a fantasy novel. Why would you want to be reminded?” Christie said.

Silence as we all considered this.

“Because someday, we’re not going to be in high school anymore,” Billy said. “We’re going to be sitting behind a desk or pushing a broom or giving someone stitches, or doing something else that our parents and grandparents called important. We’re gonna realize that other than learning, school is really just place-holding, and that all the fashion statements we can make are really just cookie-cutter emblems in a factory world. And we’re going to remember this.” He stood up and walked a bit farther toward the star. Then he turned around and raised both arms to the sky. “We’re here. Under this neon periwinkle sky. We got dragged here, yeah, but we got dragged on dragonback. We’re on a quest, guys. We’re following our own goddamned star. And one day when we’re home and we’ve got coffee and faucets and indoor plumbing, we’re gonna know that we did it. We were here. All six of us.”

--Dragon Breath Part One: Pawns


"Fairy Tales don't teach Children that Dragons exist. Children already know that Dragons Exist. Fairy Tales teach Children that Dragons can be killed."

--Paraphrase of G.K. Chesterton.


Stories are important. They run deeper than we know. I don't pretend to be a great writer, but I do hope that I am a good one...at minimum, good enough to give hope to a handful of dragonslayers who need it.

I come from a background that includes addiction, recovery, insanity and mental health. I beleive that stories, even poorly written ones, have their greatest value not in the content itself, but in the seeds they plant in the minds and hearts of readers. Sometimes the seeds are good, sometimes they're bad. My goal with this project is to plant more positive seeds than negative ones, to portray healthy relationships, or recovery from toxic ones.

And also tell a damn good fantasy story.

I have released 11 books, 12 if you're reading this after August 5th. I have delayed a promised release date exactly once, when I moved Dragon Breath's release date from July 17th to August 5th, to give the editor time to work. By supporting this project you are supporting quality in independant and self-publishing. You are supporting the dreams of a Texas waitress, and you are supporting the readers, both now and in the future, who will read and be touched by the story in Dragon Breath and in my other projects.

I will make this project happen. What I cannot do is make this project a strong success without the help and support of people like you.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know feast and I know famine. I know not everyone can afford to give even one dollar. Here are ways you can help:

Spread the word on your social networking sites. Tumblr, Twitter, Facebook, the works. Send links to the project to sci-fi and fantasy fans.

Download Starbleached from Smashwords and talk about it. It's a sample of my self-edited work, it's free, and it's the fan favorite. It's my gift to you guys just for reading this.

Join in the conversations I have at my blog, and hang around for updates on projects, art discussion and snarky book reviews.

Ask me questions! I love answering questions, and you can probably get me to talk about things I didn't think were very important to this pitch. I'll even keep a FAQ list going here.

Oh. And Use the Indiegogo share tools.


(They told me to tell you that last one)

story:
Hello Rad Dad supporter!

I am writing with some exciting news. Rad Dad is just about to release its 24th issue this June; it’s one of the best issues so far. 

However, I have been thinking about retiring Rad Dad at the 25th issue. But as I shared the idea with a few close friends, they encouraged me to re-consider that decision, perhaps to even try something different, something bigger. To move from being a zine to being a magazine.

And, yeah, I do want to expand the reach of Rad Dad, broadening the community of parents we have worked to create. I want Rad Dad in bookstores and grocery stores across the country, in small towns and big cities.  

Some things will change.  But what won't change is this: 

  • Rad Dad will still be submission based.
  • Rad Dad will remain rad as in radical, not cool
  • Rad Dad will continue to present a wide range of voices and experiences, challenging the mainstream stereotypical representation of fatherhood.
  • Rad Dad will always need you.

So with that said, I am unveiling the new incarnation of Rad Dad:

Rad Dad, a Zine for Rad Dads, Hip Mamas, and Everyone In-between.

Beginning with issue 25, I want a redesigned look, modeled after magazines that inspire me like Bitch, Hip Mama and Hyphen. To do so, I will need a graphic designer, a small collective of editors, subscription options, but most of all – you.

I will need your help!  Here’s how...

What We Need & What You Get

I need $10,000 to pay for a graphic designer to create a new look for Rad Dad, cover the initial printing costs in order to increase our distribution, and to pay a small stipend to contributors and editors for their work.

When you donate to the campaign, you will have your choice of gifts: amazing diy zines, publications, tote bags and t-shirts carrying the Rad Dad message. They are full of the authentic voices and stories that have made Rad Dad so popular.

We're going forward with the relaunch of Rad Dad this coming December.  Every dollar you contribute will help us along the way.  Be part of our Rad Dad family and join us in expanding the community we all want to be a part of!

The Impact

You will be supporting a publication that is truly one of a kind—and helping build a unique community. Only in Rad Dad will you find the voices of so many diverse and marginalized fathers and families: queer fathers, poor fathers, punk fathers, feminist fathers, fathers of color, trans fathers.

Rad Dad has a proven track record of consistently publishing independent reader contributed stories and essays about the pain, politics, and pleasures of radical parenting. Help us share our stories with a wider audience.  

To get a better sense of where Rad Dad has been and what it tries to do check out this Father's Day edition of "Making Contact."

Other Ways You Can Help

Write for Rad Dad: For now, you can email Tomas Moniz -- tomas dot moniz at gmail dot com -- with the word "submission" in the subject line. Please allow several months for a response at this time.

Ask for Rad Dad at any place that carries books or print publications!

Spread the word:  like us on Facebook, share our campaign...

story:
Short Summary

Adam and Solomon books wants to help brilliant and unique achievements in the art go noticed.

Solomon Books is a unique fringe science website offering authors a way to print, publish, sell their books 'in the arts' started in December 2012. 

It was started by Adam Bull, an author of a unique book called Technology For a New Future.

Technology For a New Future 2nd edition

In Aug-Dec 2012 Technology For a New Future was published by Adam's small startup publishing company - Solomon Books. Adam is trying to raise funds for a small book publishing label "SOLOMON BOOKS" that would allow other authors like himself to publish their work. To start things off Adam has proposed to reprint his first edition in a second edition print run of this book. By raising $8000 here at indiegogo Adam plans to print 500 copies of his Technology For a New Future book. He knows that each one can retail at $100 and the audience generally is interested in the work that he has sold out of the previous book, but last time Adam only printed 20. This time he will print 500. 

If you can help adam do this that means he will make $100 on 500 books and raise a total of $50,000 to get his livelyhood running.

"The scientific man does not aim at an immediate result. He does not expect that his advanced ideas will be readily taken up. His work is like that of the planter — for the future. His duty is to lay the foundation for those who are to come, and point the way. He lives and labors and hopes" – Nikola Tesla



About Adam Bull

Adam used to work for a company called British Forces Broadcasting Service contracting for the Ministry of Defense at British Forces News and has previously founded small telecoms businesses in London Docklands, as well as authoring Technology For a New Future he is a prolific musician that produces unique artistic works that can be seen at freewaremusic.com. Working at Sega for a brief time as Penetration Tester Europe, Adam is an experienced IT consultant and technical network engineer, and has sacrificed much of his time and heart to the thing that he loved most. 'The art'. He gave up work for a year just to write the book that he just believed in.

Adam Bull has always dreamed - and always asked why? It's landed him in trouble before. He has no money and is unemployed, but he is working towards worthwhile endeavors that would at least try to benefit humanity and preserve it's great art.

What are you doing today? Really? Are you happy?


"While I have not lost faith in its potentialities, my views have changed since. War can not be avoided until the physical cause for its recurrence is removed and this, in the last analysis, is the vast extent of the planet on which we live. Only though annihilation of distance in every respect, as the conveyance of intelligence, transport of passengers and supplies and transmission of energy will conditions be brought about some day, insuring permanency of friendly relations. What we now want most is closer contact and better understanding between individuals and communities all over the earth and the elimination of that fanatic devotion to exalted ideals of national egoism and pride, which is always prone to plunge the world into primeval barbarism and strife. No league or parliamentary act of any kind will ever prevent such a calamity. These are only new devices for putting the weak at the mercy of the strong." - Nikola Tesla, My Inventions (1919)


Why Solomon?

A dedication to brilliance 


By raising this $8000 for the 2nd edition of my book I will be able to generate $50,000 of cash for the company to market and produce more books, Adam's dedication to this world is Solomon Books - the book company representing all that is bizarre, unique, strange, and far out amazing-cool. Solomon Books is a place for brilliant and unrecognised achievements in the art.


"Ere many generations pass, our machinery will be driven by a power obtainable at any point of the universe. This idea is not novel. Men have been led to it long ago by instinct or reason; it has been expressed in many ways, and in many places, in the history of old and new. We find it in the delightful myth of Antheus, who derives power from the earth; we find it among the subtle speculations of one of your splendid mathematicians and in many hints and statements of thinkers of the present time. Throughout space there is energy. Is this energy static or kinetic! If static our hopes are in vain; if kinetic — and this we know it is, for certain — then it is a mere question of time when men will succeed in attaching their machinery to the very wheelwork of nature." – Nikola Tesla, February 1892 - "Experiments With Alternate Currents of High Potential and High Frequency"

Solomon Books


We have already have a printing company, we already published Technology For a New Future First Edition, selling out of all 20 copies. There was supposed to be 33, but the author was too poor to afford it all. The author gave up work for a year to produce his first book and setup Solomon Books.

The Author did this because he believes he can make a difference to the way the world looks at sciences and the arts. Adam, being a musician, a technical consultant and a programmer felt he might be the right person for the job - he has taken the chance, and the plunge, and now he needs your help to help the cause of the Technology For a New Future


I, Adam Bull, set up solomon-books for the people. But most of all to carry the lost legacy of the work of 3 important unthanked men:

  1. Edward Leedskalnin
  2. Nikola Tesla
  3. Eric Dollard

 

 

"The mind is sharper and keener in seclusion and uninterrupted solitude. No big laboratory is needed in which to think. Originality thrives in seclusion free of outside influences beating upon us to cripple the creative mind. Be alone, that is the secret of invention; be alone, that is when ideas are born. That is why many of the earthly miracles have had their genesis in humble surroundings." – Nikola Tesla

It wasn't easy

"When I wrote the book Technology For a New Future, I knew it would not be easy. There is no other book in existence like it. I only could afford to print 24 of them instead of the 33 that I wanted to in the first edition."

"I am lucky enough to still have 4 copies of the first edition which are available for purchase on this campaign. These are unique books professionally produced, and they will be collectors items in time to come."

"I have sold out of the 1st edition but at indiegogo campaign people have a unique opportunity to become a part of what Solomon Books is doing. You have a remarkable opportunity to obtain a unique book and make a unique difference to the arts and technology world world today that is befitting of King Solomon himself"

"I setup this company to remove all of the elitist and commercial unfairness in authoring. Whatdya think about that? I'm the little guy. I've already helped Eric Dollard, my partner donated $1000 to him herself. We don't have much money but we are trying to help art and technology - what we call "the arts". I wonder can you help us?"

"The campaign is to fund a 500 copy print of the 2nd edition of my book (500 copies) which have a retail value of $50,000 towards this cause, to fund and design electrical systems and books such as those produced by Eric Dollard and myself. IF we can do this it could change the world - finally unique individuals would have a place where they could be rewarded. And unique and talented men would have a place and a conduit to exhaust their talent. That is what I wanted Solomon Books to be. Whatcha think about that?"

It is so important we get some help so that we can publish these 500 books , if you can raise the $8000 we can raise the other $42,000 just by selling our work, this will give us enough money to invest in other peoples work and advertiose the book company and cause, these rare and unique books on Electrical Theory & Ancient Civilisations must have a market because I couldn't afford hardly any advertising and I sold $2000 of book in just 1 month. I know this can work.

"For me to do this full time and get this work out their available I am going to have to earn more than £600/year. People need to help me do it if they want it, otherwise people like me can't live and we are destitute, or otherwise in a position where we have money but no time for the art. I have the time and the courage and the tenacity and the books and experiments I have written - give me the money and I will continue give you all the time in the world I ever had - I want to make the world a better place. I know I can, if enough people listen and help."


Are you an author? email adam at adam@solomon-books.com to get a reading for your book and a quote!

What We Need & What You Get

After a successful first edition we need to print more than just 24 copies in a 2nd edition of our first published book Technology For a New Future. The total cost for 500 copies of a 555 page full colour book is about $8000.00

If you contribute $500 or more to this campaign we will send you the first edition of Technology For a New Future as a big thank you, which retailed at $100 until it sold out between DEC 2012 - JAN 2013.

  1. We are hoping for an other sellout as demand for the our 1st edition book has been surprisingly high. Solomon Books needs your help to raise the money for a 2nd edition to offer:
  2. You are buying into a unique service that never existed before in the world for small-authors.
  3.  Assure the career of a young artist, musician, technician and author who has ventured to believe in a better future, and write about it.

The Impact

No organisation like Solomon Books has ever existed. (Occult & New Age Bookstore & Online Publisher)

Technology For a New Future 1st edition retailed at $100 + P&P , sold 20 copies in just 1 month, and raised a significant amount of money, over $2000.00 . Unfortunately the author was not attempting to make money and the costs associated with printing and selling just 20 books only amounted to about £600 profit. The author and founder of Solomon Books and Technology For a New Future had to give up work for a year to produce the book and setup the business. Solomon books had been trading since Dec 2012 as a sole trader, and by helping Adam you can increase the number to 500 book prints which is significantly more profitable for author and would allow Solomon Books to compete with other leading titles in volume.

"We cannot do it without you - the impact would be huge." - Adam Bull






"Today's scientists have substituted mathematics for experiments, and they wander off through equation after equation, and eventually build a structure which has no relation to reality" – The World by Nikola Tesla, Modern Mechanics" – Jul 1934

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Tell friends and family about Solomon Books and Technology For a New Future, Nikola Tesla, Eric Dollard &  Edward Leedskalnin

Bring your 'fringe science' book work to us, because we are in a position today to help - and we can make the difference - and that’s all there is to it.

 

Words from the author


When I first started writing Technology For a New Future I had no idea what I had re-discovered, I should say re-discovered. I did not know that earthquakes produced about a million amperes of electricity underneath the ground when an electrical apparatus above the ground shook the ground violently enough at the correct standing wave ratio. Imagine faster than light transmitters, gravity transmitter telescopes and curving light with an electromagnet and you are still not close to the profoundness of TEchnology For a New Future.

In my book I re-discovered that mass does not produce radioactivity, that light is not primary, that electrons can turn around 180 degrees and go back into the conductor they are leaving. and that they are 2 different currents other than A.C and D.C. That is there are different forms of electricity that exist other than what you can read on the multimeter. Like the electricity from hydroelectricity in the ocean - for instance - that comes from the moon - wirelessly, and then it turns into a moving ocean, and then it drives a dynamo to make electricity in a hydro-electric power station. 

Tesla found a way to stand in between. That is what the Technology For a NEw Future is about. But that is just to start. Things like radiocarbon dating, and the decay of mass being controlled by external cosmic rays from other planets, stars, etc? It changes the nature of all science, even archaelogical forensic science needs to be adjusted.

My book is the begining of this revolutionary theory of Nuclear Physics. Light is not primary to stars, Mass does not produce it's own radioactivity. Radium when sufficiently shielded from the rays of the stars stops emitting radioactive rays - these are just the beginnings of the statements of Nikola Tesla and Eric Dollard. This is what the author writes about and is most knowledgable on the subject of, and this is why he has started Solomon Books. There was no other place for Adam. He like many others is an outcast, a rebel, but he is also a scientist a technical it consultant, a hacker who has worked for SEGA and a competent engineer.

I had absolutely no idea that my book would be so well received, or that my book would contain a myriad of information about the coral castle mystery that will not be found anywhere else in the world. Much fo the information is new which made it a 'cult classic' with many engineers and organisations around the world. Even the King of Hawaii was interested.

The truth is I am sorry - I just want to help people. Earn enough money to live, eat, and be warm, but most of all - to express myself and help other like minded individuals be able to do the same.

It could be a very long time (perhaps 20 or 30 years) until your book is worth something but If I am right and Einstein got it wrong about the speed of light then the work that I have catalogued will be very valuable to humanity in the future as a unique collectors item of priceless renown - who would have thought that wheatstone, tesla, dollard and leedskalnin would give the speed of light as pi / 2 * C. That is 1.57 times the speed of light that modern physics assumes to be the maximum.

Every day the moon uses some sort of wireless wave form (a bit like wi fi :) ) to move the trillions of watts of energy in the ocean from side to side. Instead of powering a machine from the ocean that is effected by the invisible wireless wave, Tesla, Leedskalnin and the pyramid builders found a way to intercept that invisible wireless cosmic ray that comes from the moon to make the ocean move.

Enough free energy to power the entire world twice over for a day is beamed down onto the ocean every minute.

What I have written about and suggested in my book is that instead of creating an ocean hydroelectric plant, we could go directly as Leedskalnin, Tesla, Dollard and the pyramid builders did, and intercept the wireless wave altogether - bypassing the need to abstract the energy from the secondary ocean movement from the wireless gravity wave of the moon, and instead absorb the primary cosmic ray energy that comes from every planet and star in the form of gravity.

Indeed- this wireless gravity wave, provides the ocean with all of it's current and movement. Without the wireless invisible gravity wave between the earth and the moon. The ocean would not move to turn around the niagra falls generator plant.

Tesla's greatest achievement was not the niagra falls generating plant, or even the realisation of the hydroelectric concept. Tesla's greatest achievement was bypassing the ocean current altogether, and going directly to the moon and other cosmic objects.

Tesla states in his research that he has  caught cosmic rays from Antarus traveling at 50C or 50 times the speed of light devised by einstein as being the fundamental limit for all waves and mass.

It stands to common sense that Einstein may not be entirely wrong, it may well be that the gravity wave which powers the ocean, and every hydroelectric plant in turn - is completely massless component.

My book takes the scientist, engineer, musician into a very strange world of technical fact, and historic quotes from mechanix magazine the New York Times and the patents and work of C.P Steinmetz and Alexanderson.

It shows that the electricity on planet earth, from lightning and the movement of the ocean in the trillions of watts comes solely from the cosmic rays of other stars and planets, and that the earth is like a gigantic conductor with an insulator around it called an ionosphere. Lightning being the process where the "Solar voltage pressure" in space exceeds the distance volume density of the insulating ionosphere of the planet, thereby causing negative electrical current to flow into the ground , usually refered to as electrons and during such a moent, an equal and opposite (gravitic) force of positive electrical current flow out of the ground in opposition, usually refered to as protons. It is infact the collision of the protons and the electrons that create the electron, which therefore whos protons and electrons are not what atoms are made of, but something that atoms can produce.

This does not contradict the copenhagen theory of Quantum Physics, it rather remarkably confirms it.

I really want more people to know about the electrical systems that I , Tesla and Dollard have been working with such as:

  1. Impulse Current (TESLA)
  2. Direct Currents (EDISON)
  3. Alternating Currents (TESLA)
  4. Oscillating Currents (TESLA)

The usual story is that most people have only heard of D.C and A.C, even scientists and engineers are not versed in oscillating currents and impulse currents. To do requires 4 quadrant theory and versor algebra. See Eric Dollards work for more information on this, as well as the Nikola Tesla patents to see that what I am saying is a fact. Impulse and Oscillating current are used in the Tesla MAgnifier Transmitter (Tesla Coil) not A.C and D.C. The Tesla Coil , in essence then, is a transformer, like the sun and the moon, the ocean and the planet is.

Which makes it an ideal ground conjugatation with the capacitance of the earth. Indeed why Tesla used the earths ground terminal to send electricity, because he was using the transformer of the earth, and the stars, as well as the transformer of the rotary device alone, tesla was using the transformer of the rotary planet and solar system. 

It is likely this is in part how the Tesla Electric Car worked. Capable of 90mph, circa 1930, and traversing 1000's of miles on land before the 12V battery was changed.

And this is just to get started - Help Solomon Books bring this information to people and we will use the money to make this work available to you and other people through the success of Solomon Books and the 2nd edition we will be able to print a variety of books by Eric Dollard, Adam Bull, and a MYRIAD of other authors in the subject of Technology for a New Future and 'the art'.

Support this campaign if you support the resurrection of the 'the art'!

"

Tesla described relativity as a 'beggar wrapped in purple whom ignorant people take for a king

.' In support of his statement he cited a number of experiments he had conducted as far back as 1896 on the cosmic ray. He has measured cosmic-ray velocities from Antarus, he said, which he found to be fifty times greater than the speed of light, thus demolishing, he contended, one of the basic pillars of relativity, according to which there can be no speed greater than that of light." -- New York Times, 7/11/35


"People are too busy earning the lives they live than living the lives they earn - I founded this company to change that" - Adam Bull



My greatest thanks,
Adam Bull
Author of Technology For a New Future
Solomon Books
and `another way for civilisation`

Tesla's greatest achievement was bypassing the ocean current altogether, and going directly to the moon and other cosmic objects.Tesla states in his research that he has  caught cosmic rays from Antarus traveling at 50C or 50 times the speed of light devised by einstein as being the fundamental limit for all waves and mass.It stands to common sense that Einstein may not be entirely wrong, it may well be that the gravity wave which powers the ocean, and every hydroelectric plant in turn - is completely massless component.My book takes the scientist, engineer, musician into a very strange world of technical fact, and historic quotes from mechanix magazine the New York Times and the patents and work of C.P Steinmetz and Alexanderson.It shows that the electricity on planet earth, from lightning and the movement of the ocean in the trillions of watts comes solely from the cosmic rays of other stars and planets, and that the earth is like a gigantic conductor with an insulator around it called an ionosphere. Lightning being the process where the "Solar voltage pressure" in space exceeds the distance volume density of the insulating ionosphere of the planet, thereby causing negative electrical current to flow into the ground , usually refered to as electrons and during such a moent, an equal and opposite (gravitic) force of positive electrical current flow out of the ground in opposition, usually refered to as protons. It is infact the collision of the protons and the electrons that create the electron, which therefore whos protons and electrons are not what atoms are made of, but something that atoms can produce.This does not contradict the copenhagen theory of Quantum Physics, it rather remarkably confirms it.I really want more people to know about the electrical systems that I , Tesla and Dollard have been working with such as:

Impulse Current (TESLA)
Direct Currents (EDISON)
Alternating Currents (TESLA)
Oscillating Currents (TESLA)
The usual story is that most people have only heard of D.C and A.C, even scientists and engineers are not versed in oscillating currents and impulse currents. To do requires 4 quadrant theory and versor algebra. See Eric Dollards work for more information on this, as well as the Nikola Tesla patents to see that what I am saying is a fact. Impulse and Oscillating current are used in the Tesla MAgnifier Transmitter (Tesla Coil) not A.C and D.C. The Tesla Coil , in essence then, is a transformer, like the sun and the moon, the ocean and the planet is.Which makes it an ideal ground conjugatation with the capacitance of the earth. Indeed why Tesla used the earths ground terminal to send electricity, because he was using the transformer of the earth, and the stars, as well as the transformer of the rotary device alone, tesla was using the transformer of the rotary planet and solar system. It is likely this is in part how the Tesla Electric Car worked. Capable of 90mph, circa 1930, and traversing 1000's of miles on land before the 12V battery was changed.And this is just to get started - Help Solomon Books bring this information to people and we will use the money to make this work available to you and other people through the success of Solomon Books and the 2nd edition we will be able to print a variety of books by Eric Dollard, Adam Bull, and a MYRIAD of other authors in the subject of Technology for a New Future and 'the art'.Support this campaign if you support the resurrection of the 'the art'!"
Tesla described relativity as a 'beggar wrapped in purple whom ignorant people take for a king
.' In support of his statement he cited a number of experiments he had conducted as far back as 1896 on the cosmic ray. He has measured cosmic-ray velocities from Antarus, he said, which he found to be fifty times greater than the speed of light, thus demolishing, he contended, one of the basic pillars of relativity, according to which there can be no speed greater than that of light." -- New York Times, 7/11/35
"People are too busy earning the lives they live than living the lives they earn - I founded this company to change that" - Adam Bull
My greatest thanks,Adam BullAuthor of Technology For a New FutureSolomon Booksand `another way for civilisation`

story:
Cliquez-ici pour vous pré-inscrire (paiement sur place)

Les Y'a Bon Awards des Indivisibles

Chaque année depuis 2009, les Indivisibles organisent les Y'a Bon Awards, cérémonie parodique et humoristique de remise de trophées en forme de peau de banane dorée (crées par l'artiste Alexis Peskine), aux personnalités publiques ayant tenu les pires propos racistes de l'année, souvent dans l’indifférence générale.

Le jury, composé de personnalités invitées par les Indivisibles, élit les lauréats parmi les nommés issus du travail de veille médiatique de l’association.

La soirée organisée par les Indivisibles aura lieu le 10 juin 2013 à 19h30 au Cabaret Sauvage et sera animée par Raphäl Yem.

Votre générosité, c'est notre indépendance !

La cérémonie des Y'a Bon Awards n'existent que pour vous, et grâce à vous. Les dons et adhésions sont nos principales sources de financement et la garantie de notre indépendance.

Le don minimum de 12€, pensé pour permettre au plus grand nombre d'assister à la cérémonie, ne suffit pas à couvrir le coût de la soirée. Pour assurer la pérennité des Y'a Bon Awards et des Indivisibles, nous comptons donc sur votre générosité.

En effet, la cérémonie des Y'a Bon Awards représente un coût de près de 10 000 € pour l'association des Indivisibles. Avec 400 adhésions à 25€, nous rentrerons dans nos frais ! En devant adhérent à part entière, vous participez ainsi à couvrir les frais de la cérémonie pour l'association.

Avec un don de 100€, soit 33€ après déduction fiscale, vous participez à garantir que les Indivisibles puissent accomplir leur travail de veille médiatique et d'organisation des Y'a Bon Awards 2014. Mieux encore, vous envoyez un signal fort de soutien dont l'association a besoin pour croire en l'avenir.

L'heure de nous-mêmes a sonné !

Les Y’a Bon Awards 2013, à l’occasion du centenaire de la naissance d’Aimé Césaire, porteront son message phare « L’heure de nous-­mêmes a sonné ». Ainsi l’évènement toujours placé sous le signe de l’humour promeuvra le droit à l'initiative notamment en encourageant, promouvant, et fédérant les initiatives positives de lutte contre les préjugés racistes pour ne plus seulement se cantonner au registre de la dénonciation.

Les Indivisibles et le combat antiraciste ne peuvent se réduire à une soirée. Nous avons besoin de l'engagement de tous pour mener à bien notre travail.

Passez le mot autour de vous et invitez vos amis aux Y'a Bon Awards 2013 !

Responsabiliser la parole publique

Les Y'a Bon Awards participent ainsi à responsabiliser les médias et personnalités publiques sur l’impact des préjugés racistes qu'ils peuvent diffuser. C'est dans ces préjugés que ces prescripteurs d’opinions diffusent que le racisme ordinaire y trouve sa légitimation principale.

story:
Many thanks to all the contributors who made this campaign a success!

Pledges have gone toward the book design costs of publishing my second novel, Missing Steps, under my own imprint, Not That London. 

The novel can be purchased online through major booksellers starting in April 2015. Visit NotThatLondon.com for details. Or you can buy discount multi-book packs right here. Simply select one of the post-campaign perks.

I'm releasing Missing Steps on April 30, 2015 to capitalize on the momentum generated by the recent international release of my first novel, After Helen. It received rave reviews in Canada, the US, and the British Isles and was named one of 2014's Top Ten self-published books. It also earned me the title of international Lit Idol at the London Book Fair in the UK.

Missing Steps was already written and edited. In late December 2014, I handed the manuscript over to the freelance book designer who created the stunning cover for the international edition of After Helen. She provided me with four cover options for Missing Steps. My many email followers helped me choose from among them. Check out the campaign Gallery to see the cover they selected. 

Publishing a book independently isn't cheap. It cost me $10,000 to get After Helen out into the world and to promote it properly. After giving retailers, wholesalers and distributors their cut (and paying for printing costs), I earn about $2.50 per paperback sold. That means I have to sell a lot of books just to break even. Funds raised through the campaign reduced the financial risk I was taking to publish Missing Steps.

Post-Campaign Perks

So what's the payoff for you? I'm offering a new set of rewards now that the official campaign is complete. Perks include discount multi-book packs and special book club features.

Missing Steps: Story Synopsis

Dean Lajeunesse doesn’t want to follow in his father’s footsteps. He’s not yet fifty, but his memory is starting to fail him. He vividly recalls how dementia whittled away at his dad and doesn’t want his own teenaged son, Aidan, to see him suffer the same fate. Of course, he could just be overreacting. Maybe it’s the stress of his on-again, off-again relationship with Valerie, his long-time live-in girlfriend, or the feeling that he’s not measuring up as a father that’s making him absent-minded. But before he can understand what’s happening to him, he’s dragged home to the sickbed of his estranged mother. There, he butts heads with his older brother, Perry, who’s remained loyal to their mother and has succeeded in almost every way that Dean hasn’t. As old family tensions bubble to the surface, Dean must try to hold on to Aidan’s respect as he relives his difficult relationship with his own father.

Visit www.missingsteps.com for access to free preview chapters.

Praise for Paul Cavanagh and After Helen

“Paul Cavanagh reads like a North of 49 Anne Tyler: by turns funny and moving, his new novel explores the ambiguity of modern relationships, and points toward reconciliation with facts we cannot change.”

– Antanas Sileika, Author of Underground

Cavanagh writes “with incisive observational skill and a plain-spoken, moderate tone. The result is an emotional depth that is often shocking in its intensity, fidelity and resonance…. I’m not the first one to say it, but here it is: After Helen is a winner.”

– Robert Wiersema, The Globe & Mail

“An absorbing and deeply touching debut, After Helen is a whirlwind of a novel that, once started, is incredibly difficult to put down.”

– Alison Potter, Irish Examiner

“Helen is a complex and powerful character in a novel full of them, but she is by herself worth the price of admission.”

– David Worsley, The Waterloo Record

"…a nuanced exploration of what it means to mourn those we love most, all their flaws considered. After Helen is an emotionally intelligent, surprising novel that more than earns its stripes."

 – Michelle Anne Schingler, Foreword Reviews

“…enticing and exciting… a witty book with powerfully moving moments throughout… Overall, a teasingly, addictive novel…”

– Katy Hepburn, We Love This Book

“Everything is beautifully fleshed-out, from the supporting cast of characters, through the Canadian landscape, to the parallels with a doomed Victorian expedition to find the Northwest Passage. And the detail is superlative. I can see why Cavanagh won a Lit Idol competition, because it’s difficult to criticise anything in this story: prose, structure, plot development, consistent characterisation, background, continuity of theme. This is a well-written novel.” (Recommended book)

– Jill Murphy, The Bookbag


Campaign Results: Perks Chosen

$12 CAD - Help bring the book to readers - 0 claimed

$24 CAD - Advance release ebook - 0 claimed

$48 CAD - Advance release paperback - 8 claimed

$68 CAD - Autographed paperback - 1 claimed

$100 CAD - Special mention in the novel acknowledgements - 4 claimed

$150 CAD - Gift 5-pack - 3 claimed

$232 CAD - Book club autographed 8-pack - 0 claimed

$290 CAD - Book club autographed 10-pack - 0 claimed

$312 CAD - Book club autographed 8-pack + author visit - 1 claimed

$390 CAD - Book club autographed 10-pack + author visit - 0 claimed

Additional pledges (without a perk) - $889 CAD

Many thanks to all my generous supporters!

story:
Disclaimer: If you would like to pick up your perk of Function Magazine Issue 16 before May 2015, from the Function Team themselves, email functionmagazine@gmail.com to find out where!

What is Function Magazine

Our purpose is to serve as a guide to visual culture in today’s multimedia landscape. Our aim, put simply, is to expose more people to more art - both as an online platform and print publication.

The content of our publication expresses the unique and integral dimensions involved in understanding how we think, how we represent, and how we identify as a generation today.  Our mission is to create a relevant dialogue around thought-provoking concepts and demonstrate a social awareness of today’s standard of visual culture.  

We are artists existing within the scope of the entire visual industry, and as artists in this society, we are unlimited in our potential. Function Magazine Issue 16 features interviews with with notable industry professionals such as Jeremy Bailey and Eugene Richards, as well as a variety of extraordinary student work. 


Why We Need Your Support

Our biggest investment is the cost of our publication. At 950 copies, we will be spending just over $16,500. The rest of the majority of our spending goes towards the purchasing of merchandise, national distribution, and events.

We are the editorial team of Function Magazine and we are coming to you to ask for your help to raise $1,600 towards the cost for the production of our publication. It’s easy to make a difference, and your contribution will be greatly appreciated. 


What You Get For Donating 

By contributing, you are supporting our goal to support all our student work, providing them with a professional platform to showcase their remarkable talent. Function has a reputation of being a entrepreneur for the arts and your donation assist’s Function in being a outlet for student growth and development.

We are happy to give back to you as a our way of saying a huge thank you. We appreciate any and all donations, no matter the amount. Please check out the perks we are offering on the sidebar of this page! 

Thank you so much for your kind consideration and please check out our website to see what your gift is helping to create!

story:
Breve reseña

Vista Larga Foundation, en colaboración con otras entidades independientes, busca financiación para su proyecto de denuncia y concientización “Los niños olvidados”, que persigue la publicación bilingüe, traducción al inglés y distribución y presentación internacional del libro del mismo nombre (título provisional), una compilación inédita de testimonios sobre los campos de trabajo forzado para niños y adolescentes en Cuba, comúnmente conocidos como “Escuelas en el Campo” y “Escuelas al Campo”.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes


  • Los 50, 000 dólares que queremos reunir para este proyecto se emplearán en la compilación, traducción y edición del libro, en imprimir tiradas para las distintas presentaciones, en publicitar fuertemente cada presentación en al menos cinco ciudades de varios continentes, y en su distribución en universidades, bibliotecas, ONGs e instituciones internacionales de derechos humanos.

  • Los testimonios recogidos en el libro aparecerán con los nombres y apellidos de sus autores, que recibirán cada uno un ejemplar. Al final del volumen, aparecerá una lista con los nombres y apellidos de los donantes que deseen figurar en él, así como agradecimientos. Todos los donantes recibirán ebooks, o versiones digitales del libro, por correo electrónico. Las contribuciones de los residentes en Estados Unidos son deducibles de impuestos, pues Vista Larga es una organización Non-Profit.

  • Si no logramos la meta total, los fondos parciales recaudados se emplearán en cumplir algunos de los objetivos enumerados arriba. El primero, por ejemplo, sería la compilación y traducción. El segundo, la publicación, y así sucesivamente.  

El impacto

La experiencia de las Escuelas en el Campo y al Campo comienza oficialmente en Cuba en 1966 con una serie de movilizaciones en la provincia de Camagüey, y luego, a partir del curso 1968-1969, empiezan a construirse edificaciones donde alojar a los niños y jóvenes lejos de sus familias, los cuales de lunes a viernes estudiaban en la mañana y trabajaban, sin recibir remuneración a cambio, en la tarde, o viceversa. Este plan reeducativo estuvo vigente por más de cuarenta años en Cuba sin que hasta ahora se haya contado la verdadera historia de lo acontecido en el interior de esos centros, que muchos cubanos recuerdan como verdaderas cárceles.

Nos proponemos publicar y distribuir internacionalmente la historia de los abusos, malformaciones, violaciones, suicidios y hasta asesinatos cometidos impunemente en las Escuelas en el Campo y al Campo a través del testimonio de quienes vivieron directamente esta etapa, padres, menores y profesores. El libro estará conformado por testimonios de las víctimas y pedagogos implicados, y servirá para explicar al mundo cómo durante más de medio siglo se llevó a cabo en Cuba una labor de genocidio cultural en la que las instituciones reeducativas cumplieron un papel protagónico. Este genocidio cultural se está exportando ahora a países como Venezuela.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Algunas personas tal vez no puedan colaborar financieramente, pero eso no significa que no ayuden con sus testimonios y aportes de difusión:

  • Apoya la campaña de denuncia publicitando la idea del libro o el propio libro por tus canales y entre tus amigos.
  • Tu testimonio debe ser enviado, con tus datos completos, a este correo: escuelaalcampo@gmail.com
  • Usa las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.
  • Si vives en Estados Unidos, tus contribuciones a este proyecto son deducidas de impuestos. Vista Larga es una organización Non-Profit.

familias, los cuales de lunes a viernes estudiaban en la mañana y trabajaban, sin recibir remuneración a cambio, en
la tarde, o viceversa. Este plan reeducativo estuvo vigente por más de cuarenta
años en Cuba sin que hasta ahora se haya contado la verdadera historia de lo
acontecido en el interior de esos centros, que muchos cubanos recuerdan como verdaderas
cárceles.
Nos proponemos publicar y distribuir
internacionalmente la historia de los abusos, malformaciones, violaciones,
suicidios y hasta asesinatos cometidos impunemente en las Escuelas en el Campo
y al Campo a través del testimonio de quienes vivieron directamente esta etapa,
padres, menores y profesores. El libro estará conformado por testimonios de las
víctimas y pedagogos implicados, y servirá para explicar al mundo cómo durante
más de medio siglo se llevó a cabo en Cuba una labor de genocidio cultural en
la que las instituciones reeducativas cumplieron un papel protagónico. Este
genocidio cultural se está exportando ahora a países como Venezuela.
 Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar  Algunas personas tal vez no puedan colaborar financieramente, pero eso no significa que no ayuden con sus testimonios y aportes de difusión:  
Apoya la campaña de denuncia publicitando la idea del libro o el propio libro por tus canales y entre tus amigos. 
Tu testimonio debe ser enviado, con tus datos completos, a este correo: escuelaalcampo@gmail.com
 Usa las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.
Si vives en Estados Unidos, tus contribuciones a este proyecto son deducidas de impuestos. Vista Larga es una organización Non-Profit.

story:
Due to a four year old tax error (not mine personally), the IRS has claimed the contents my bank account, making it impossible for me to pay my bills, rent, etc. 

I have three novels due for release this year, along with a novella, and several short stories. Working on all of these projects as a full-time writer and part-time tour guide has been tough enough, and now that my money has been confiscated, the strain is drastically increased. This is where you come in.

Greetings and Salutations, friends, fans, and strangers who went searching for porn and stumbled upon this page. My name is Jessica McHugh, and I'm an author of speculative fiction. I've had fourteen books published by small presses in the past five years, and I have three more novels due for release this year. (The Green Kangaroos, Darla Decker Hates to Wait, and Darla Decker Takes the Cake) I also have three novels currently in progress that I'd hoped to submit for publication this year, (The Train Derails in Boston, Verses of Villainy, and The Dangerous Life of Darian McCloud) but I'll have to put those off if financial worries become too large.

I've been working as a frugal full-time writer for a little over a year now, and I've been making a decent go of it---well, I'm alive and happy, and that's usually enough for me. :)

Until the IRS emptied my bank account. 

This setback has come at a rough time for my family. Financially, we'll always be strained because of my life as an artist, but I'm overloaded with projects right now, and it's made life all that more stressful.

Funding & Perks

The goal amount is based on approximately two months of rent/bills and groceries. That's what your contributions will be used for. Although I could use A LOT more money, I'd be happy to have any assistance digging my family out of this hole. Not only will it lessen the strain on us personally, it will allow me to focus on my looming deadlines and affording the personal appearances I've already committed to throughout the year.

Other Ways You Can Help

My ebook of ponderings, fan-submitted pictures, and writing prompts, "Virtuoso at Masturbation, and More McHughmorous Musings, is $1.99 at Amazon. http://www.amazon.com/Virtuoso-Masturbation-More-McHughmorous-Musings-ebook/dp/B00E1JSDX2 Although purchasing ANY OF MY BOOKS is appreciated, I receive more money from this one. But please check out my Amazon Author page if you'd prefer to purchase something else.

www.amazon.com/Jessica-McHugh/e/B003NUKAA4

www.jessicamchughbooks.com

www.http://www.facebook.com/author.JessicaMcHugh

Also, please share this page and spread the word. Believe me, I wouldn't have made this campaign unless the McHughniverse were in real trouble. So please consider donating whatever you can. Thank you. THINK in INK!!

story:
2015. november 4-én a Böde családnak egy meghibásodott villanyóra miatt leégett az otthona, ezzel mindenüket elveszítve. 

Videó az esetről

Egyik éjszaka Rebeka telefonhívást kapott a nővérétől, aki értesítette őt, hogy a házuk kigyulladt és lángokban áll. A férjével együtt azonnal a helyszínre sietett, de sajnos addigra a házból már semmit sem lehetett megmenteni. Mint utólag kiderült a tüzet a meghibásodott villanyóra okozta, amely feltételezhetően egy zárlat miatt kapott lángra. A telken közvetlenül mellettük Rebeka testvérének a háza áll melyben négy gyermek él szüleikkel és melyre a tűzoltóknak köszönhetően nem terjedt át a tűz. Az egész család összefogva próbálja biztosítani számukra az átmeneti szállást és az alapvető szükségleteikhez nélkülözhetetlen dolgokat, azonban ez nem elegendő füstté vált életük újrakezdéséhez.

A hat hónapos gyermekével várandós anyuka, férje és másfél éves kisfiúk otthon nélkül maradtak a tél kezdete előtt!

Egy páran összefogva, akik látjuk hogy ezt a családot mekkora veszteség érte, úgy döntöttünk, hogy közösségi finanszírozást indítunk számukra annak reményében, hogy ezzel együttes erővel új esélyt teremtsünk számukra. 

El sem lehet képzelni milyen lehet átélni azt, amikor egy családnak megsemmisül mindene ami a múltat, a jelent és a jövőt jelentette. 

Veszteségeiket nem tudjuk teljes mértékben kárpótolni, de arra gondoltunk, hogy egy közös összefogással képesek vagyunk arra, hogy óriási segítséget nyújtsunk számukra!

Ez a felület arra nyújt lehetőséget, hogy egy olyan anyagi hátteret biztosítsunk nekik, amely segíti egy új otthon megteremtését. 

Ha te is át tudod érezni a helyzetet, arra kérünk, hogy segítsd a kampányt anyagi támogatásoddal. A kampány lejártával, a befolyt összeg a család bakszámlájára kerül!

Köszönjük hogy Te is velünk együtt támogatod őket!

story:
i founded pill magazine in response to the lack of information available to me as a 16-year-old in need of an abortion. in my journalism career, i try to create the work i needed as a teenager and imbue my works with a queer, feminist perspective. now that i've put together the first issue, i'd like to continue making this publication a quarterly possibility. 

pill magazine is an intersectional zine geared towards the clinic lobbies of planned parenthood and its ilk. the goal is to offer a grimy, brazen alternative the pamphlets available in these spaces, one that speaks the language of the folks actually involved. the inaugural issue is entitled "shoutyourabortion." it's full of guidance and cultural commentary for those making the choice to have an abortion. 

i have next few issues outlined:

  • the vibrator issue: let's talk about masturbation, how it happens, and what it means
  • the betty white issue: a discussion of senior women's sexual health, toys, and stories
  • the discovery issue: everyone has a different introduction to sex; let's talk about 'the talk.' this will be an anthology of sorts, complete with guide for parents, guardians, and loved ones who want to begin the conversation in a healthy way. 
currently, i need help with printing and production costs to keep this publication moving forward. i plan on consigning with different comic and zine stores around chicago, and would like to bring the publication to clinics throughout the midwest.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name's Miranda Doerfler. I'm a 21 year old writer. My latest and most ambitious project is DEAD INSIDE, a zombie novella thriller that I'm incredibly excited about. Before we go any further, I want to tell you about the story:

"A horrible virus that eats you alive from the inside out. A group of people with an amazing gift. A man who wants to unleash the virus on the world population. A newlywed whose life is in more danger than he realizes. The pieces of the puzzle must fall together in time to save humanity and prevent the zombie apocalypse.

Dead Inside is a zombie thriller about a virus called Mortoxin which turns you into a zombie from the inside out, slowly killing you, then feeding off the cells in your body until you rot and there's nothing left. Hayter Industries has created this virus, and invited six people known as The G2 Group, to put it to use. The members of this group have an incredible ability: to make contact with the dead, materialize spirits and even revive the dead, though none of them knows how to control their power.

Newlywed Daniel Flynn has been summoned by Hayter Industries to be a test subject for Mortoxin, but things don't go as planned and things take a turn for the worse when an employee of Hayter Industries smuggles the virus out. Tein Luck gets his hands on Mortoxin with plans to unleash it on the public. The survival of humanity depends entirely on the ability of Hayter Industries and The G2 Group to put a stop to it before it literally eats the entire world population alive."

Basically, I am hoping to attend a massive convention in August, getting a booth there and spreading the word about my books as much as possible. I am also hoping to film a short trailer for this book, starring Seth Peterson as Daniel Flynn. This campaign is to help me get the supplies I'll need for this convention.

What We Need & What You Get

In total, I'll need around $1200.

$50 - expanded distribution via CreateSpace
$300 - about 100 print copies for distribution
$195 - 500 bookmarks via Lulu
$275 - 100 posters via Lulu
$115 - 50 keychains via Vistaprint
$100 - 100 buttons via CafePress
$140 - IndieGoGo Fees

If I reach more than my goal, whatever funds I have will be put towards the next publication; I release a new collection of short stories every three months, so any funding will be helpful for promotions and such.

The Impact

Have you heard of The Walking Dead? Robert Kirkman, the creator of the incredibly popular comic book series and television show was entirely self-published. I don't know if I'll ever write something as brilliant as The Walking Dead, but I'm taking a shot with Dead Inside.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can follow me on Twitter (http://twitter.com/docsaico), like me on Facebook (http://facebook.com/docsaicowrites) and spread the word by visiting my website (http://mirandadoerfler.com).

story:
WHY God Bless Skeletons?

I believe in America. It is a real place with real people. If you dispute this, I do not want your money or your time and I'd like you to stop reading right now.


Thank you for continuing to believe in America. I'd like to answer the above question with a question of my own. Do you like me? Don't respond just yet. Think about it. Do you know me? Do you like anything I've ever done, even a little bit? Most of you will probably answer "No, sir." to both of those questions. To you I say: fine, then snap judge me right now based on my art. Here is a piece of my "art":


What do you think of that? It's just OK, right? I'm with you on that. I've done better and worse. That's not the only thing I do. Far from it, in fact. I actually haven't made one of those in a long time. Mainly, I write. I want to be a writer. This is a difficult career choice, but I had to choose something. Professional Internet Reader was not paying my bills. And I guess I enjoy writing even though I bitch about having to do it.


This was intended to be a mission statement and although I think I've gone off the rails a bit, I will now attempt to reign it in.


Like I said, I want to write. I'm moving to California without a job and my only real skill is tapping away at a keyboard. My college degree will only get me so far. I believe that it will get me into a second interview at Lady Foot Locker. For some people that might be very far. But not for me. I think by doing this Kickstarter [Ed. Note: IndieGoGo], I can get some of what industry insiders call "heat". How much "heat"? Frankly I'm not expecting any "heat". I think maybe seven people will visit this site. Of those seven, I'll be lucky if two of them are even reading this far. What's up you two? How's your day going? I'm going to share some exclusive information with you for sticking around this long. Did you know that I have never voted in an election? I am not even registered to vote. Does that annoy you? Deal with it! This is my America.


WHAT Do I Want From You?

I want your pennies. Your hard earned, coffee stained, sometimes fun tasting pennies. These pennies will help me to do nothing. I honestly just want to see if this site even accepts pennies. If it does then that's pretty cool isn't it? What if I made four cents? I would then have to withdraw four cents and transfer four cents to my bank account. I can't wait to do that. If it's not possible for you to donate pennies, then I will ask for your dollars. Of which I expect you to donate none. Honestly, why would you even fund this thing? 


EDIT: HEY GUYS, GUESS WHAT? You can't donate pennies. Shit.


What IS this thing, anyway? I haven't even told you. Well I guess I have. I'm attempting to use this site to see if it will help me get a job as a writer, if it's not clear to you yet. What kind of job? Jeez, I don't know. How does it even work? I'll be a PA or something if it helps me to be a writer's assistant eventually. I want to write for a living and also be able to pay my bills. That's not what this is by the way. DO NOT GIVE ME MONEY ON THIS SITE WITH THE INTENT THAT I WILL PAY MY BILLS WITH IT. Because I won't. I can't guarantee I won't spend it on bills but I don't want it for that reason. I don't even want your money. What the hell am I doing right now?


If you DO donate and I make one dollar on this that would be insane and I will have successfully scammed the system. I understand that times is tough. Please do not donate if times is tough for you. Actually, just don't donate at all. Just pass this link along. Let's get it in the hands of Steven Spielberg. How crazy would that be if he even clicked on the link? Imagine Steven Spielberg on the internet! Do you think he googles himself?


WHAT I Need & What You Get

I really just want to see how many people check this out. They made me choose a monetary goal, though. So my goal is the minimum of $500. FIVE HUNDRED DAMN DOLLARS?! That's a lot of money. I do not expect to reach this goal, nor do I want to.


What do you get for donating? Well, if you really did donate there are several perks to choose from. I haven't thought of them yet but by the time you read this I will have filled out the rest of this form. So check out those perks on the top right of this page! I wonder what they'll be?


OTHER Ways You Can Help

Please, just pass this along. Or don't. I'm already resigned to the fact that nobody will read this. But it helped me kill some time at work so it's not completely worthless.


Oh, also, if you want to contact me about anything (a job, how stupid this is, how I can find meaning in life) hit me up here: tutpsu@gmail.com

Please, just pass this along. Or don't. I'm already resigned to the fact that nobody will read this. But it helped me kill some time at work so it's not completely worthless. 

Oh, also, if you want to contact me about anything (a job, how stupid this is, how I can find meaning in life) hit me up here: tutpsu@gmail.com

story:
If Only You Knew What Your Body Knows

A new book by Philip Shepherd 

The basics 

My name is Philip Shepherd.  Three years ago I published my first book, New Self, New World.  It was written on pure passion, and took me ten years to finish.   I’ve been incredibly honored by the praise it has received from both celebrities and regular readers who have resonated to its message, and by the invitations to give interviews and talks and teach workshops based on its material. 

I’m now in the midst of writing my second book, which has the working title If Only You Knew What Your Body Knows.  It is shorter, simpler, and accessible to a wider audience.  A lot of readers have encouraged me to do this – to present the vision of the first book in a punchier, more direct manner so that more people can benefit from it.  I’ve realized, though, that my resources are too depleted from the decade-long task of writing New Self, New World to sustain me through the writing of this one.  That’s why I need your help.

So what’s the new book about? 

This book steps back for a bird’s eye view of our culture in order to make out why we act as we do with ourselves and each other, and with the world around us. What concerns me isn’t just the persistent damage we do to the ecosystem and other species, or the horrors of war, or the systematic violence inflicted on women; I’m also interested in why we deliberately create realms for ourselves – in malls and skyscrapers and on city streets – that are harsh, cold, ugly and inhospitable.  Why we seed strife into every corner of our lives, our relationships, and into our own bodies.

And why are these things happening? 

It turns out that for 10,000 years we have been developing a story of what it means to be human – and that story, unknown to us, tells us how to live.  It tells us our place in the world and directs our actions.  Unfortunately it is a story that leaves us divided within ourselves, and divided from the natural world, so that our interactions inflict damage both unwittingly and deliberately.  We start learning the story as infants, before we are able to question it, and it defines what we consider to be normal.  As long as the story remains invisible and unquestioned, though, it will continue to drive us even more deeply into imbalance.

How does the new book help?

It began as a simpler presentation of the material in New Self, New World – but it has since taken on a life of its own.  It not only looks afresh at assumptions that blindside our choices – it addresses what we need to do, as individuals, to reframe a new, more accurate story about what it means to be human, one that can free us from our seductive fantasies and draw us back into accord with the gifts of being a human on this miracle of a planet.

How can I check it out?

You can get a taste of If Only You Knew What Your Body Knows and the fresh perspective it offers, because I’ve posted a draft of Chapter One on my website, www.philipshepherd.com  Please have a look at it, even if you are not able to contribute to this fundraiser.  I think you’ll find its insights helpful, and deeply relevant.

So what’s the deal? 

If you believe in this work and can lend a hand, that would be awesome.  Any amount at all helps to make a difference – not just financially, but also as a heartwarming show of support.  There’s a schedule of incentives you may have noticed – including a signed copy of the new book, an invitation to the book launch, an original “Occupy Your Body” t-shirt designed by Allyson Woodrooffe (who also designed the award-winning cover of New Self, New World), a mention of thanks in the book, and so on – but the real reason for helping out has to be just that: the wish to collaborate in bringing this book to completion, ready for publication, and the gratitude that will come your way from me, for whatever you may be able to offer.

So I give you my warmest regards, and my thanks for reading this far. Please feel free to pass this note along to anyone who might be sympathetic to the cause.

All the best,

Philip

ps. If you have any questions, feel free to email me!

story:
Where The Story Begins

I graduated from Savannah College of Art and Design in 2011—during the early recovery stages of the Great Recession. Though I'm incurably optimistic, I wasn't stupid enough to think that a 21-year-old with a degree in writing would be in high demand, so I packed my bags and moved to Cambodia. Not exactly the most conventional choice, but I kind of have a habit of that. 

My memoir starts there: A solo-traveling, button-pushing, introspective young woman, heading into the unknown.

I've written a quarter of this collection of observations, but I'm still working on the chapters about:

  • running away from Cambodia and myself.
  • wandering into a riot in Turkey.
  • learning lessons from a yogi and the Dalai Lama in India.
  • falling in and out of love with people and places.
  • finding my way back to a changed Cambodia—one of the fastest growing, chaotic countries in the world—and approaching it as a 25-year-old, experienced writer determined to finish what I'd started four years before. 

Your donation will afford me the time to give this story the attention it deserves so that I can deliver a professional product by September 1, 2015.

Why I Need Your Help

Although I love when people ask why I can't just finish this in two weeks, the short answer is that I've never qualified for jobs that posted "must be able to work in fast paced environment." I'm slow to observe, slow to process, and slow to write.

I need about three months of uninterrupted focus to write, rewrite, doubt everything I've ever written, and edit to create a roughly 200-page memoir about my love affair with Cambodia and the ripple effect that it's had on my life.

Your generosity goes toward: 

  • the publishing costs for ebook and print perks that YOU receive in return for your donation.
  • the professional video for this campaign (a huge thanks to Jeremiah Overman!). 
  • an editor to make sure I don't spell my own name wrong, among other things.
  • the electricity it takes to power up my computer in the morning. 
  • the coffee it takes to power up my brain.
  • the roof over my head that doesn't provide nearly the same security (or health insurance) as the one I had as a child.
  • the ability for me to continue living and writing in Cambodia, documenting the incredible changes this country is witnessing.
  • a graphic designer, so that I don't send out stapled Word documents as a final product.
  • the cover artwork provided by a local Cambodian artist. 
  • the 9% Indiegogo fee (4% if funded)

I'm making up for the rest of my everyday costs through my freelance writing and coaching services, but this campaign will alleviate the bulk of my financial burdens while I finish the book and spend time marketing it. 

    The Impact

    I started off this journey identifying myself as an American (with stereotypical pride), but now I struggle to define what that even means.

    Drinking warm chai prepared in an Indian family's home changed me. Seeing the looks of violent unity from Turkish youth protesting the destruction of nature in the face of tear gas and rubber bullets changed me. Having a young Cambodian woman say that I've inspired her to travel and be more independent changed me.

    I've shared so many of these stories on my blog, Awkward American Traveler, to approach the magnitude of these experiences, using humor, compassion, and storytelling, but I've omitted so much. This book will finally allow me to fill in the gaps; it will allow me to tell the complete story of what becoming an adult and global citizen in this instantly connected yet chronically disconnected world is really like. 

    That's why if I exceed $5,000, I will donate any additional funds to We Help Nepal. Their story is now our story.

    The world, to me, has become such a small place and I feel more confused and captivated by it than ever. I feel a deep responsibility to share my story—one that is interwoven with the stories of all the people I've interacted with in my life—to show that this connection, this love, is found in every corner of the earth.


    Even if you're unable to donate, please take a moment to share this campaign. I appreciate all of your help. Thank you!
