story:
Please help me raise money to fund the publishing of my book "Not Just Tits in a Corset: Celebrating Women in Metal."  This book will be self-published by Jill Hughes Kirtland.  Foreword by Doro Pesch.  Available as a pdf, e-book (for iOS devices), or a softcover and hardcover printed book. All contribution levels include a copy of the book in one of these formats. You will receive the book before it is available to the public (non-contributors).  All those who contribute will also receive a FREE invitation to the Book Launch Party held on Thursday, April 3rd (7-11pm) at Roxy & Duke's Roadhouse in Dunellen, NJ. 


Objectives of the Book:
- To celebrate the Women who are involved in the metal genre Internationally 
- To depict how courageous, strong, and talented all the women are who are involved in metal music
- Through quotes and photos, allow these women to tell their story about their challenges and triumphs as female metalheads, and inspire others
- Describe how female involvement in the metal community has changed over time

100 pages of full-color photos, narrative, and interviews with many notable female metal musicians from around the world:  Lita Ford (The Runaways, solo artist), Ann Boleyn (Hellion), Doro Pesch (Doro, ex-Warlock), Betsy Bitch, Leather Leone (Sledge/Leather, Chastain), Anneke Van Giersbergen (ex-The Gathering, Devin Townsend, solo artist), Elize Ryd (Amaranthe), Sharon den Adel (Within Temptation), Alissa White-Gluz (The Agonist), Angela Gossow (Arch Enemy), Floor Jansen (After Forever, ReVamp, Nightwish), Tarja Turunen (ex-Nightwish, solo artist), Cristina Scabbia (Lacuna Coil), Charlotte Wessels (Delain), Roxy Petrucci (Vixen), Linda McDonald (The Iron Maidens, Phantom Blue), Simone Simons (Epica), etc.  
Full list can be found here: https://www.facebook.com/notes/celebrating-women-in-metal/artists-who-have-been-interviewed-exclusively-for-women-in-metal-book/354303054636443

What does this fundraiser campaign pay for?
The funds will be used to pay for a professional editor, promotion, printing costs, photo rights (for photos not taken by the author), shipping costs, and other incidentals associated with publishing a book. 

Author Bio
The first musician Jill Hughes Kirtland ever interviewed was Edgar Meyer, the GRAMMY award winning upright bass player, when she was a freshman at Ithaca College.  She knew then she wanted to be a music journalist.  In 2007, she started an online magazine for progressive rock & metal (USA Progressive Music), which allowed her to interview many of her favorite musicians and learn the art of concert photography.   Around that time, she also became the manager for New Jersey-based progressive metal band Suspyre, and then she donned the hat of tour manager for Shadow Gallery, a Pennsylvania-based progressive metal band, all of this allowing her to immerse herself behind the scenes into the metal music industry. After selling USA Progressive Music in 2010, she traveled all over the world conducting interviews with female metalheads—musicians, fans, photographers, promoters, and other behind-the-scenes women—all the while fending for her life in the photo pits at metal concerts to create this book.

Jill Hughes Kirtland currently resides in New Jersey with her husband, daughter and two cats.  She can mostly be found in her home office wearing a black band t-shirt, listening to a metal album on her Tannoy monitors, or blaring music at deafening levels from her iPod in her car while traveling to concerts, or working with a prog band in their latest scheme to steer the next generation away from bad pop music. 

Facebook & Twitter hashtag: #CelebratingWomenInMetal

story:
Help the Golden Rule sail for peace once more!

Veterans For Peace needs your help to restore the Golden Rule, the world's first anti-nuclear peace boat. In 1958, her brave crew of Quakers and pacifists risked their lives and freedom to nonviolently confront nuclear testing on the high seas. With your help, we'll be able to honor their legacy and continue their mission. 


The Story


Horrified by the ongoing, open-air nuclear bomb tests and the threat of nuclear war, the four-man crew sailed the Golden Rule from California toward the Marshall Islands. Their intention, publicized around the world, was to nonviolently place their bodies in the way of planned nuclear bomb blasts. As they sailed from Honolulu harbor for the testing area, the voyagers were stopped and arrested by the U.S. Coast Guard. Guided by their conscience, the crew attempted to sail again, were arrested once more and detained in the Honolulu city jail until the conclusion of the test cycle. 

“I sense that most of us feel overwhelmed by a disintegrating world, seemingly beyond our control....at the same time, we have the potential to preserve and enhance our delicate, beautiful planet and create on it a society of respect, sharing, and caring—where love will not be considered a sign of weakness.”
- Albert Bigelow

The Legacy

The publicity surrounding their trial and imprisonment helped ignite public outrage against nuclear weapons testing and alerted the world to the health hazards of nuclear fallout. Five years and many protests later, the Partial Test Ban Treaty of 1963 was enacted, banning above-ground nuclear testing by the two Superpowers. 

The courageous voyage of the Golden Rule and her crew inspired a similar anti-nuclear voyage in 1971 by the group that would eventually become Greenpeace. 

After the Golden Rule's crew was released from jail in 1958, the boat was sold. Many owners and half a century later, it ended up in northern California's Humboldt Bay, neglected and damaged, finally sinking in a storm.  

The Golden Rule can continue to be an inspiration for the protection of the environment and active peacemaking.  But first, we've got to get her back in the water. 

The Golden Rule Project

When Veterans for Peace learned that this irreplaceable icon of history had literally washed up on their doorstep, they formed the Golden Rule Project and set about the restoration of both the boat and her mission.

With the gracious help of many talented volunteers and generous donations from around the world, the restoration is 85% complete. But, to get the Golden Rule back on the water now requires some large capital expenses like sails, electronic navigation equipment and specialized labor. 


Who We Are  

Although the Golden Rule Project receives support from a diverse collection of people and groups, Veterans For Peace is our sponsoring organization.  We share common values and goals, and most Golden Rule Committee members belong to Veterans For Peace. 

We are committed to ending arms races and abolishing nuclear weapons, illuminating the true costs of war, and finally abolishing war as an instrument of national policy.  

The Golden Rule Project and Veterans For Peace are equally concerned about the state of the environment, and the impact of military activities upon it. In fact, we see peacemaking and the environment as being inextricably intertwined. After all, the U.S. Department of Defense is the world's number one polluter.  

We are likewise fully committed to the use of nonviolent means. The Quaker-inspired original crew of the Golden Rule pioneered the use of nonviolent direct action, and the restored boat will proudly carry that message.  

The Golden Rule Project is also supported by a number of Quakers, as was the original voyage, along with many other people of faith.  A number of Humboldt County businesses have been most generous with their support.  Lots of peace people and historic wooden boat lovers are behind us as well. 



Join The Crew

Our $10,000 goal will cover these costs, allowing us to “splash” in 2015.

The sooner the Golden Rule will be able to set sail, she'll continue on her mission, to serve as a living museum and floating classroom - educating future generations on the importance of the ocean environment, the risks of nuclear technology and the need for world peace.  


By donating to this project, you become a part of the Golden Rule's extended crew, helping to unfurl the sails of peace everywhere.  Please step up, step aboard and help us launch the dream.

In the hoped-for event that we exceed our fund raising goal , all additional funds will go toward future peace making voyages. 

The Perks

Besides knowing that you're an integral part of this important piece of peace history, your monetary contribution will get you all sorts of cool tokens of appreciation, and is tax-deductible to the fullest extent of the law. 


Join us for sea trials aboard the reborn Golden Rule as we remake history. Become an official Plank Owner. Have your name engraved on a permanent brass plaque aboard the boat. Score some fantastic bling. And lots more. Check the giving levels and pick your favorite. Every bit helps and no contribution is too small.

Can't contribute cash?  There are lots of other ways to participate! 

  • Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Reddit and your blog or on email to your friends. 
  • Do you know someone who writes about peace, anti-nuclear protests, history, Quakers, the Pacific Ocean, wooden boats, sailboat restoration or sailing? Encourage them to contact us for a story.
  • Hold a pledge party, where a computer is available for people to create accounts and pledge on the spot. 
  • Pledge in someone's honor as a gift to them.
  • Do you know any celebrities who might support the Golden Rule's mission? Encourage them to lend their name and support to our fundraiser.

From the bottom of our hearts, thank you! Even if you can't contribute now, the Golden Rule is always available for personal tours if you're in the Eureka, CA area. 

Contact us through our website,  http://vfpgoldenruleproject.org/ and we'll show you around. But, fair warning: once people see the boat, they become easily seduced by the beauty of the vessel and the dedication of the fun-loving characters who make up the project. Many soon find themselves sanding, painting, sweeping up or fundraising with us.

Although the Golden Rule Project receives support from a diverse collection of people and groups, Veterans For Peace is our sponsoring organization.  We share common values and goals, and most Golden Rule Committee members belong to Veterans For Peace. 
We are committed to ending arms races and abolishing nuclear weapons, illuminating the true costs of war, and finally abolishing war as an instrument of national policy.  
The Golden Rule Project and Veterans For Peace are equally concerned about the state of the environment, and the impact of military activities upon it. In fact, we see peacemaking and the environment as being inextricably intertwined. After all, the U.S. Department of Defense is the world's number one polluter.  
We are likewise fully committed to the use of nonviolent means. The Quaker-inspired original crew of the Golden Rule pioneered the use of nonviolent direct action, and the restored boat will proudly carry that message.  
The Golden Rule Project is also supported by a number of Quakers, as was the original voyage, along with many other people of faith.  A number of Humboldt County businesses have been most generous with their support.  Lots of peace people and historic wooden boat lovers are behind us as well. 


Join The Crew
Our $10,000 goal will cover these costs, allowing us to “splash” in 2015.

The sooner the Golden Rule will be able to set sail, she'll continue on her mission, to serve as a living museum and floating classroom - educating future generations on the importance of the ocean environment, the risks of nuclear technology and the need for world peace.  

By donating to this project, you become a part of the Golden Rule's extended crew, helping to unfurl the sails of peace everywhere.  Please step up, step aboard and help us launch the dream.
In the hoped-for event that we exceed our fund raising goal , all additional funds will go toward future peace making voyages. 
The Perks
Besides knowing that you're an integral part of this important piece of peace history, your monetary contribution will get you all sorts of cool tokens of appreciation, and is tax-deductible to the fullest extent of the law. 



Join us for sea trials aboard the reborn Golden Rule as we remake history. Become an official Plank Owner. Have your name engraved on a permanent brass plaque aboard the boat. Score some fantastic bling. And lots more. Check the giving levels and pick your favorite. Every bit helps and no contribution is too small.
Can't contribute cash?  There are lots of other ways to participate! 

Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Reddit and your blog or on email to your friends. 
Do you know someone who writes about peace, anti-nuclear protests, history, Quakers, the Pacific Ocean, wooden boats, sailboat restoration or sailing? Encourage them to contact us for a story.
Hold a pledge party, where a computer is available for people to create accounts and pledge on the spot. 
Pledge in someone's honor as a gift to them.

Do you know any celebrities who might support the Golden Rule's mission? Encourage them to lend their name and support to our fundraiser.


From the bottom of our hearts, thank you! Even if you can't contribute now, the Golden Rule is always available for personal tours if you're in the Eureka, CA area. 
Contact us through our website,  http://vfpgoldenruleproject.org/ and we'll show you around. But, fair warning: once people see the boat, they become easily seduced by the beauty of the vessel and the dedication of the fun-loving characters who make up the project. Many soon find themselves sanding, painting, sweeping up or fundraising with us.

story:
To Inspire Liberty

Hi! I’m George Donnelly, a science fiction author, blogger and libertarian activist.

I’ve teamed up with the best libertarian science fiction authors available to produce Defiant, She Advanced: Legends of Future Resistance. We’ve written ten gripping stories - 71,000 words in total - depicting courageous, defiant characters fighting for their survival. Our goal? To inspire more resistance to authority in a world dying of submission and mindless compliance.

Your support enables us to publish the first libertarian science fiction anthology in more than a decade. Together, we’ll bring our original stories of resistance to the world without big corporate publishing and DRM-free. We’ll inspire more defiance of authority, more resistance to tyranny and more heroism in a world in desperate need of it.

What We Need & What You Get

Budget

Cover Design:                  $115
Formatting:                      $110
Authors:                            $180
Marketing Expenses:   $60
Payment Processing:   $35

TOTAL: $500

(The Indiegogo minimum request is $500.)

The 6 principal authors additionally share on a pro-rata basis in the income for Defiant, She Advanced with the editor (me, also an author).

If we do not reach our goal, I will pay for as much of this as your contributions allow. I will cover the rest out of pocket.

Your Perks

  • Heartfelt Gratitude (100) $1 : We’ll thank you publicly and with an abundance of heartfelt gratitude on the Defiant, She Advanced anthology website, including a link back, at GeorgeDonnelly.com/Defiant.

  • The DRM-Free Ebook (1000) $3 : A DRM-free ebook copy of Defiant, She Advanced (PDF, EPUB & MOBI), a thank you mention in the back of the ebook and the previous perk.

  • The Gorgeous Paperback (500) $15 : A stunning paperback copy of Defiant, She Advanced, a thank you mention in the back of the paperback, a rousing, personal note of thanks from the editor and all previous perks. (Additional shipping charges may apply for those outside the continental US.)

  • Libertarian Fiction Value Pack (500) $25 :  The full-length dystopian libertarian novel, Lando Cruz and the Coup Conspiracy by George Donnelly, J.P. Medved’s libertarian political thriller novella Granite Republic and Mathew Alexander's epic libertarian science fiction adventure Withur We, all DRM-free in ebook format (PDF, EPUB & MOBI), and all previous perks.

  • Spread the Defiance (500) $50 :  Send a bulk order of five (5) paperback copies (total, inclusive) of the Defiant, She Advanced anthology to any government agency, business office, library or home, and all previous perks. (N.B.: This anthology is recommended for adults only.)

  • Just for You Flash Fiction (10) $100 : One (1) flash fiction story written just for you by the editor/co-author based on the dramatic situation you specify, Benefactor status with a thank you mention in the front of the Defiant, She Advanced ebook and paperback, and all perks from the $25 level.

  • Name a Background Character (3) $200 : Name a background character in The Death Shop, the final story in the Defiant, She Advanced anthology, receive a personalized, defiant wake-up or cheer-up call from the editor, and all  perks from the $100 level.

  • For the first taker of the $200 (or higher) perk, also receive one (1) original, mint-condition hardback copy of William F. Wu’s satiric, Western scifi novel, Hong on the Range, autographed as you like and stamped with a traditional Chinese-style red-ink chop.

  • Name a Main Character (2) $300 :  Name a main character in The Death Shop, the final story in the Defiant, She Advanced anthology, receive a personal phone call from the editor, Associate Editor credit in all editions of the anthology, and all perks from the $100 level.

  • Dedicated to You (1) $500 :  We dedicate Defiant, She Advanced exclusively to you, our regal and generous patron! Receive a personal phone call of deep appreciation and camaraderie from the editor. I'll edit your Nanowrimo or similar manuscript. Have four (4) more paperback copies. Also, all perks from the $100 level.
  • Audiobook Producer (1) $2,000:  Receive the exclusive Producer credit and thank you mention for the Defiant, She Advanced audiobook. Pitch me ideas for an audiobook-exclusive story over the phone and  I'll write one. This also includes the perks of the $500 level (it's an either-or perk).
  • Co-Author a Novel with Me (1) $5,000: We'll co-author a novel. You pitch ideas to me. We'll select one. I will develop and execute your idea and bring it to market. Includes my full participation in a face-to-face weekend creative retreat at a location that we mutually agree upon. Also includes all perks of the $100 level.

Prefer bitcoin? Of course we accept it! Send your contribution to the below address and an email to me@georgedonnelly.com.

16zb5U9cwmc2ioHU1x7c99oSKngCqUrYow


Stretch Goals

Reaching each goal overall for the campaign unlocks the corresponding perk.

$501 - Inspire More Authors. I will produce a detailed How to Produce a Libertarian Fiction Anthology article and distribute it freely so that others can more easily bring to market more libertarian fiction. Delivery: February 2015

$1,000 - Q & A Session: All backers will be invited to an online Question and Answer session with the editor and as many authors as possible. Delivery: February 2015

$1,500 - Defiance/Assertiveness Training: I will create a 1-hour, practical training course in how to be more defiant/assertive in your life and distribute it free-of-charge to all contributors. I can assure you that I am very good at being defiant/assertive and, in fact, have done a little university-level training in it. Delivery: March 2015

$2,000 - Creative Session: All backers will be invited to an online Creative  session with me in which we plan out the plot of my next novel together. Delivery: March 2015

$2,500 - Suggest something to me@georgedonnelly.com!

$3,000 - Suggest something to me@georgedonnelly.com!

$4,000 - The Professional Audiobook. I'll produce an audiobook version of the anthology and every backer will receive a complimentary copy. Delivery: May 2015

$5,000 - The Next Anthology. I'll get to work on the next libertarian science fiction anthology and every backer will receive a complimentary copy. Delivery: December 2015

$10,000 - Suggest something to me@georgedonnelly.com!

The Impact

  • You receive an emotional experience of defiance that will inspire you to remain independent and defiant of illegitimate authority in your own life.
  • You can share this experience with others by lending them the book.
  • You help other people that you don't even know to discover and experience these feelings that are so rare in a world of pervasive submission.
  • Many of the stories have strong female leads. This can inspire women in the future to stand up for themselves, their friends and families, and to play greater roles in the libertarian communities.
  • You validate the work of these eight authors and encourage us to produce more libertarian science fiction to inspire the world to greater liberty and progress in the future.
  • You create a market for more libertarian fiction by more authors, which will in turn inspire even more people to greater individual liberty and prosperity.

Risks & Challenges

The stories are written. They have been edited. The authors and the editor have signed contracts. The cover has been designed. There are no significant risks at this point. The project will happen. All we need now are readers itching for some fist-in-the-face defiance. Are you ready?

Other Ways You Can Help

  1. Please use the Indiegogo share tools so others can be inspired to defy illegitimate authority.
  2. Post a review to Amazon (preferred), Goodreads and/or on your blog.
  3. Pre-order the book on Amazon
  4. Pick up some of the authors’ other works.
  5. Send me your feedback to me@georgedonnelly.com. I would love to hear from you.
  6. Suggest stretch goals and perks.
  7. Interview one of our authors for your blog or podcast or ask your favorite podcaster or blogger to do an interview. Forward them this press release.
  8. If you're an author and would like to participate in a future anthology of any genre, let's connect now on Facebook.
  9. If you've created something artistic that aligns with the theme of Defiant, She Advanced, perhaps we can help you distribute some of your works through this indiegogo? Contact me.


The Stories

Download the anthology sampler here.

  1. The Slow Suicide of Living Again by Wendy McElroy (6,000 words) Tech Noir. Mac Jones works at a restitution agency in the Free Zone. After a routine run to Old Town, her reality begins to crumble.

  2. Thompson's Last Stand by Jake Antares (1,000 words) Dystopian. Mr. Thompson of Thompson People and Energy is fighting a war with bricks in the business district. And he’s losing.

  3. Under the Heel of the Aether Imperium by J.P. Medved  (12,000 words) Steampunk. The newest captain of the aethership Profit and Luck is caught in a conspiracy that shakes the foundation of the new galactic order when she takes a job from a strange alien.

  4. Yellowsea Yank by William F. Wu (11,000 words)  Steampunk. Kanlee Kung, an American of Chinese descent, arrives in an alternate, 1894 China in response to a desperate plea for help from his young female cousin, Meiping. He finds lies, facades and secrets at every turn.

  5. Doubleplusunhate by George Donnelly (1,000 words) Dystopian. A father in an Orwellian future takes his son off the daily goodpharm ration and teaches him Oldspeak -- until his wife discovers their crimethink.

  6. Get Kidd to Bounty by Jack McDonald Burnett  (10,000 words)  Steampunk. War veteran Karren Considine sticks her finger in the eye of Justice cop Sergeant Makepeace when she helps a Spectrum boy to safety in the next town over.

  7. The Intruder by Robert S. Hirsch (1,500 words) Hard Sci-Fi. An angry husband clashes with a home invader using swarmbot technology.

  8. Workaday by Jonathan David Baird (1,500 words) Fantasy. It’s just another day in an HR-oppressed, EPA-regulated engineering office until some unusual cargo appears in shipping.

  9. Fluorescence by J.P. Medved (500 words) Political. A child relates the story of her vibrant grandmother who defied governmental regulation and suffered for it.

  10. The Death Shop by George Donnelly (24,000 words) Dystopian. Homeless, single mom Ailsa struggles to fill her daughter’s stomach and break the girl’s addiction to viewscreen soap operas on the dreary streets of London as good people are terminated around them.

Plus a bonus essay on libertarian science fiction by Geoffrey Allan Plauché, founder of the Libertarian Fiction Authors Association.

Download the anthology sampler here.


Meet the Authors

William F. Wu is a six-time nominee for the Hugo, Nebula, and World Fantasy Awards, and author of over sixty short stories published in the science fiction and fantasy fields and thirteen novels by major New York houses. WilliamFWu.com

Wendy McElroy is an individualist anarchist and individualist feminist who has scripted and edited several dozen documentaries and written for a syndicated television show. WendyMcElroy.com

J.P. Medved writes fun steampunk adventure stories and thoughtful thrillers. When not writing, J.P. can be found frying anything he can get his hands on in his deep fat fryer. JPMedved.com

Robert S. Hirsch is an engineer turned writer, who has been in a midlife crisis for most of his mid life. After a stint in Hollywood making creatures for movies, he finished his bachelors, masters and even a Ph.D. in 1998.

Jake Antares is a writer and translator who grew up in Philadelphia and lived most of his adult life in Japan. He is currently completing his first novel.

George Donnelly is a rebel, troublemaker, accused terrorist and unreformed idealist who unschools his son and believes equally in human rights and abundant hugs before bedtime. GeorgeDonnelly.com

Jack McDonald Burnett is an attorney and a prize-winning author of short fiction. His first novel, Amethyst: Stocks and Mods Book One will be published by Combat Haiku Press in 2015. CombatHaiku.com

Jonathan David Baird is an archaeologist, specialist in late Victorian Gothic horror and the only registered Libertarian to win an elected seat in North Carolina in 2014. He is currently working towards a PhD in Humanities. NukeMars.com


Give the gift of defiance. Order a copy for a friend or family member.

story:
The Big Idea

There is an endless sea of “lifestyle magazines” out there which serve up lots of empty calories with pictures of sandy beaches and overall generic information.  

We can do better.

OpenWorld magazine is here to help you create a life of satisfaction and infinite choice... where you spend time working on projects and going places you enjoy, and doing what you love. 

There is a wide open brave new world out there waiting to be discovered - OpenWorld will be beside you, offering guidance and support, in each step in the journey.

What is OpenWorld Magazine?

A high quality, low-cost subscription magazine delivered through iTunes, Android, Desktop, and the Web with actionable, inspirational content.

OpenWorld Magazine is not your average lifestyle and travel magazine. It’s not about destinations, luxury hotels, or where to spend a gap year. It’s not some senseless tabloid like Vogue or Maxim. 

The vision for OWM is to become the most indispensable resource for you, our dear reader, to get out there in to the world, see what’s waiting for you, and tap in to your true purpose and destiny.

It’s about lifestyle discovery. OpenWorld Magazine is leading a movement to show exactly what it takes to live life on your own terms.

In each issue, we will feature :

  • Full-length features on game-changing digital nomads and lifestyle designers, hear their stories and how they got where they are
  • Break the process down into steps with takeaways and action plans that you can use
  • Inspirational stories from real people
  • Money and wealth - blueprints for creating new side hustle and streams of recurring income, with a focus on what's working now
  • Templates, systems, and procedures to get the result you want.
  • Resources for location-independent jobs, technology, new apps and hacks
  • Life, travel, and business hacks - tips to improve all aspects of your business and life
The mission is to provide a ton of killer value and critical information to help you - and others - to make your biggest lifelong “dream goals” possible.

Featured In...

My Story

My dream was to support myself without a boss and have the freedom to travel and go and do whatever I wanted. I poured my heart and soul into creating location-independent businesses to give me the freedom I sought.

Over the last five years I’ve traveled and lived in over 30 countries, and done many cool things that I’d always dreamed about doing:

  • Exploring the world’s oldest rain forest
  • Fighting bouts as a boxer in Thailand
  • Exploring the Amazon on a raft
  • Celebrating Carnivale in Brazil
  • Taking up tango dancing in Buenos Aires
  • Island-hopping via sailboat across the South China Sea
  • Riding across Vietnam on a motorcycle
  • Living in jungle camps in Borneo
  • Surfed epic breaks on remote islands in the Indian Ocean
  • Plus a ton of other adventures.

But when I started, I began at zero. I had no mentors. There were so few resources that I could consult to help me move forward. I spent hours at the library, at the park, or at the beach, speed reading through business books, in search of valuable nuggets.

Then “The Four Hour Workweek” came out and it talked about the “New Rich.” But it seemed like all these people had superpowers. Tim Ferriss himself went to Princeton. The case studies in the book seemed cherry-picked and I couldn’t replicate them. 

I didn’t know how to start. How could an average person like myself live this kind of life? It seemed like an impossible fantasy.

Wallowing in my despair, I lacked the confidence and direction to take any meaningful action. I felt like I was mindlessly spinning the wheels, and just following some senseless routine.

More than anything I feared living the next 40-50 years of my life like this.

What I needed back then were role models. I needed a supportive community community of peers like me, helping and learning from one other. I needed valuable information that I could use - and actually implement - to take the next step.

That’s when I had my “AHA” moment - and that’s how OpenWorld Magazine was born. 

Let's Make This Happen

My ethos is to help you discover and live your best life.

As I’ve traveled the world these last five years, I’ve met all types of inspiring and unique people doing things I never thought possible.

As I met more and more of these individuals I wanted to create a platform to share their stories and ask: “How on earth did you do it?” 

I want to present actual ideas, inspiration, and practical techniques to make our lives and the world better.

If you want to travel the world, create an online business that frees you from the shackles of wage slavery, or pursue your lifelong passions and do what you really love... this is a resource to serve you.

There are is a wide open brave new world out there waiting to be discovered - OpenWorld will be beside you, offering guidance and support, in each step in the journey.

The magazine is here to help you create a life of satisfaction and infinite choice... where you spend time working on projects and going places you enjoy, and doing what you love. 

A life of passion, purpose, and freedom.

Imagine... and help us make this vision reality. Through this journey, we can help many others in the process, too.

I want to empower you with the tools and content to feed your mind, fuel your passions, and inspire to realize your ultimate purpose and vision.

Be a game-changer. Join the OpenWorld movement, and live life to your full potential.

What We Need & What You Get

$2,200 is the minimum amount that we need to get off the ground. We have various fixed costs in terms of software and production, and with your help we'll have enough to get started!

I can’t do this alone - but together, we can create something special.

We also have a variety of special perks for backers:

  • Discounted 1 year, 2 year, and lifetime subscriptions. You'll also become a VIP club member with special perks and receive free giveaways on new products first!
  • Discounted sponsorship opportunities. Full length features in both our magazine and podcast, reaching tens of thousands of targeted listeners monthly. Place yourself front and center in front of our savvy global community of professionals, startup entrepreneurs, remote workers, and digital nomads.

Please help us and get behind this project if you can. Whether you pledge or just share the link to this page and spread the word, everything helps.

To manifest this vision in the world, you can pledge anything -- from the cost of a cup of coffee all the way up to a premium sponsorship. 

Join us, become a part of the OpenWorld planet, and help us spread the word!


Who's Behind this Madness?

My name is Danny Flood. In addition to creating OpenWorld, I have also self-published four books designed to help digital nomads and aspiring laptop entrepreneurs, and host the OpenWorld podcast. 

I have over 5 years experience running businesses from my laptop while traveling as a nomad, and experience in online publishing and content marketing. I am 100% passionate and committed to achieving the goals for OpenWorld Magazine.

It is time to take it to the next level.  I want you to join me.

Danny Flood
Editor, OpenWorld
story_txt:
The Big Idea


There is an endless sea of “lifestyle magazines” out there which serve up lots of empty calories with pictures of sandy beaches and overall generic information.  


We can do better.
OpenWorld magazine is here to help you create a life of satisfaction and infinite choice... where you spend time working on projects and going places you enjoy, and doing what you love. 
There is a wide open brave new world out there waiting to be discovered - OpenWorld will be beside you, offering guidance and support, in each step in the journey.
What is OpenWorld Magazine?

A high quality, low-cost subscription magazine delivered through iTunes, Android, Desktop, and the Web with actionable, inspirational content.





OpenWorld Magazine is not your average lifestyle and travel magazine. It’s not about destinations, luxury hotels, or where to spend a gap year. It’s not some senseless tabloid like Vogue or Maxim. 


The vision for OWM is to become the most indispensable resource for you, our dear reader, to get out there in to the world, see what’s waiting for you, and tap in to your true purpose and destiny.


It’s about lifestyle discovery. OpenWorld Magazine is leading a movement to show exactly what it takes to live life on your own terms.


In each issue, we will feature :

Full-length features on game-changing digital nomads and lifestyle designers, hear their stories and how they got where they are
Break the process down into steps with takeaways and action plans that you can use
Inspirational stories from real people
Money and wealth - blueprints for creating new side hustle and streams of recurring income, with a focus on what's working now
Templates, systems, and procedures to get the result you want.
Resources for location-independent jobs, technology, new apps and hacks
Life, travel, and business hacks - tips to improve all aspects of your business and life

The mission is to provide a ton of killer value and critical information to help you - and others - to make your biggest lifelong “dream goals” possible.


Featured In...



My Story






My dream was to support myself without a boss and have the freedom to travel and go and do whatever I wanted. I poured my heart and soul into creating location-independent businesses to give me the freedom I sought.


Over the last five years I’ve traveled and lived in over 30 countries, and done many cool things that I’d always dreamed about doing:


Exploring the world’s oldest rain forest
Fighting bouts as a boxer in Thailand
Exploring the Amazon on a raft
Celebrating Carnivale in Brazil
Taking up tango dancing in Buenos Aires
Island-hopping via sailboat across the South China Sea
Riding across Vietnam on a motorcycle
Living in jungle camps in Borneo
Surfed epic breaks on remote islands in the Indian Ocean
Plus a ton of other adventures.





But when I started, I began at zero. I had no mentors. There were so few resources that I could consult to help me move forward. I spent hours at the library, at the park, or at the beach, speed reading through business books, in search of valuable nuggets.


Then “The Four Hour Workweek” came out and it talked about the “New Rich.” But it seemed like all these people had superpowers. Tim Ferriss himself went to Princeton. The case studies in the book seemed cherry-picked and I couldn’t replicate them. 


I didn’t know how to start. How could an average person like myself live this kind of life? It seemed like an impossible fantasy.


Wallowing in my despair, I lacked the confidence and direction to take any meaningful action. I felt like I was mindlessly spinning the wheels, and just following some senseless routine.


More than anything I feared living the next 40-50 years of my life like this.


What I needed back then were role models. I needed a supportive community community of peers like me, helping and learning from one other. I needed valuable information that I could use - and actually implement - to take the next step.


That’s when I had my “AHA” moment - and that’s how OpenWorld Magazine was born. 




Let's Make This Happen
My ethos is to help you discover and live your best life.
As I’ve traveled the world these last five years, I’ve met all types of inspiring and unique people doing things I never thought possible.
As I met more and more of these individuals I wanted to create a platform to share their stories and ask: “How on earth did you do it?” 
I want to present actual ideas, inspiration, and practical techniques to make our lives and the world better.
If you want to travel the world, create an online business that frees you from the shackles of wage slavery, or pursue your lifelong passions and do what you really love... this is a resource to serve you.
There are is a wide open brave new world out there waiting to be discovered - OpenWorld will be beside you, offering guidance and support, in each step in the journey.
The magazine is here to help you create a life of satisfaction and infinite choice... where you spend time working on projects and going places you enjoy, and doing what you love. 
A life of passion, purpose, and freedom.
Imagine... and help us make this vision reality. Through this journey, we can help many others in the process, too.
I want to empower you with the tools and content to feed your mind, fuel your passions, and inspire to realize your ultimate purpose and vision.
Be a game-changer. Join the OpenWorld movement, and live life to your full potential.



What We Need & What You Get


$2,200 is the minimum amount that we need to get off the ground. We have various fixed costs in terms of software and production, and with your help we'll have enough to get started!
I can’t do this alone - but together, we can create something special.
We also have a variety of special perks for backers:

Discounted 1 year, 2 year, and lifetime subscriptions. You'll also become a VIP club member with special perks and receive free giveaways on new products first!
Discounted sponsorship opportunities. Full length features in both our magazine and podcast, reaching tens of thousands of targeted listeners monthly. Place yourself front and center in front of our savvy global community of professionals, startup entrepreneurs, remote workers, and digital nomads.


Please help us and get behind this project if you can. Whether you pledge or just share the link to this page and spread the word, everything helps.

To manifest this vision in the world, you can pledge anything -- from the cost of a cup of coffee all the way up to a premium sponsorship.

story:
**image: Four of the six core members of the team. The signs read:

The University of Vermont need the F-Bomb because...
"an academic institution needs an intelligent outlet for feminist conversation"
"feminism is still alive and relevant"
"I want a magazine that speaks to me, my life and the things I care about!"
"Magazines shouldn't tell women how to be less but instead should encourage them to be more"

Who We Are and What We Believe 

The F-Bomb team is an independent student group at the University of Vermont who believe a feminist publication is long overdue. The goal of this publication is to diffuse stereotypes surrounding gender equality and to raise awareness in a safe, informative, and (slightly) unbiased manner. 

Mission Statement

The F-Bomb is committed to reinventing the conversations surrounding Feminism, femininity, gender equality, and sexual liberation. We aim to lessen the negative associations people have with these terms and create a space in which everyone can feel safe, supported, and heard. We seek to deconstruct stigmas and stereotypes whose goals are to belittle women and minimize their power, efficacy, and voice and are committed to proving magazines with female audiences can be informative, upbeat, and sexy without being inherently sexist, degrading, or demoralizing. The F-Bomb strives to foster every woman’s potential and are invested in ending the discrimination between sexes.
The F-Bomb is dedicated to creating a space for female empowerment.

What We Need & What You Get

We are going to have an online version of the magazine as well as a printed version. To print 1,000 copies of our mag, we will need to raise roughly $2,000. Because this monetary goal is a moving target, we added an extra $500 to give ourselves a cushion. If we do not use all $2,500 for our first print, it will go to the second addition of the magazine. If you donate, we will send you a copy! 

    Why We Need You

    Sexism is still an important thread that holds together the fabric of our society, and college campuses are perfect isolated examples of this. From the university's Greek life to male dominated discussions in the classroom, as students at UVM we have first hand accounts of every day sexism. It is critical to the dismantling of this sexism to have open dialogue about it and to raise awareness in a safe, supportive, and educated environment.  With the F-Bomb we hope to instill long lasting progress at our University (and hopeful other institutions) so that when our children attend UVM all genders will be treated with respect, dignity, and in a completely unbiased manner. By donating to our cause, you will become an invaluable member of the domino effect we hope to create at the University of Vermont. 

      Risks & Challenges

      Time and money. We are a student group which means our education is our number one priority. Although we would love to spend all our time writing articles and perfecting pages, we also have 18 credits to worry about in addition to outside jobs. However, if we had the proper funding, this would alleviate us of the stress of applying for grants and brainstorming different fundraising events, and we could use our precious spare time to compose new articles and images. 

        Other Ways You Can Help 

        Spread the word! Talk about feminism! Question the socially constructed concepts of gender identities and gender roles! Respect everyone not because they are female, male, transgender, cisgender, or anything in between but because they are a fellow human of this Earth and because we should treat everyone with the same loving-kindness we too hope to receive.

story:
What Is This All About?

Well, Michael Sugden has decided to throw his hat into the political ring. His 11 months of campaigning, knocking on doors, throwing "parties in the park", and getting the word out begins in May. So this party is the official launch of the campaign. This party is being sponsored by "Friends of Michael Sugden". 

What We Need & What You Get

Donations are needed to make the campaign happen. The campaign rules have set limits on personal donations. We can only accept $408 from an individual ($816 for a couple ... see what we did there?) throughout the entire campaign.

After months of thinking, we thought this would be an "innovative" way to reach out to "nontraditional" donors who may have not heard about this campaign without this Indiegogo launch.

But what do I get for my donation? Good thing you asked! Here are the perks:

  • $10 = A Facebook and Twitter Shoutout!
  • $20 = A Handwritten Letter
  • $50 = Campaign T-Shirt, Sticker, & Pen
  • $100 = Thank you Video
  • $250 = Coffee Chat
    (all donation levels above $10 receive all previous level perks as well)

      The Impact

      Our campaign has some awesome ideas to help improve the 11th District. By obtaining the funds to host the launch party, we can give Michael the strong start that he will need to win the election.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Follow the campaign! Visit us online at www.sugden2016.com

story:
And So It Begins...

My name is Corey R. Parsley and I am a self published author on Amazon: Kindle and the time has finally come to bring my first Novel, Diamond into the physical realm. It deserves to be held and read by its amazing readers. This fundraiser will make that possible. By your generous donations it will become a reality and not only that, but I will be hosting an official book signing on December 15th 1:30 P.M. to 3 P.M. at the Woodward Park Library in Fresno, California. 

Now, would you like to know what else I may have in store? I thought you'd never ask! PRIZES! Of course! 

The Journey and The Treasures...

There will be FIVE levels of perks for you amazing readers to buy and all of the money goes toward ordering physical copies of Diamond as well as the awesome loot you'll be receiving at the book signing or by mail! 

Bronze - A "Diamond" Bracelet($5) Infinite Amount

Silver - A "Diamond" Bracelet, A signed copy of the book, and a book mark with your sponsorship on it! ($25) There shall only be a limit of 25 silvers so better grab 'em fast!

Gold - Everything that comes in Silver plus, a signed "Diamond" Poster!(50$) This is shall only be available for 10 generous sponsors! 

Platinum - Everything included with Gold plus, A "Diamond" Coffee Mug with assorted candy inside! Now that's what I call a delicious prize!($75) This tasty treasure shall only be around for 7 beautiful people! 

And lastly, if you can guess the theme by now you have guessed the final Perk!

Diamond - Everything that comes with Platinum tied all together in a pretty bow(probably now really tied in a bow, but you get everything PLUS!) A Serene Seal Wooden Plaque! Now that'll look nicely on your mantle or hanging on your wall! ($100) This sparkling prize shall only be given to 3 Prestigious Sponsors! 

We need to raise 2,000 dollars by the end of November in order to pull this off ladies and gentlemen and your support is so greatly appreciated! 

Departing Letter...

Readers, writers, treasure hunters, activists, and gem seekers alike this fundraiser is just the beginning of something so much greater! As I recall November is also NaNoWriMo which I will be participating in in order to quickly bring you the Sequel! So, keep those smiles of excitement and look forward to this event, because it's going to be a spark that starts a massive fire. As you begin Colton's adventure with him in December I will be continuing it in November and further. Finally, through all of this I always remember one thing that has stuck with from the very beginning back in August of 2007. Whenever I am within the darkest abyss or am overwhelmed with chaos of this world I simply...Embrace the Light.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Zella. I am a 15-year-old dancer, aerial acrobat, singer, stilter and puppeteer. I am adding writing and poetry to the list. 

I need your support to help me reach my goal and send me to the 2013 Unschool Adventures Writing Retreat in Crested Butte, Colorado. My primary goal at the retreat is to write 100 one-page poems, and self-publish a book of my own poetry.

Your contributions will help pay for airfare and tuition to the Unschool Advertures Writing Retreat, where I will join 25 other homeschoolers from around the country.  We will  stay in Colorado for a month, attending workshops, writing, singing, dancing, and growing as a community.

This is the first time I have done anything like this.  I am ready to go out in the wider world and meet other people, make new connections, and have adventures with other teens who share my passions.  This will help me grow as both an artist and as a person.

What I Need & What You Get

I will need $2500 for this advenutre - $1700 for the actual cost of the retreat, and $800 for travel and in-town expences.

For those of you who help me out I have some special perks, all of which are focused on the poetry writen on the retreat.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute you can still help me!  Call, email, tweet, message, and text your friends and family.  Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.  You can also use the Indiegogo share tools. 

*UPDATE*

Thank you all for your wonderful support.  I can't believe you helped me reach my goal with 10 days left!  

People can still send money and spread the word.  Any further donations I get will go towards offsetting the fees paid to indiegogo and paypal.

If there is anything left, or people give a lot more than what's needed for my retreat, all extra money will go towards my continued arts and academics education.  I already pay for many of my dance and academic classes, and every little bit helps!

Thanks again! 

Much love!

story:
Who am I and why am I doing this?


I alluded to this all in the description and video, but let me state things very clearly. I'm a college student studying Advertising and English. I'm 22 years old. In the grand scheme of things, though my mom may disagree, I'm a very unimportant person. I'm not trying to be hard on myself, I just realize that I'm young, and have yet to really do anything in my life. In today's world, differentiating yourself and doing something above and beyond what is expected of you, is almost required to get a job. Since I'm a student soon to be graduating, what I can do now to really set myself apart and prepare myself to get a job weighs heavily on my mind. 


This line of thinking goes hand-in-hand with knowing who I am and what I am capable of. Writing has always been a part of my life, and though I have never been published I consider writing to be one of my personal strengths. In fact, it is such a strength that I want to compliment my repertoire and resume by highlighting my ability to tell a story in a concise manner. This lead me to the idea of writing a children's book. Not just any children's book however, but a Star Wars children's book. By funding this project, contributors are not only helping me to get a job, but also helping me get an education and potentially helping my future children go to bed. 

Why Star Wars?

Along with writing, I have always been a gigantic Star Wars fan. I've written reviews of Star Wars movies and even tried my hand at creating a Star Wars blog once. It's something I know a lot about (and I'm not ashamed to admit it!). Furthermore, I think there a lot of great stories within the Star Wars universe that adults and children a like would love to hear! One of those stories is the that of IG-88, the assassin droid. That is why I chose him to be the main character of my story.

Since this is Star Wars, I cannot publish this book (since I have no licencing or permission from Lucas Films). If I try and make a profit from the book, I will likely be sued. That is not my intention however, my intention is to highlight a fan fiction children's story that I wrote myself, that I can show to recruiters and potential employers to give myself an edge in finding a job. That's my intention. I don't plan to distribute the book. 

Why do I need money?

I can do all of the writing myself, but creating a children's book requires more than just clever writing.

  • A picture book without pictures is worthless. Regrettably, I can only draw in stick figures. Hence, the main reason that I need funding is to pay to have someone illustrate my book. I think that I can hire someone to illustrate this book for around $500. That may not seem like much, but for a college student living from paycheck to paycheck, it isn't really feasible. 
  • Physically printing the book will also cost me money, though I plan on paying for that just out of pocket. I only plan on printing ONE physical copy of the book for my own PERSONAL use. Though I would be happy to send a physical copy to anyone willing to contribute over a specific amount. 
  • If I reach more than my intended goal, I will put the money towards creating a second book (which I've already begun writing) that illustrates the story of another character from Star Wars (General Greivous). 
  • All contributors are welcome to receive a digital copy of the completed and illustrated children's book.

The Impact

Contributing to this cause will really make a difference. No, you won't save any kids in Africa, and no you won't end world hunger... But you will make a difference in my life. Once again, I'm a nobody... but maybe with your help I can become a somebody?

I'm not trying to be hard on myself, I just realize that I'm young, and have yet to really do anything in my life. In today's world, differentiating yourself and doing something above and beyond what is expected of you, is almost required to get a job. Since I'm a student soon to be graduating, what I can do now to really set myself apart and prepare myself to get a job weighs heavily on my mind. 

This line of thinking goes hand-in-hand with knowing who I am and what I am capable of. Writing has always been a part of my life, and though I have never been published I consider writing to be one of my personal strengths. In fact, it is such a strength that I want to compliment my repertoire and resume by highlighting my ability to tell a story in a concise manner. This lead me to the idea of writing a children's book. Not just any children's book however, but a Star Wars children's book. By funding this project, contributors are not only helping me to get a job, but also helping me get an education and potentially helping my future children go to bed. 

Why Star Wars?

Along with writing, I have always been a gigantic Star Wars fan. I've written reviews of Star Wars movies and even tried my hand at creating a Star Wars blog once. It's something I know a lot about (and I'm not ashamed to admit it!). Furthermore, I think there a lot of great stories within the Star Wars universe that adults and children a like would love to hear! One of those stories is the that of IG-88, the assassin droid. That is why I chose him to be the main character of my story.
Since this is Star Wars, I cannot publish this book (since I have no licencing or permission from Lucas Films). If I try and make a profit from the book, I will likely be sued. That is not my intention however, my intention is to highlight a fan fiction children's story that I wrote myself, that I can show to recruiters and potential employers to give myself an edge in finding a job. That's my intention. I don't plan to distribute the book. 


Why do I need money?
I can do all of the writing myself, but creating a children's book requires more than just clever writing.

A picture book without pictures is worthless. Regrettably, I can only draw in stick figures. Hence, the main reason that I need funding is to pay to have someone illustrate my book. I think that I can hire someone to illustrate this book for around $500. That may not seem like much, but for a college student living from paycheck to paycheck, it isn't really feasible. 
Physically printing the book will also cost me money, though I plan on paying for that just out of pocket. I only plan on printing ONE physical copy of the book for my own PERSONAL use. Though I would be happy to send a physical copy to anyone willing to contribute over a specific amount. 
If I reach more than my intended goal, I will put the money towards creating a second book (which I've already begun writing) that illustrates the story of another character from Star Wars (General Greivous). 
All contributors are welcome to receive a digital copy of the completed and illustrated children's book.



The Impact
Contributing to this cause will really make a difference. No, you won't save any kids in Africa, and no you won't end world hunger... But you will make a difference in my life. Once again, I'm a nobody... but maybe with your help I can become a somebody?

story:
My name is Billi Wagner. I'm a married mother of six (three of them teenagers) and an author. I have a mystery series published with a small press under a pen name because I wanted to keep my YA work separate. I only mention this because I've been through the publishing process and while I'm not an expert, I know what I need to do to make this the best book it can be. 
I decided to self-publish my Kindred Spirits series for a couple of reasons. The first being that my publisher only does e-books for the first year and I want this series available in print. The Young adult genre reaches all age groups, but I know a lot of teenagers who don't have e-readers. 
The second and most important reason is creative control. This has been a family project from the beginning. I wanted my daughter on the cover, as she inspired the main character Hallow. Most publishers have final say on everything, including cover art and would not have allowed that. I'm not saying it's a bad thing, it's just not how I wanted this series to go. 
Everyone is a part of the process from my daughter Scarlett doing videos in character to my son Jakob who is a computer whiz. Even the youngest ones contribute in small ways. Everyone is excited about the first book 'Haunting Echoes' because they've been a part of it every step of the way and I would love for you to be a part of it too.  In some cases, I mean that literally, you can be written into my story. There's more about that in perks. First I want to tell you what the story is about.        
                                 
16 year old Hallow Reid has had a rough year. She's lost her boyfriend, her popularity and now her freedom. After a devastating car accident, she finds herself enrolled in Koops, an institute for displaced teens, without any memory of how she got there.
Koops is a frightening place, full of strange happenings and secretive whispers. Hallow quickly becomes convinced both the students and the faculty are hiding something from her, but it isn't until an attempt is made on her life-correction afterlife-that she realizes the horrifying truth. She did NOT survive the accident.
Hallow may be a ghost, but to her relief she learns that she isn't dead. At least not yet. Her spirit is trapped in between this world and the next and if she wants to get her life back she has to pass a series of trials to prove herself worthy before her body expires. 
To make matters worse, a dark entity has found its way inside Koops and no one is safe-least of all Hallow, for her soul calls to him above all others and he will stop at nothing to have her. When spirits are killed in Limbo, the battle of souls becomes more than a fight for life-but for eternity.
           

First of all, I would never ask someone to contribute to a project I hadn't invested in myself. I didn't just write a book, but paid to have a professional cover made. It wasn't cheap, but people do judge a book by it's cover and I didn't want to take any chances by doing it myself. 

My cover artist Claudia McKinney is a professional who works with traditional publishers like Random House and has done covers for famous authors including Amanda Hocking and Kami Garcia, one of the authors of Beautiful Creatures.  I wanted my daughter on the cover, so we hired a photographer and had the pictures sent to her so she could work her magic. 

After Claudia finished with the artwork, it was forwarded to the Font Diva, who will also be doing the spine and back cover after editing is complete and providing me with both print and e-book sizes. All this is already paid for, but we're a one income family and it's impossible to finance this alone and still release it as soon as I would like. That's where you come in. With your help, we can make our dream a reality and bring Hallow's story to life.

What still needs paid for? The next step is editing. It costs around $500 for a comprehensive edit, which is everything from proof reading  to content. With my previous books I went through several edits before the final galley was ready and I really believe this is a necessary expense.  It makes the book so much better and to keep people interested in a series, it needs to be up to industry standards.

The rest of the money will go to formatting, paying for an ISBN number, a publishing name (so the book can get into bookstores),  the most affordable advertising I can find to get the word out (it doesn't do any good to make a book if no one knows it exists) fees and perks. Pretty much all the little things that can add up to a whole lot.

I'd love to do a print run, if there's any money left, but there's always print on demand with Create space and I tried to keep my goal as reasonable as possible, without sacrificing quality.  I chose flex funding, so if we don't make the goal (fingers crossed that we do) we can get started, while I save up toward the rest. This project will  happen. There's no risk in investing because I already have and I'm not going to quit on something I've put so much money into myself, not to mention time and energy. The only difference between meeting our goal and not is time. 

If we get the full amount of the funding I hope to have the book released this October. What better time to launch a ghost story right? If we don't make our goal it will take longer-how much depends on how close we get. I'll update everyone when we get near our end date for the campaign. All perks will be delivered no matter what if you contribute to this project and we have some pretty cool perks or as my daughter would say 'Epic'.

                          

There are multiple levels and as you rank up you get more stuff, including everything that comes before your chosen perk. The last three levels allow you to become part of the story, either by naming or developing a character that may continue into the next book 'Tortured Souls', depending on the level you choose. The reason I can do this is that I haven't gone to edits yet. I can easily weave more characters into the story before sending it off and what a fun perk, knowing this character that readers love or love to hate is your creation or based on you or someone you know. I can't imagine a better way to be included in a creative project than contributing a part of yourself. Not just money.

                               

Every little bit helps and is worthy of acknowledgement…literally. If you give to this campaign you have our gratitude and a mention on the acknowledgements page.                                   

You get our gratitude and a mention on the acknowledgements page, as with the Kind Soul level, but as a Phantom Fan you also get listed as a supporter on the kindredspiritsnovels.com website, my Facebook fan page and my main character  Hallow herself will give you a shout out in a special thank you video on the Hallow Reads Youtube channel!                                  

                              

At the Amazing Apparition level you get the gratitude, acknowledgements and shout out from the previous two levels, as well as a copy of the e-book sent  to you via email before anyone else gets it!             

                            

As a Guiding Light you get everything from the previous three levels, including the Haunting Echoes e-book and an autographed postcard featuring the cover and book summary!        

                         

You get everything from the previous levels, including the e-book and autographed post card, but as a Kindred Spirit you also get a copy of the paperback book with personal inscription from the main character Hallow and a Haunting  Echoes bookmark.

                         

At the Spook-tacular' level you get all of the above, a mini poster featuring the book cover, a blackbird pin which makes you an honorary Koops (Spook High) student and a character in the story named after you or a loved one.    

                           

 As a 'Higher being' you get all of the above and the character you name from the previous level will get killed in Limbo, which ensures their return in book two 'Tortured Souls'. To commemorate this you'll receive a character card featuring your character's picture on one side with bio and the book cover on the other.

                            

There can only be one Ghost With The Most and once the title is claimed it's gone. Not only do you get everything from all the previous levels, but you also get to work with me (the author) through email to help bring your character to life by defining things like appearance, quirks and flaws. I will try to stay as true to your vision as I can, so long as it doesn't conflict with the story arc. It will be almost as if you wrote the character yourself! 

                        

                 

I understand there are a lot of meaningful projects out there that you could be contributing to and perks aside, there is more to this book than an entertaining story about ghosts.  I have teenagers of my own. I've met their friends, even taken in a couple when they had nowhere else to go. I've heard and experienced some of the horrors they go through. They face very real issues today, like bullying, cutting, low-self esteem, peer pressure and more. Some even find their lives so awful they would rather die than continue suffering. The secondary plot regarding the trials is about owning their issues and realizing it's okay to be different and no matter how bad things get, they can survive it. I weave these messages into the plot without getting preachy, because let me tell you teenagers hate being preached at by adults. They don't confide in their parents anymore and we often don't discover something is terribly wrong until it's too late. They don't realize that we were teenagers once too and their pain is our pain. I'm hoping each teenager who reads this book can find a character they relate to with common interests or issues and see that they are not alone.  I believe that is what makes this project worthy of your time and I hope you agree.                

                                


Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Spread the word about this campaign. Talk about it and share links on your social networking sites. The more activity it gets, the more the campaign gets seen by people exploring on Indiegogo without a direct link.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools! The more people that share, the more we can get ourselves out there.
  • If enough people have contributors message me with referral names I may be able to do a randomizer raffle for a small gift card or come up with some swag to reward your efforts.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
About Atlas

Atlas Magazine is a student-run, student-funded organization at Emerson College. Each semester, we publish a lifestyle magazine with innovative, entertaining, and thought-provoking content across seven sections: Arts, Style, Health, Campus, City, Globe and Career. This semester, we aim to bring our next issue, Origins, to Emerson's campus and beyond. We hope to print 250 issues. But first, we need your help. 

How You Can Help

  • Donate! Whether you're able to contribute $5, $10, or $100 to our campaign, your support means the world to our staff. 100% of funds support printing expenses.
  • Share! Can't donate? Instead, spread the word via social media. Tweet, Facebook, or reblog our campaign to help us spread the word.

Connect with us

Website // Past Issues // Twitter // Facebook

If interested in advertising with us, please see our Media Kit and Atlas Online.

We aim to be as accurate a representation of the Emerson Community as possible, so if you have any questions, concerns, suggestions or feedback contact us at emersonatlasmag@gmail.com.

story:
Short Summary

A beautiful brick building with stained glass and hardwood pews, remains empty after 3 years. You can help save it!

My name is Jordan Gardner. I am an assistant pastor of Solid Rock Community Church in Harvard, IL. This campaign is purposed to raise funds towards the downpayment for financing this beautiful building for our congregation to meet. Currently, we are filling a storefront to its maximum capacity and have become in dire need of a larger location. Three years ago, we rented this building and due to the high rent and gas expences due to a very low efficiency gas-heated boiler, we moved to our current location. After being foreclosed on, the price has continually decreased to a point now that it would be a wise decision to purchase. We need your help!

With a full-service kitchen that meets food safety requirements, we will be able to offer a low to no-income soup kitchen for Harvard and its surrounding area. With the classrooms, it will once again be possible to conduct Sunday School for our youth and with the open fellowship hall, we will be able to expand our youth service that reaches out local children and teens.

This purchase would mean so much to our church congregation and community. If you are able to contribute please donate now, otherwise please share with others. 

What We Need & What You Get

Here is the breakdown of where the money is going:

  • $15,000 is going directly to American Community Bank of Woodstock, IL for downpayment.
  • $10,000 will be paid to an HVAC operator to install a higher efficiency heating and cooling system. 

Here are the perks to those who give:

  1. $100- you will receive a thank you letter signed by the whole congregation.
  2. $150- you will receive the thank you letter and a SRCC t-shirt.
  3. $500- you will receive the thank you letter, the t-shirt, and will sit at the dedication service as a guest of honor (hotel room included)
  4. $1,000- you will receive the thank you letter, the t-shirt, the guest of honor, and a plaque with your name on it hung on a wall in the sanctuary.
  5. $2,000- you will receive the thank you letter, the t-shirt, the guest of honor, the plaque and will have the exclusive honor of cutting the ceremonial ribbon. 

If we do not meet our entire goal, the funds will be applied towards that goal and other fundraising options will be necessary. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean we don't need you! Here's what you can do:

  • Get the word out and make some noise in conversation or social media such as facebook and twitter.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
You Can't Be a Failure is a motivational book that will definitely help people re-connect with themselves and their dreams, live meaningfully, and grow to their full potential.

What Is This Book About?

Here is the excerpt from the Introduction:

Life sucks! Life's a bitch! Life’s unfair!

Are you familiar with these words? They express the frustrations of millions who have encountered “failure” and feel like nothing seems to work. This book is for you if you have felt or feel that way. You start a business and your hopes rise, but then some unseen force comes knocking everything off and you are zeroed, broke as they say, without knowing why. You get a new job, an increase in salary, and you raise a glass of wine toasting your success with friends. You think that everything has fallen into place, but you soon discover that your debt is tripled and that your misery only increases.

Then you start asking the million dollar questions: What is really the problem with life? Why can’t I get what I really want in life? Why is my dream job given to someone who doesn’t seem to like it or who can’t do it well? Why can’t my business attract as many clients as my competitor’s? Why can’t I be successful in my relationships, in my career, in getting rich …and why does the famous Secret seem to work for everyone but me?

At this point you want to believe that something is seriously wrong with life. You’re wrong again. There is nothing wrong with life. If there is anything wrong, it is the way you look at life, the way you treat it, and the way you receive it. Uncle Sam always said the damn world doesn't care shit about who you are or how much you claim to know. It really only cares about the tough ones out there, and you’re going to have to be tough enough to create your own space. 

The most successful people of all time have experienced that emotion when they were first met with failure, and they made the choice or choices that changed their lives in incredible ways. Life continues to knock down people who still dream with their eyes closed. Failure comes in to wake you to live the beauty of your dreams. “It's time you start your journey,” it seems to say. That is what this book is all about: discovering the seed of success and making it grow to its potential in your life. It’s about dreams and the key to unlocking those dreams.

You can’t live without your dream, but you have the choice to shy away from it or to allow it to transform you and the world around you. Whether you are aware of your dream or not, your life will remain barren unless you discover the one thing for which you’re ready to sacrifice it. If you have lost faith in your dream and yourself, you need to read this book. You need to reconnect with your dream, because if you don’t, your life will be a big lie. It’s never with pride you hear people say: “I should have been a great musician, a reputable lawyer, a renowned motivational speaker, a successful writer, an inventor of the next big thing if…” They have always said such things with regret at not pursuing their dream, feeling like they stole a space in the universe that wasn’t really theirs, barely squeezing themselves in. 

If you do not pursue your dream for yourself, you should do it for others. When you resolutely go after your dreams, you create a path through which others can walk in life. It’s the debt you owe to life and humanity - the debt to grow to the full stature of your dreams. Your dream has the tremendous power to transform your life, and in so doing, it creates a path through which more life flows into the world.

You might have read other books, watched inspirational and motivational videos, attended seminars, and explored every avenue of creating wealth and living meaningfully. After trying all the tips and putting the motivational pieces of advice into practice, you might still feel like that dream wasn’t meant for you. You might have blamed it on chance, on the cruel world that continually conspires against you, or the capitalist system that continues to suck the blood from the poor to feed the already rich and successful people. You might have thought you aren’t getting it right when you see people who seem to be less talented than you achieving success and making money as though they were born with the Midas touch. At some point, you begin to despair and you think: “It wasn’t really meant for me. I should have known all along that I am destined for failure.”

You’re awfully wrong.

You couldn’t be more wrong than that.

You are sculpted for success, and there is no dream that isn’t possible. You can only dream what life offers you. All you have to do is reach out and accept that dream.

Your only obstacle to making the next big success story is you. It’s the way you think.

Thought is powerful. Thought is what transforms the world. If you doubt it, think about the wonderful inventions that now make people travel faster than it could have been possible some few decades ago; think about the digital devices, the infrastructure, and the skyscrapers that tower right up into the sky as though telling you with a forefinger, “This is the amazing thing about what your thoughts can achieve.”

Your thoughts are things. The bigger those thoughts, the more incredible the things they create.

This book doesn’t offer you what you do not have. It will only offer you tips on how to become the master of what you possess and how to make it grow. You already have the key to success, the secret that rich and successful people have discovered. It’s the power of your mind. In part one of this book, we will explore thought patterns that can hinder you from mastering the secret and how they define you. In part two, you’ll learn how to eliminate these thought patterns and attain inner freedom. The last part offers insights on how to empower yourself, re-claim your dream and make it become a reality. Before you continue reading this book, I would like to mention that you may find the style a bit hurting because of the overgeneralizations. I have consciously used this style in a manner of speaking.

What Others Say About This Book

""If you have lost faith in your dream and yourself, you need to read this book... It'll save humanity from despair and failure. It has saved me." Fr. Dufe Joseph OFM Cap.

“I highly recommend this book for anyone and for everyone seeking to take control of their dreams and to grow to their full potential; it is the best companion for seekers and dreamers.”

Samuel Vera Cruz, MA, Philosophy Professor, University of the Philippines.

“After reading this book you’ll definitely feel different. You’ll think differently. It feels like waking up into a new world with endless possibilities … your real world!”

Catherine Oda, English Professor, Loyola School of Theology.


Where Is the Money Going?

Editing:  $500
Isbn's and Barcodes:  $300
Rewards: $400
Indiegogo's cut: ~$100
Cover design:  $100
Printing/binding:  $1400
Total cost =  $2500

If we go being the target, then a lot can happen, including more marketing.

What Do You Get From It?

I believe that gratitude is the memory of the heart, and yes, I can't thank you enough for being part of this book project. No one can thank you enough for helping another person make a big story; however, I have included perks that you can find at the top right hand side of this campaign, including freebies, handwritten letters from me (using the notepad I used for a year while writing this book), signed copies of the book, and acknowledgments in the book. Everyone will receive some kind of appreciation from me.

Can't Help With Cash?

Don't worry, I will greatly appreciate if you can spread the word and let it known to others. You can use the share features on this page to let others know about this campaign. Do receive my thanks in advance.
