story:
How you can contribute to a powerful and audacious domino effect for good in the world!

For years I worked with my life coaching clients and workshop participants to teach them how to manifest the life of their dreams. I dreamed of running a retreat center focused on creativity, personal development, spirituality and physical well-being. Then in an instant of astounding clarity my vision changed.

I realized that I was meant to contribute to the creation of new community in the world. So I started my own community and one of the first projects to launch from this effort is a book on how to create cohesive intentional communities called Collective Manifestation: Heart-Centered Blueprints for Creating Intentional Community. Communities are being created in social media and through blogs, in chat rooms and through online programs, in virtual games, via non-profit events, and at physical locations around the globe.

I don't believe we are here to be super-consumers; we are here to be powerful creators!

We are here to create the new processes, structures and solutions that will move us into a bright, inventive and exciting future. What I've experienced is that we best expand our talents, gifts and life work by playing within groups or communities that support and inspire us. I think of it like this: one person doing something remarkable generates the ripple effect of small sail boat. Ten people coming together with intention generates the force of a ship. A thousand people generate an immense tidal wave of energy that affects the collective positively.

The potential in each of us that hasn't even begun to be tapped yet. If you are like me, you feel feel like you've been acting alone for too long and want to experience the power of connecting your brilliance to something really dynamic.

You may be ready to lead or belong to a community if you:

  • Long to connect to others in a more meaningful way around spirituality.
  • Love to cook, paint, or chant (you name it) and you've wondered what your options are for bringing others together to expand this talent.
  • Want to help make a difference through specific ecological lifestyle choices but don't want to go it alone in starting an initiative or project.
  • Are feeling the political activist in you emerging and know it's time to join with others around your passion.
  • Keep thinking something needs to be done about creating a more equitable economy and you'd love to lead innovation in this area.
  • Believe that communities of artists can change the world for the better.
  • Envision what a healing group could accomplish.
  • Have wanted to start a group around parenting kids with ADHD or learning disabilities and don't know where to start.
  • Want to start an animal sanctuary but it feels like too much for one person.
  • Believe that travel is the ideal way to a happier planet!

Truly, heart-centered community creation will reshape the world as we know it. I keep connecting to people who long to live values of wholeness and connection, healing and creative passion, sustainability and respect for all living beings. This a great time to reinvent what community is and how it operates.

So, I have taken everything I know about the law of attraction and manifestation and stepped it up!

What this book is about:

Collective Manifestation is about what is possible when you let go of societal limits associated with gender, age and roles and become conscious of what wants to show up through your authentic brilliance.

This book includes:

  • Practical exercises for creating a cohesive and effective community. Includes  identifying core values and member needs, learning how to use clear intention to create favorable outcomes, and how to facilitate each person being heard and choosing the role they play within community.

  • Discussion around how to address the particular issues of our time like, "How do we work in permission with nature instead of dominating it?" and "What "currency" systems can we create for healthier systems of exchange?
  • Stories about the fascinating and experimental things people are doing in their own areas of passion.
  • Creative energy processes that enable groups to access their collective intuitive genius.
Collective Manifestation comes from my vision of joyfully engaged individuals stepping into their unlimited potential each day creating, innovating and being of service.

One group and one community at a time we can create a true global community as we connect authentically to each other, our heart intentions, and our living Earth. I hope you will be part of my community effort to get this book out into the world.

What's Needed


I need a community of funding angels to help me raise $5000 to get this book published. 

I'm putting this request out into a world I believe in. It's a humbling and hopeful ask. It's a scary and exhilarating possibility. If the message of this book resonates, I hope you'll respond with your heartfelt participation. It all matters greatly.

The book has been written and luckily, I have the marketing savvy to launch the book. I need to manifest your help so that I can reach the people who will be inspired by this message, and who will then use the book guidelines to create their own unique community that leads our world into more joy, freedom, peace and plenty for all.

Funds will go toward:

  • Exterior Book Cover design: $400
  • Interior book design: $700
  • Editing $1,200
  • Copy editing: $912
  • Fee to convert to ebook reader $79
  • Fee for Library of Congress number $49
  • Website for book launch $650
  • Copies of book for launch and speaking engagements: $550
  • Fee to post galleys of the book to a book reviewer network: $399
  • Miscellaneous marketing fees (book award entry fees, crowdfunding fee, etc.)

Pssst: If I reach my goal, I pay less to Indiegogo!

What Contributor Perks You Get:

  • $10 You Matter level: You are helping to build energy for a more loving, fun and creative world!
  • $25 Partner in Change level: Beyond receiving my heart-is-full gratitude for this wonderful donation, your name will be listed in the acknowledgements section of the book launch website and you'll receive a Collective Manifestation ebook. 
  • $50 Making It Happen level. You'll be gifted with great gratitude, your name will be listed in the acknowledgements section of the book and website, and you'll receive a paperback copy of Collective Manifestation. You indeed make good things happen in this world.
  • $100 Super Hero level. Beyond receiving my heart overflowing with gratitude, and acknowledgement in the book and website, you’ll receive an autographed copy of the book before the launch date (or a kindle version of the book and a postcard thank you from me).
  • $250 Loving Angel level.You receive all the perks mentioned above and a 11x14 framed print of original art.
  • $500 Shinning Star level. You receive all the perks mentioned and a piece of original heart art. A few examples below.

      

    All money raised here will go to this project, whether or not I raise my goal amount. All monies raised in excess of my goal amount will go toward publishing the second book in the Collective Manifestation series.
Who you are:

  • An innovator or super creative who knows that supporting others' best efforts benefits everyone.
  • A caring person who feels overwhelmed about trying to effect change all on your own and who wants to be part of a meaningful project
  • A trendsetter who likes to be on the leading edge of new ideas
  • A nonconformist feeling grouchy and rebellious about the state of the world
  • An optimist excited by what humans are still capable of
  • A leader who knows now is the time for everyone to experience their true capabilities!
 This is an opportunity to connect your energy to something you believe in and to affirm your belief that the world can change for the better through people power.


Who I am:

An intuitive creative, life coach, author, speaker and artist. I have dedicated my life to exploring consciousness, creativity, the meaning in all experience, and supporting people worldwide in their life journeys. An avid student of life, my life path has encompassed a career in public relations, the creation of an essential oil face and body product line, and expertise in the law of attraction and intuitive dream boards. You can find out more about me at: http://www.melissawadsworth.com/about-melissa

story:
Short Summary

Hello Everyone! I'm Mallory and I live in the very sunny state, Florida. I'm 14 and for as long as I can remember, I have always loved to write! Now, just recently, I have written a self help book manuscript exclusively for girls. But now, I hope that I can turn my manuscript into a book in print. With your contribution, I will be able to self publish my script into a book through a very reliable self book publishing company called AuthorHouse. Want to know more about my book? Well, I'll give you some information: My self help book manuscript is fully packed with advice on all sorts of different topics. How to deal with drama. How to deal with bullies, and how to deal with fitting in with different situations and people. And that is not just it. There are so many more topics that I have included in my book. I am hoping to reach readers from all over the country and maybe even further!     

What We Need & What You Get

There are many different packages of self publishing to choose from Author House. But my main goal for publishing is $1,000 or maybe more. With a simple donation of $5, I will give you updates to keep you in the loop about my book. If and when my book is published, I will give you details on how to order it. You will basically get to be the first to know about the progression of my self help book. Also, if I decide to have a radio station, I will consider you to be a guest speaker and more. If I can, I will try to give my contributors a signed copy of my book, too.  

The Impact

I really appreciate all donations. The impact will be very great not only for my efforts but for girls of all ages. Teen and tween girls will finally be able to rely on great advice. There are many things that girls are going through today. Sibling rivalry. Bad break ups, bad fights with parents, and just plain,  bad stress. Jealousy. Some girls are teased. Some girls may be feeling shy. The reason I even wrote this book was because I know I was having some stress, too. So, I helped myself by writing! There is a lot of power in words, but you can keep someones writing forever! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Spread the word about my campaign! Tell everyone you know! I want to change a girl's life! Spread the word through the wide world of social media!

Hello Everyone! I'm Mallory and I live in the very sunny state, Florida. I'm 14 and for as long as I can remember, I have always loved to write! Now, just recently, I have written a self help book manuscript exclusively for girls. But now, I hope that I can turn my manuscript into a book in print. With your contribution, I will be able to self publish my script into a book through a very reliable self book publishing company called AuthorHouse. Want to know more about my book? Well, I'll give you some information: My self help book manuscript is fully packed with advice on all sorts of different topics. How to deal with drama. How to deal with bullies, and how to deal with fitting in with different situations and people. And that is not just it. There are so many more topics that I have included in my book. I am hoping to reach readers from all over the country and maybe even further!     


What We Need & What You Get
There are many different packages of self publishing to choose from Author House. But my main goal for publishing is $1,000 or maybe more. With a simple donation of $5, I will give you updates to keep you in the loop about my book. If and when my book is published, I will give you details on how to order it. You will basically get to be the first to know about the progression of my self help book. Also, if I decide to have a radio station, I will consider you to be a guest speaker and more. If I can, I will try to give my contributors a signed copy of my book, too.  


The Impact
I really appreciate all donations. The impact will be very great not only for my efforts but for girls of all ages. Teen and tween girls will finally be able to rely on great advice. There are many things that girls are going through today. Sibling rivalry. Bad break ups, bad fights with parents, and just plain,  bad stress. Jealousy. Some girls are teased. Some girls may be feeling shy. The reason I even wrote this book was because I know I was having some stress, too. So, I helped myself by writing! There is a lot of power in words, but you can keep someones writing forever! 


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
Spread the word about my campaign! Tell everyone you know! I want to change a girl's life! Spread the word through the wide world of social media!

story:
Crack the Spine Literary Magazine was founded and is nurtured by the loving hands of people obsessed with the written word. We steal out of bed to snuggle with illicit poetry while our loved ones are sleeping. We skip happy hour to guzzle gallons of short stories instead. Flash fiction regularly punches us square in our collective face and we smile through broken teeth, already hungry for more.

Since 2011, we have published hundreds of authors' poetry and prose in our digital magazine. We've also published and distributed five stunning (if we do say so, ourselves) print anthologies. We’ve discovered some new, raw talent and placed their work alongside that of seasoned professionals. We are inspired and humbled by the level of interest in our publications.

But now we need your help to keep going!

  • If you look forward to our weekly digital magazine…
  • If you have been inspired by one of our stories or touched by a poem…
  • If you’ve found kinship and valuable conversation with other readers…
  • If you had work featured in our publications and felt grateful for the opportunity…
  • If you want us to keep our commitment to always select madness over method…

Please give whatever you can!

The phrase “labor of love” takes on a new meaning at Crack the Spine, as no one involved in the production of digital or print publications is receiving financial compensation! We’re investing massive amounts of our time and energy to contribute to the literary community as a whole and we hope we can count on our loyal readers to help us out as we move forward.

Our financial goal is simple… a thousand bucks. This will allow us to cover operating expenses (website hosting, anthology printing, digital and print issue promotions, etc) and continue producing a quality product that we hope brings value to our contributors and readers.

Our artistic goal is more complicated… we plan to never stop looking for new ways to grow, expand and spread the word about the talented writers and artists who are kind enough to share their work with us.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Timothy Bowden, indie author, history fanatic and zombie geek. My second novel - Freaks and Greeks - is ready to be distributed, but it needs your help! As an independent author, I don't have the resources of a huge publishing house behind me, so I need some cash to build a website and order a print-run of my book to put in book stores and sell to the public. The book is ready to go (edited, designed, printed), it's just waiting to head out into the wide world. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $3000 AUD to order a large print-run for a bunch of copies of the book, as well as to build a website to be able to connect with cool people like you. Your contribution will:

* enable me to order a large print-run of the book. Once the campaign is over, there will be no production or wait time. If your pledge includes a copy of the book, you will receive yours in excellent time.

* build a kick-arse website to connect with zombie/history enthusiasts around the world. A website will enable me to sell copies of my book as well as communicate with indie book fans. Yay!

The Impact

Your contribution would mean a lot to me. It would help support an independent author, and an independent publishing house.

Your support will not only help me order copies of my book, but it will support a grass-roots publishing enterprise as it makes it's mark against the book conglomerates. In this age of e-books, there is something magical about holding an actual printed book in your hand. Call me old-fashioned, but nothing excites me more than plucking a book off a shelf in a little neighbourhood book shop and leafing through it's wondrous pages.  

Risks & Challenges

Seriously, there are no risks or challenges. With the funds I raise, I will order as many copies of the book as I possibly can. You will get yours (if you pledge for one) and I can build my website! Once the books are shipped, the only potential challenge is out of my hands (and in the hands of the postal service!).  

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have any spare cash (I know how you feel)? That's ok! You could give this campaign a huge push by:

  • spreading the word about this campaign and the novel Freaks and Greeks
  • sharing the campaign on social media (Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, Snapchat).

To our international friends, we're so sorry we can't ship signed or personalised copies of the book overseas for the purposes of this campaign, BUT you have the option of ordering an unsigned copy or an eBook now. Once the campaign has concluded, the book will be available on Amazon and other fantastic sites offering international postage. Yay! 

Thank you.

story:
Promoting Tolerance & the Creative Spirit in a Polarized World

Tiferet means “heart, compassion, and a reconciliation of opposites.” Today more than ever, seeming opposites must learn to come together. White and black, Jew and Muslim, conservative and liberal… Somehow, we need to find a creative solution to work together.

Tiferet aims to let people speak their individual journeys…

Through a quarterly literary journal, monthly radio interviews, and global community of writers inspired to create, exchange, and grow.

Our community and projects are also growing, and we have so much more we want to do. Our goal is to raise $10,000 by February 19, to help us launch another vibrant year of publishing, interviewing, community-building, and more.

Your contribution can help.

Your donation now will also help us continue to publish Tiferet Journal, offering work by some of today’s best writers and artists—poetry, prose, and art that further meaningful dialogue about what it is to be humane and conscious in today’s often divisive world. The journal is published in a beautifully designed format both in print and digitally, to open hearts and nurture the creative spirit.

Your donation supports our broadcasts of Tiferet Talks, hosted by Melissa Studdard and Donna Baier Stein, conversations with authors such as former Poet Laureate Robert Pinsky; Buddhist meditation teacher Susan Piver; best-selling authors like Caroline Leavitt, Dan Millman, Julia Cameron; poet Jane Hirshfield. You can listen to archives of these wonderful interviews on our website. [Link: http://tiferetjournal.com]

We hope Tiferet will inspire you to write, connect you to a global community of people who believe in tolerance, and foster peace in you and in the world. Please support us generously and join in the community of heart, compassion, and the reconciliation of opposites that is Tiferet!

story:
Each year, PlayGround publishes the best scripts from hundreds received over the course of a season. As we are about to embark on our 21st season, we are proud to publish Best of the Best of PlayGround, a new anthology containing six of the VERY BEST PLAYS we have presented over the years.

From nearly 700 plays by 200 Bay Area playwrights developed over the past twenty years, 24 semi-finalist scripts were submitted to an all-star panel that included Pulitzer Prize winner Bruce Norris, PlayGround co-founder Brighde Mullins and Steinberg Award winner and PlayGround alumnus Peter Sinn Nachtrieb. The final six they selected will be presented at a gala event inaugurating PlayGround’s 21st season on September 15th, 2014, at Berkeley Rep, our home since 2003. These six plays will comprise this new anthology.

CONTENTS
These short works have previously only be available in individual yearly collections, but now you can have the Best of the Best of PlayGround in one convenient collection. The plays are:

Panopticon by Aaron Loeb (2008) 
Rapunzel's Etymology of Zero by Katie May (2011) 
Net by Geetha Reddy (2009) 
Hella Love Oakland by Robin Lynn Rodriguez (2012) 
Truffaldino Says No by Ken Slattery (2009) 
My Name Is Yin by Tom Swift (2004)

HOW YOU CAN HELP
Help us publish this exciting collection of remarkable short plays by pre-ordering copies that will be available in mid-September. Each of the plays was written by an Emerging Playwright Award winner and had its world premiere production in one of the annual Best of PlayGround festivals. Some have gone on to further acclaim in other cities and countries.

Like the 16 other collections previously published by PlayGround Publications, this anthology

  • celebrates the very best writing by talented new playwrights
  • provides an economical way to bring scripts to the attention of producers and educators
  • provides students and new dramatists with models of plays that have proven popular with audiences.
  • demonstrates the enormous flexibility and potential of the short play form

WHO WE ARE
Since 1994, PlayGround has supported 200 local playwrights in the development and staging of nearly 700 original short plays and 50 new full-length plays, including more than a dozen that have since premiered in the Bay Area.

PlayGround’s alumni have gone on to win local, national, and international honors for their short and full-length work, including recognition at the Humana Festival, Sundance Festival, Source Festival, Bay Area Playwrights Festival, Aurora Theatre's Global Age Project, Internationalists Playwriting Prize, and New York International Fringe Festival, among others.

Their works have been premiered at numerous theatres throughout the Bay Area, including: A.C.T. Costume Shop, Shotgun Players, Impact Theatre, Theatre Rhinoceros, San Jose Stage Company, Just Theater, and San Francisco Playhouse.

Proceeds of this campaign will be used to:

  • print the Best of the Best of PlayGround (1994-2014) anthology
  • acquire ISBN numbers (yes, they cost money)
  • market the anthology to producers, educators, and drama students.
  • pay author royalties
  • develop and distribute an electronic version of the book

For more information, visit http://playground-sf.org.

PlayGround Publications is a fiscally-sponsored project of PlayGround (Federal ID 94-3336399).

story:
Congratulating Pause Suicide’s John Hesnan for being one of only three Finalists in Social Entrepreneurs Ireland’s The Impact Series (Inspiring Ideas to Change Ireland) Innovation in Health Minnovation Fund in Association with J.P. Morgan at Smock Alley Theatre, Dublin, Ireland on Wednesday September 3rd 2014.

Video:

Irish Executives Network IEN:

The Irish Executives Network I.E.N. was formed in June 2008 at a time when People & Businesses first realized the pressures being exerted on the Global economic climate.  As that pressure has increased, so too has IEN’s membership & activities.  Now connecting close to 23,000 Business People within Ireland & around the World, I.E.N. continues to respond to this pressure with a commitment to sharing ideas, insights, expertise, solutions & know how which exists amongst the Irish Diaspora at home & abroad.  The Irish Executives Network has endorsed the “Pause Suicide” campaign & recently published an interview with “Pause Suicide” Founder, John Hesnan.




"Pause Suicide" Founder / IndieGoGo Promoter...

John Hesnan:

John Hesnan is a Multiple National Award Winning patents granted Inventor and Entrepreneur from the West of Ireland who collaborates closely with numerous Government Agencies.


"Pause Suicide - Don’t Kill Yourself Today" is very close to His heart as 40 years ago John survived His suicide attempt.  John was 20 years old and did not expect Anyone to rescue him from the bridge of a fast flowing deep river.  But he was saved and is thankful for the intervention of a complete stranger who dragged him off of the bridge at 3 o’clock in the morning.

John has gone on to achieve a lot in his life since that night.  For many years John was Project Manager for an American Technology Corporation’s European manufacturing headquarters based in Ireland Managing a Technical Team and providing Technical Support to Computer sites around the World.  At its peak the Corporation had 126,000 Employees.

John was a Computer Maintenance / Training Engineer for a Royal Naval Force and based in a top secret underground Command Centre in a desert in The Middle East.

John’s Inventions have seen him appear several times on National Television including RTÉ’s The Late Late Show, RTÉ’s Nationwide and TG4.

Some of John Hesnan’s Awards:
  • Young Scientist of the Year Award Winner as a teenager
  • Spirit of Entrepreneurship Award Winner
  • Galway Mayoral Enterprise Award Winner
  • Best in Business Regional Award Winner

John’s other passions are art, healing pain, writing, engineering and music for which He has several patented Inventions being used daily by People around the World such as MusiCalc® and MusiCan®.  John is Married with two grown up Children.

Perks Infographic:




    Risks and Challenges:
    There are risks and challenges in all ventures.  John already has a successful track record in project and product development and His personal suicide survival skills are second to none.  The benefits to society far outweigh any possible risks.

    Other Ways You Can Help:
    If you cannot contribute, then please spread the message.  Use all Your Social Media networking skills and sharing tools to tell Your Friends and Family. Do not let another Life be taken by despair.  Help people in despair to pause the final fatal act of suicide and help them to recover and build fulfilling lives.

story:
We make literature come alive! It's all about the excitement of discovery and the pleasure of reading. The AUTHOR'S CORNER on Public Radio, to date with 400 authors reading select passages from their new books, is aired on stations from Texas to Alaska. Listeners annually hear from scores of books they'd otherwise not encounter! TAC is "many voices, many views, changing daily."

But TAC needs $1,000 seed money now to continue production. This amount will qualify us, by contract with our Fiscal Sponsor*, to then pursue vital corporate and foundation funding formally -- in order to continue to exist. The only daily national platform for new authors, TAC is a radio show with the authentic voices of authors reading their literary work. We've featured 50% women authors by design and ten Pulitzer winners to date. You may recognize our authors, debut and otherwise: Jimmy Carter, Amy Poehler, Nigel Hamilton, Peter Cherches, Caroline Clarke....

Our leadership team is seasoned radio producer, Peter Johnson, formerly with WGBH-Boston, and public relations specialist, blogger and author, Susan Weinstein. Like you, we love new books and authors, and want them to flourish amidst the sea of sports, video games, and pop culture. But this project risks ending soon.

Help keep literary voices alive! A $50 donation or more gets you our highlights CD of 2-minute programs. Thank you for considering backing our mission to: encourage a love for reading, expose new books to new audiences, and create a contemporary audio archive! Stories and ideas contribute to an informed citizenry, necessary for a true democracy.... Yet producing this daily series entails expenses for equipment, time to identify and book authors, editing passages, traveling to recording sessions (usually conducted in-person), coaching, audio post-production, constant web site maintenance, marketing to stations, national distribution. The Author’s Corner is our registered federal trademark, our Fiscal Sponsor, “Fractured Atlas,” is a 501(c)3, and our site is www.authorscorner.org

* The Author's Corner is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of The Author's Corner must be made payable to "Fractured Atlas" only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
Escape into an insane world! Where anything seems possible and everything is not as it seems.  

Hi! My name is Husna Haze and I'am a fanatic over books. My love of story telling started when I was introduced to anime and it's many forms, before my tastes quickly matured or rather expanded into books.  I have always been a fan of the science fiction genre of dystopian themes that can arise from said future. I have always been drawn to great character development alongside hard hitting themes that make you think.

Vertigo is a five part book series that first came into conception almost six years ago back when I was a teenager...yikes! The first installment in the series is Honour Bound by Blood.  Come along on a journey that spans the Champion Imperial Empire stretching from Earth to the dome cities on Mars and Pluto. Imperial moon base stronghold home of the Emperor and his personal fleet. With the Solar System under the banner of the reigning Champion regime.  2095, is turning out to be a complicated year for the inhabitants to navigate with the Resistance and Purple Hand turning the System into a war zone.

The Sequence Begins:

With Honour Bound by Blood - jump into a web of death, betrayal, and deceit. A high fantasy, dystopian, epic tale that tackles the question is it all black and white, good or bad or is there a grey area in all this?   

What is Vertigo? 

Without giving away too many spoilers Vertigo is a story that explores power and the human condition as it relates to drive and moral. It dives into the concepts of love and selfishness of lies and loss. The series concentrates on world building a society of classism, patriotism, corporation control and greed.

Follow the main characters as they navigate their lives never having to worry about freedom, money, safety and opportunity. Become acquainted with their lavish lifestyle and watch as they embark on a journey that will have them questioning everything and nothing.  Step into a world unlike your own with characters that explore whether power corrupts absolutely or if it attracts the worst and corrupts the best.       

What We Need & What You Get

To ensure that the manuscript is:

  • Copy edited £1,500
  • Professionally proof read £1,242
  • Formatted for print and digital consummations £600
  • Website £300
  • Line edited  £2,000 

Approximately £5,342 to pay for these professional services to deliver this 500 page book.

The Impact

I wrote book 1 in the sequence with two goals really:

1. To bring a plethora of characters to the reader that they can relate to in some way shape or form.

2. To make it as epic as possible in scale and in story. I wanted people to get lost in this this word to picture it vividly to imagine it as I have or interpret it as they wish.

I feel as though I have been working on this project for a long time, and I feel as though not many indie authors get the opportunity to traditionally published. I embarked on this route because I wanted to show people that you can retain ownership of your work and be ethically artistic to yourself and your body of work. Without having to cut corners or sacrifice your dream to fit the proverbial box to sell copies or to make it marketable to the main stream. I wanted to build a community of people who love to get lost in fantasy, who enjoy an epic read.

Risks & Challenges

Some risks and challenges are that people may not like the book, Or you may hate the characters you may feel the pacing is trash or you may find some other problematic issues in it. But that's okay! And honesty is what I want from readers because it will help me fix or change the trajectory of the following four books. 

Due to this being being self-published some challenges an indie author faces are not having editors, book formatting for kindle and paperback. Traditionally published authors have this provided in house by an agency. However, indie authors have to professionally find and pay industry rates for these services.  

COVID-19: Is a risk to getting the book printed and distributed in a timely fashion. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about Vertigo Book 1 campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Donate!
  • Follow Vertigobookseries on Instagram for the latest news!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Story of My Book

Get With The Program discusses why computer science education opportunities need to be available in every school and the difficulties that come about when trying to get these classes into the classroom.

My name is Mary and I am the author of Get With The Program. I wrote this book because schools across the nation are in a dire need for computer science education opportunities from qualified teachers.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the importance and the power of providing computer science education at all stages of learning. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for computer science education in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you integrate more computer science opportunities within your community.

In this book, you'll learn about diversity in the technology space and it's relation with education and the struggle of attaining teachers for computer science:
  • The technology field severely lacks diversity which means that implicit biases are being coded into technologies we use every day.
  • Teachers looking to teach advanced computer science courses must pass a licensing exam which has been compared to taking 3-4 college computer science courses, making it difficult for teachers to earn.
  • Computer science education relies heavily on funding, meaning that computer science education opportunities are primarily in wealthy areas that can afford licensed teachers and the computers needed for the course, thus continuing the lack of diversity in the technology field.

You will love this book if you have any interest in technology, education, or both.

Get With The Program is a non-fiction book that speaks to education professionals and parents who are looking at computer science opportunities in their own schools and communities for the first time.

The Book - Get With The Program

The book is written in 4 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-3. Part 1 dives into the issues behind computer science education and what makes this subject so difficult to bring into the classroom. In these chapters I will talk about accessibility to computer science education and how it correlates with educational equity and the achievement gap. Furthermore, we will go over what a technology course is about and how it is currently being misunderstood.

Part 2 contains Chapters 4 - 6. In this part, we will discuss the role of teachers in the technology space. Teaching computer science is not an easy feat, especially when the subject matter changes every 5 - 10 years considering the speed modern technology is changing. This part focuses on bringing teachers into the computer science space to give our students the best computer science experience.

Part 3 contains Chapters 7 - 9. These chapters will talk specifically on how to implement computer science education into schools. Whether that be introducing a new course or integrating computer science skills into a math lesson, computer science education can (and should) fit into the daily curriculum of all students.

Part 4 contains Chapters 10 - 11. The final chapters in the book will be my suggestions on possible solutions to bringing about more computer science opportunities and making it more accessible for all communities. Additionally, I will talk about the power of technology and where I see the field going.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Audiobook)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this spring

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will donate the additional profits to fund scholarships for teacher workshops in support of expanding computer science education.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Mary Newby is an IT Design Analyst for Harley-Davidson, as well as the President of her Alma Mater’s Young Alumni Association and a teacher’s assistant for a Introduction to Computer Science class at a local high school.

Mary has been volunteering for local schools as a teacher’s assistant for computer science classes for two years now. Without the help of herself and volunteers like her, many schools in her area would not have a computer science program. She loves her technology career and wants more young people exposed to the opportunities, growth, and creativity that accompany a job in the field. Unfortunately, many schools do not have a comprehensive computer science program, leaving many students without the chance to explore the subject. Mary is looking for answers as to why computer science education opportunities are so scarce when technology is everywhere!

In her very little free time, Mary spends most of it at home with her cats (cat lady alert!), either reading, cooking, or crafting. She is the fourth of five girls in her family who all reside in the Midwest and is the proud aunt of 6 nieces and nephews, who she hopes will positively benefit from the work she is doing promoting computer science education.

For more information you can connect with Mary at marycnewby@gmail.com and on LinkedIn.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #GWTP and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Mary Newby

story:
My name is Omar Napier and I have been a Pastor and a Counselor in the city of Los Angeles for the past 10 years. Over the years I have realized that we are all dealing with some type debris whether that is the debris of physical sickness or financial difficulty, or the debris that affected me personally, which was the wounds I suffered from being abandoned by my parents.  I discovered through my own situation and years of counseling others that no matter what your debris is, you can recover and rebuild your life.

I wrote the book "Standing in the Debris...Rebuilding Your Life Through The Damages" to empower others by giving them the tools they need to recover and rebuild their lives.​
We are asking for $15,000.00 to cover the associated publishing costs.
 
Your Campaign contributions will cover :
  • Editing, Illustration, Layout, Formatting and Conversion costs
  • Book Cover Design costs
  • Binding Costs 
  • ISBN Costs
  • Print Run Costs (Quantity 2000)
By contributing you can indirectly affect the lives of others who may have lost hope or who have been shattered by the pain of their past. 
 

Perks for your support include:

  • Your own autographed copy of Standing in the Debris
  • Choose 1 of  4 t-shirts listing some powerful quotes from the book
  • Have your name listed on the book's website contribution page
  • Be a Special Guest at the Hollywood book signing
  • Be a Co-Publisher with your name listed in the front of the book

Again, your support will let others know that they are not alone and that they can recover no matter what type of debris they are standing in.  

And even if you can't contribute financially, you can still help by spreading the word or by sharing this link on Facebook and other types of social media. 

I would sincerely like to thank you for taking the time to view this campaign.
